loans.name: Guadalupe Rolando

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Guadalupe Rolando D. H. le está haciendo falta el vitropiso pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder llevar acaba la mejora. 
  Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poner lo más pronto posible el vitropiso ya que su esposa la señora   Fidencia García está pronto D. tener a su hijo y quiere que tenga un buen hogar donD. vivir.
  La persona que nos atendió cuando se realizo la visita a la casa del señor Guadalupe fue la señora Fidencia quien aparece en la foto.
texts.en:
Guadalupe Rolando D. H.' home doesn't have flooring, but at the moment he doesn't have the necessary funds to make the improvements. It's for this reason he is requesting a loan to put in a tile floor as soon as possible because his wife, Fidencia Garcia, will soon give birth to a son and he wants to proviD. him with a good home. The person who met us when we maD. our visit to Guadalupe's home was Fidencia, so she is the one in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put in tile flooring throughout his home

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.es: Elisabeth tiene 28 años, vive en casa de sus padres, con ellos y su bebé recién nacido.	Edad, estado civil, miembros de su familia. Desde hace un año se dedica a la  venta de comida al paso que son las salchipapas (salchichas y papas fritas) y sándwich en una esquina cerca de su casa en horas de la tarde. Por las mañanas va al mercado a comprar los ingredientes frescos y prepararlos para la tarde, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hermanas en este proyecto pues su meta es acrecentar sus ventas obteniendo más clientes, hasta el momento Elisabeth está en camino de concretar su anhelo ya que cada día su clientela va creciendo. Es la primera vez que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y está muy agradecida por haber sido invitada a formar parte de su banco comunal, donde se compromete a realizar un trabajo unido con las demás integrantes. El dinero que requiere lo usará en la compra de bancas y toldos para implementaran mejor el espacio de su negocio.
texts.en:
Elisabeth, 28, lives with her newborn baby and her parents in her parents’ house. For one year she has been selling street-food called “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes) and sandwiches. She sells on a corner near her house in the afternoon. In the mornings, she goes to market to buy fresh ingredients and prepares the food for the afternoons. He sisters help her. Her goal is to increase sales and get more customers. Elisabeth is on her way to making her goal a reality. Every day she has more customers. This is the first time she has asked MFP for a loan. She is very grateful to have been invited to be part of her community bank. She promises to work in a united way with the members. She will buy benches and awnings to improve her business space.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy benches and awnings for her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 43 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su propia casa. Desde hace 2 años vende comida al paso por las tardes en una calle principal cercana a su domicilio, todos los días sale a vender y en ocasiones le ayudan sus hijos mayores para transportar su carrito de ventas. Por las mañanas va al mercado a realizar las compras, principalmente de las carnes, que es necesario que estén frescas, este trabajo para Maria es rentable porque su platillos son del gusto de las personas y por el precio cómodo son muy demandados. Ahora, Maria quiere implementara un negocio de comidas precocidas por las mañanas en un puesto del mercado, ya que su deseo a futuro es tener una pollería (restaurante donde se vende pollo a la brasa), en años anteriores su experiencia de trabajo dependiente, le enseñó a administrar este tipo de negocios, por lo que está ahorrando para su inversión. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está deseosa de cumplir un trabajo responsable dentro del banco comunal donde está integrada. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio de venta de comida por las mañanas, de productos precocidos, como hamburguesas.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old, she lives with her 3 children in her own home. For two years she has sold food in the afternoons on a main street near her house. Every day she goes out to sell and sometimes her older children help to move her cart. In the morning she goes to the market to buy supplies, primarily for meat, which must be fresh. This work is profitable for Maria because her dishes are well-liked and popular because of the low price she charges.

Now, Maria wants to start a business selling precooked foods in the mornings at a stall in the market. In the future she hopes to have a chicken restaurant (where she would sell pollo a la brasa, a Peruvian dish). Her work experience in past years has taught her how to run a business, and she is now saving money to invest.

This is her first loan from MFP, and she wants to do a good job in the communal bank that she is a member of. The money requested will be invested in purchasing merchandise for her food stall, including precooked foods such as hamburgers.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase supplies

loans.name: Misael

texts.es:
Al señor Misael L. tiene poco que adquirió su vivienda pero le está haciendo falta un cuarto mas para sus hijos quienes están ya creciendo y necesitan su propio espacio en la casa. 
   Por tal motivo decidió construir un cuarto más en la parte de atrás de la vivienda pero no tiene el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagar la mano de obra. Nos está nueva mente solicitando un préstamo para llevar acabo la construcción de la recamara de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Misael L. recently acquired his house, but still needs one more room for his children, who are growing and need their own space in their home.

For this reason, he has decided to build an addition on the back part of the house, but does not have the money necessary to purchase materials and pay workers. He has requested a loan to enable him to construct a room for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room on the first floor of his home

loans.name: Heab

texts.en: Heab B., 31, lives with his wife in the Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He is a construction foreman and is able to make US$10 every day, while his wife Sim Sameth, 34, is a garment factory worker and makes US$2 per day. This couple has two young children. Heab B. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase construction materials.

loans.use: Construction materials.

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Morm C. is 40 years old and resides in the Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has two children and has a business selling meat balls in the market near her house. On average, she is able to make US$3 of profit every day. Her husband is a wedding chef and makes US$2 per day. Morm C. is asking for a loan of US$200 to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Reinvest in her business.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Tam S., 58, (pictured with her daughter) is a widow and resides with her two children in the Kampong Cham province. She sells grocery items and is able to make US$5 every day. Tam S. needs a loan to expand her business. She will use this loan to purchase more grocery items to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: Add grocery inventory

loans.name: Ou's Group

texts.en:
This small loan group is made up of three people who live in Phnom Penh City. The leader, Mrs. P., is 40 years old and married with three single children. Two of her children are employed, while the other one still attends school. P. currently teaches the pupils in the local primary school. Her husband helps feed the family with food by working as a crop cultivator. Since it is the crop growing season, P. is looking for capital in order to support the farming business.

The two other borrowers are S., 43, who is a fruit seller seeking a loan to order corn to sell, and S. who sells corn in the local market and requests a loan to increase the quantity of corn to continue selling.

loans.use: To support the farming business

loans.name: Sean

texts.en: Sean N. is 56 years old and resides in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband (pictured at home) are vegetable sellers; together they make US$ 9 per day. This income is less than their daily expense, so Sean would like to take a loan to invest in another business. She will use her loan to purchase rubber, which she will sell for additional income.

loans.use: To purchase rubber to sell.

loans.name: Oum

texts.en: Oum S. is 43 years old and resides in the Kampong Cham province. Since 2006, she has been selling fish in the market and makes US$15 in revenue per day. Her husband is a taxi driver. On average, he makes US$10 to US$20 in revenue a day. This couple has three children, two of whom are students. Mrs. Oum would like to take out a loan to replace an old taxi for her husband. The old one needs many repairs and uses a lot of gas.

loans.use: To replace her husband's old taxi.

loans.name: Oum

texts.en:
Oum S., 36, sells gas to earn a living with her husband. On average, she is able to make about US$5 combined per day. Besides selling gas, her husband, pictured here, also recharges batteries, making typically US$10 in revenue every day. This couple has one daughter, who is a student.
Oum S. needs a loan to replace an old generator for her husband to recharge more batteries.

loans.use: To replace an old generator.

loans.name: Nhim's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan made up of three people, all residents of the city of Phnom Penh. Mrs. S., 49, has been selected to be the leader by the group members. Mrs. S. currently sells poultry that she buys from the people who live in the rural area. She keeps stocks in her home and resells to gain revenue with her husband, who assists her in the business actions. The family have four children. Three are working in different jobs and one is still studying. The family's business of selling poultry is a profitable one and due to the lack of capital, Mrs. S. is applying for a loan on Kiva to buy chickens and ducks to sell. The other two borrowers are:
N., 34, who is a rice farmer looking for a loan to purchase piglets to raise.
Y., 54, sells fresh fish in the market and requests a loan to buy fish tools for her husband's fishing.

loans.use: To buy chickens and ducks to sell

loans.name: Tes

texts.en: Tes T., 46, is married and resides with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. To earn a living, she sells mangoes and typically makes US$4 of profit per day. Her husband is a taxi driver and earns US$3 per day. Mrs. Tes T. would like to take out a loan to purchase mangoes from growers to sell at the market.

loans.use: Buy mangoes to sell

loans.name: Khuon

texts.en: Khuon K. is a widow with two children,  a daughter and a son, and she lives in the Kampong Cham province. She sells rice noodles and makes US$3.5 of profit per day. Her daughter is already married and has one child. Her son-in-law is a taxi driver and typically makes US$7 per day. Khuon K. is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her younger son so that he can run a moto-taxi business to have an additional income to help raise the family. (Khuon is pictured with her daughter and granddaughter from home)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Agapito

texts.en:
Mr. Agapito P. maintains two hectares of farmland in his village. He needs additional working capital to proceed with manual planting of corn and rice crops. Agapito is a 50-year old man, married to Elena. They are blessed with one child, Agiecel, who is 31-years old and a college graduate. Despite his degree, Agiecel is helping his father on their family farm due to a lack of job opportunities in the area. They presently reside in Barangay San Isidro Quirino, Isabela, which is a small rural village in the northern part of Quirino, Isabela.

Agapito is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to sustain his farming business and to make it grow. He will be purchasing fertilizers, pesticides, diesel and seeds which are the major requirements to sustain his farming. He is hoping to have a good harvest to be able to earn more profit. “Giving my family what they need is my responsibility,” says Agapito. This belief serves as his motivation as he struggles with the many challenges of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farming supplies

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is a 25-year old farmer in the small village of San Isidro Quirino, Isabela. He is married to Rosalyn, who is 28 years old. They are blessed with two children. The eldest is Rose-Ann and the youngest is Christine Joy. Alfredo wishes for nothing except to see his family happy and content in life. He also hopes to give his children a priceless gift: to be able to send them to school to gain a good education and to finish college.

Alfredo maintains less than a hectare of rice farmland which he cultivates as the source of income for their family. He just started farming five years ago when he got his own farm from his parents. But he needs funds in order to sustain his farming business. He is hoping for a loan amounting to PHP16,000.00 for his farming needs. He plans to purchase three bags of fertilizer, one bag of seed variety for rice and diesel for the hand tractor used in cultivation. He will also pay laborers who will help him with the rice planting.

His dream is to increase his profit in rice production and have savings for the future schooling of his children. If given the chance, he would also like to have a livestock business. He believes that in God, anything is possible. God is in his heart, that’s why he knows that his dreams will come true in the future. He always seeks God’s guidance, forgiveness and support with his life’s responsibilities.

loans.use: Farming needs

loans.name: Charity Faith

texts.en:
Charity Faith manages a hog raising business which is her only source of income for sustaining her family. According to her, “Life is like a wheel, sometimes we are on top and sometimes we are at the bottom.” She strongly believes in these words, and is committed to hard work and patience in order to get to the top of the wheel. She is a woman of courage and when she encounters difficulties in life, she takes it as a challenge and strives for the best solution. She aims to give her two children the best education possible since she knows that it is the best treasure that she can give them. Charity is the wife of Velmor T.. They live in a rural area in Barangay Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya.

Charity is requesting a loan from ASKI of 8,000 PHP for the improvement of her hog raising business. She wants to buy additional piglets and feed for her pigs. She intends to make her pigs healthy in order to sell them at a higher price. She hopes that with the profit from her current business, she will be able to save and open a sari-sari store (a small village store). With additional income, she will be able to support her children’s education. She believes that she can improve her business with a loan from ASKI - MFI.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Crisanto

texts.en:
Crisanto E. is 31 years old and married to Teresita. They have been blessed with two children: Christ John, who is 12 and just graduated from elementary school, and Cristel Joy who is 4. Teresita is currently working abroad as an “Overseas Foreign Worker” trying to earn money for their family.

Crisanto and his wife are making the sacrifice of being away from each other just to earn more income in order to give their children a better future. He believes that there is nothing greater that he could give his children than education, and thus Crisanto strives hard to grow his farming business and make it more profitable.

Crisanto manages his farming business for his family. He availed of a loan last year and is now requesting another loan of PHP 15,000.00 in order to maintain and improve his farm. He paid off his last loan successfully, but is still in need of financial assistance for his farm. He is very thankful for being able to borrow from ASKI, Kiva's partner, since ASKI offers many benefits to its clients. He hopes that someday, his family will be able to improve its living condition. He works towards this through his perseverance in developing his farm and by sacrificing a lot for his family’s future welfare.

loans.use: addional capital to maintain and improve his farm

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga N. is 55 years old and is a resident of Barangay Quirino in Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She married after finishing her elementary education but, unfortunately, ended up separating due to family conflicts. Their three children live with her and she is sacrificing to earn a living for them. She works hard to satisfy their daily needs and to send them to school. She aims to have her children attend college.

Dominga is a walking vendor. She sells vegetables, fruits and some homemade snacks from house to house in her village. She also sells her products at the bus terminal since there are so many customers there. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 from ASKI, Kiva's partner. She will use the loan to buy a larger quantity of products in order to increase her daily income, which is just a minimum of PHP 100 daily. She aims to save money in hopes of improving her vending business for her children’s welfare.

loans.use: buy addtional products to sell

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.en:
A. Olimjon is 36 years old. Together with his wife, who works to help pay household expenses, he has three children. His goal for his children is to support them so that they may complete their studies, leading to professional careers.

Olimjon has worked as a farmer for the past 10 years. The greatest obstacle for him is pests. He began his work with his own efforts, and the help which IMON International, Kiva's partner, was able to offer led to better production. With this second loan Olimjon will invest in the purchase of fertilizers and high quality seeds to get a better harvest which he will be able to sell at a better market price. Let’s support this hard-working man so that he can attain his goals!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Yahyokhon

texts.en:
R. Yahyokhon was born in 1981. Married and a family man, he works in agriculture. The income he makes from selling agricultural products enables him to manage his household expenses. But today the profit from agriculture has decreased considerably and it is difficult for him to meet the needs of his family. To make his agricultural business more productive again, Yahyokhon is asking for a loan of $650 USD to buy seeds and fertilizer and thus increase the productive capacity of his land. This will improve the living conditions of his entire family.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Khairullo

texts.en:
R. Khairullo is a very happy and sociable 47-year-old man. He is happily married to a hard-working woman who has supported him in achieving all of his dreams. They have 3 children and they would have liked to have more. Khairullo’s family is one that loves working in agriculture. The whole family works together to harvest onions, tomatoes and corn. It has been 10 years since Khairullo began working the land he loves so much.

His wife sells the products in the local market. Khairullo also earns some extra income by transporting products for other farmers from the fields to the markets using his car. Khairullo is requesting a loan to acquire agricultural supplies that are necessary to maintain the crops. His dream is that his children will inherit the love to work the land that with great effort he and his wife acquired, and that some day their children will inherit that love as well.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Lham

texts.en:
Lham A. lives with her husband in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Lham is 61 years old and has retired with her husband. All her children have already grown up and live with their own families.

Since her retirement is not enough to cover her living expenses, she has started a small cafeteria/bar with the help of her children. She runs the small fast food cafeteria/bar in the town. It is quite common in Mongolia to have a small cafeteria and bar in the same place. During the mornings and afternoons the restaurant serves cafeteria style food and in the evenings it serves alcohol. Her restaurant/bar is located next to the town's sports center, and is usually full during sporting events.

She requests a loan to purchase ingredients and beverages for her cafeteria/bar business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and beverages for her cafeteria/bar business

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en:
Myagmarsuren S. is a widow and lives with her granddaughter in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her granddaughter is a freshman at the Eurasian University in Arhanghay.

Myagmarsuren has a small retail business selling dairy products. Since 1997, she has been selling dairy products in the local food market. She usually sells milk, curds, cheese, and cream. Since the start, her business capital has increased from 100,000 MNT ($1 USD=1,400 MNT) to 3,000,000 MNT. She usually purchases her products from herder families at wholesale prices and sells them from a stall that she rents in the local food market.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business by opening a wholesale shop for dairy products in the food market. She requests a loan to purchase more dairy products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en:
Uuganbayar D. lives with his wife and 3-year-old son in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Uuganbayar is 24 and married his wife three years ago. His wife is a big supporter of his business.

Uuganbayar has a small retail business selling secondhand car accessories. He started the business with his parents in early 1995 and the business was passed down to him after his marriage. He has plenty of experience with car accessories and fixes cars by request in his free time.

In the future, he would like to open a full-service car shop where he would be able to fix and diagnose cars. Uuganbayar requests a Kiva loan to buy more secondhand car accessories for his business.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand car accessories for his business.

loans.name: Mandah

texts.en:
Mandah H. is 48, married and the father of two. His family lives in a "ger" (traditional Mongolian tent) district on the plot of land he owns in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Since 1996, together with his spouse Tsesenjav, he has run a traditional shoe making business. He has many repeat customers from both the capital city and the countryside. He has lots of experienced and his shoes contain many beautiful traditional decorations. With the profit from his business, Mandah bought a vehicle so he could run a taxi service to earn extra income.

He recently got an order to make many traditional shoes, and requests a loan to buy raw materials. Mandah says, "I have many dreams, including to have my own little shoe factory. I'm saving for my daughter's future home when she gets married. I also want to continue to develop, and am learning computer skills from my son".

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for making shoes

loans.name: Myagmarhajid

texts.en:
Myagmarhajid Y. is 42, married and the mother of two. Her family has lived in a rented apartment for the last six years in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Both her children are attending an elementary school.

Since 2000, she has been selling women's underwear at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. Once every month she goes to Ereen, a Chinese border town, to buy a variety of women's underwear to resell. Ereen is where many Mongolians go to buy a variety of goods and products to resell in Mongolia. Her husband Bat-Ochir is a taxi driver.

With their business profit, she was able to save for a down payment on a condominium. Her dream is to own a larger underwear shop.

loans.use: To buy women's underwear for her business

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Oeun A., 26, is married and lives with two young children and her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She has two businesses: selling groceries and selling rubber. On average, she is able to make a profit of US $5 per day. Her husband also has a business selling rubber.

Mrs. Oeun A. would like to take out a loan to add to her grocery’s inventory to meet her clients’ demand. (Oeun is pictured with her husband and her daughter)

loans.use: Buy groceries and rubber

loans.name: Duong

texts.en: Duong N., 50, sells fruits in the market of Kampong Cham province. She typically makes US$5 per day. Her husband is the village chief and earns US$5 per day as well. The couple has three married children. Duong would like to take out a loan to reinvest in her fruit store.

loans.use: Reinvest in her fruit store

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg A. is a married mother with one son. Her family lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Together with her husband, Gantumur, and sister, Narantsetseg has been running a candy stall for the last three years. She runs her business out of a rented booth at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar City. When she began her business, her working capital was only one million tugrug ($1=1400 MNT). As a result of her hard work, it has increased to four million tugrug. The income from candy sales is the only income for her family. She is planning to rent another booth to expand her business.

Narantsetseg is requesting a loan to buy candy at the wholesale market to increase her business inventory. Her dream is to help her only son lead a healthy and fulfilling life.

loans.use: To buy candy at the wholesale market.

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Erdenechimeg R. is 53 years old and married. Her family lives in a "ger" (traditional nomadic tent) district in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her husband, Purevdagva, is a professional carpenter. They have run a furniture business together since 2000. They make many types of home furniture, including beds, chairs, closets, and tables.

The family’s living conditions have improved as a result of the success of their business. Their working capital has increased from 30,000 tugrugs ($1 USD=1400 MNT) to 200,000 tugrugs.

Erdenechimeg is requesting a loan to purchase wood for the business. She says "with our future profit, I and my husband are planning to buy our own vehicle."

loans.use: Purchase wood for making furniture

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Oyun B. is 63 years old and married. Her family lives in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her husband, Gaadan, is retired and helps with his wife’s business.

Oyun opened a vegetable stall at the local market in 1998. Since then, her business has expanded; she now has three stalls and sells a variety of vegetables such as potatoes, carrots, onions, and cabbages. Her husband purchases vegetables at wholesale prices and drops them off at the stalls. Oyun employs two saleswomen at her stalls and she works as a saleswoman at the third. She has many repeat customers because she treats her customers with care and loyalty.

Oyun's dream is to have her own little grocery store. She is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables to resell

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en: Gantulga J. is 43, married and the father of three children. All his children attend elementary school. Together with his wife Nosolmoo, he has been running a retail business since 1999. He goes to the countryside to sell food products to herders and buys whole animals for meat to resell to residents of the central provinces capital. When he started his business he had one million tugrugs. As a result of ten years of hard work, his working capital has increased to five million tugrugs. With the profit, he bought a vehicle for his business and family needs. Gantulga is a very open and loyal person. His hope is to provide his children with a high level education. He requests a loan to buy more food products to increase his business inventory.

loans.use: To buy fmore ood products

loans.name: Ngen

texts.en: Ngen N. is 41 years old, a widow with two children and resides in the Kampong Cham. She sells cakes, desserts and groceries. On average, she is able to make US$8 in revenue. One of her children is a student and the other one is a worker. Nhen N. is asking for a loan to purchase ingredients and rice so that she can make cake and dessert to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and rice.

loans.name: Dean

texts.en: Dean A., 27, pictured here with her husband, lives in the Kampong Cham province. She sells rice and makes US$2.50 per day, while her husband sells fish in the market. On average, he earns US$7.5 of profit per day. This couple has two young children. Mrs Dean A. is asking for a loan to purchase rice and fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase rice and fish to sell.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im H. is 48 and married with two young children living at home. They live in the Kampong Cham province. She works in a grocery store, typically making $11 each day. Her husband, Bech Haiy, is a construction worker and typically makes about $2 each day. Im H. would like a loan of $1000 to purchase more grocery items to meet her clients' demands.

(Both Im H. and her husband were not available so their daughter is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase more grocerie items.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana Gloria C. P. vive en el Canton Melara departamento La Libertad. Ana es una mujer casada y madre de 4 hijos entre ellos Yohana 16 años, Marcos 14 años, Gloria 7 años y un nuevo integrante a la familia de tan solo un mes de nacido llamado Jaison. Ana cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo Marco Antonio, que trabaja fuera de casa en la Agricultura, cultivando cereales y pipian; pero los ingresos de Marco no son suficiente para los gastos que esta familia afronta;  es por ello que  Ana ha logrado poner  una tienda donde los ingresos de sus ventas son de gran apoyo económico familiar, Ana cuenta con la ayuda de su hija Yohana que al regresar de la escuela acompaña a su madre atender el negocio. Ana solicita este crédito para invertir en su negocio y comprar mercadería,  para que sus ventas incrementen al igual que sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana lives in a town called Canton Melara in La Libertad. She is married and has four children; Yohana, 16 years old, Marcos, 14 years old, Gloria, 7 years old, as well as a new family member named Jaison who is still a baby. Ana counts on her husband, Marco Antonio, for economic support. Marco works in agriculture, but his salary is not sufficient to cover the family expenses, so Ana has set up a general store to provide additional income. Ana's daughter Yohana helps with the store after school. Ana is requesting a loan to purchase inventory for her store to help grow her sales.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her general store and help grow her sales

loans.name: Oscar Alfredo

texts.es: Oscar Alfredo A. vive en Rosario de la paz, departamento La Paz junto a su esposa y su hijo de 2 años de edad, Oscar es empleado en una fábrica, pero también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, que le ayuda en los gastos familiares ya que ella también trabaja. Oscar y su esposa solicitan un crédito para mejorar su vivienda, con la construcción de un muro, que le dará seguridad a la casa de cualquier acto de vandalismo y también desean asegurar la parte de la zona de lavar instalando techo, porque hasta el momento esta zona se encuentra a la intemperie sin seguridad alguna.
texts.en:
Oscar Alfredo A. lives in Rosario de la Paz, La Paz state, with his wife and son who is 2 years old. Oscar works at a factory and he says that his wife also helps with the household bills by working as well. Oscar and his wife would like a loan in order to improve their housing with the construction of a wall that will provide them protection from vandalism and to install a roof because right now they do not have one.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall and a roof over their bathroom

loans.name: Nidia Aracely

texts.es: Nidia Aracely H. M. vive en Ciudad Arce departamento La Libertad. A sus 28 años Nidia es una mujer casada y madre de tres niños, Jonathan de 6 años, Nelson de 4 años y la pequeña Dianita de 1 año. Esta pareja de esposos se dedican a su negocio que es una panadería donde elaboran pan dulce y pan francés, tienen 7 años de experiencia en el negocio; Nidia solicita un crédito para comprar materia prima para su panadería, como harinas y levadura; Nidia ya ha obtenido otros créditos anteriormente y ha sido muy responsable en todos sus pagos de cuotas.
texts.en:
Nidia Aracely H. M. lives in Arce city, La Libertad state. At 28 years old, Nidia is a married woman and mother of three children: Jonathan of age 6, Nelson of age 4, and Dianita of age 1. This couple works at a bread shop where they make sweet bread and french bread. They have 7 years of experience in this field. Nidia would like a loan to purchase basic ingredients for her bread shop, such as flour and yeast. Nidia has received loans in the past and she has been very responsible with all of her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic ingredients for bread making

loans.name: Jaqueline Janeth

texts.es: Jaqueline Janeth R. M. vive en Ciudad Delgado departamento San Salvador. Jaqueline tiene tan solo 19 años de edad y es madre de un niño de 2 años llamado David, Jaqueline esta acompañada con su pareja que también es muy joven al igual que ella, el tiene 17 años de edad. Esta joven pareja lucha por salir adelante y darle lo mejor a su hijo; el padre del niño trabaja como ayudante en un taller automotriz, y Jaqueline tiene un negocio de venta de ropa ubicado en Soyapango, un lugar con mucha afluencia peatonal, Jaqueline solicita un crédito para comprar mercadería para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Jaqueline Janeth R. M. lives in Delgado city, San Salvador state. Jaqueline is only 19 years old and is the mother of a small 2 year old boy named David. Jaqueline is joined by her husband who is 17 years old and young like her. This couple fights to improve their conditions and to provide the best for their son. Her husband works as an assistant at a car repair shop and Jaqueline has a clothing shop located in Soyapango, a place with many pedestrians. Jaqueline would like a loan to buy merchandise to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan B. is 45 years old. He and his wife are farmers and their five children also work in agriculture. His parents were farmers, his only source of income has always been farming, and it will always be farming. His wife and children help him in the harvest.

Hasan sows tomato, cucumber, garlic, and other produce. At around 6 a.m., he's already in his fields. He sells his potatoes to cover the expenses but his other products are for family consumption. He loves his work but for him to break even and have a good quality crop, he needs to fumigate and fertilize at very precise dates. During this season they are sowing in great quantities, and with the help of this loan, Hasan will purchase seeds and fertilizer to help with the tilling.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en:
Karomat E. is 43 years old. She is married with four children. She started her own business 20 years ago when her husband was unemployed. She sells confectionery like candies, cookies, and pastries in the local market. The income from this business allows Karomat to support her family. Karomat dreams of educating all of her children through higher education.

Today, she requests 2500 Somoni for the term of eight months. Karomat is going to spend the loan to purchase confectionery to enlarge her range of goods. She will use the added income on the well-being of her family as well as her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase confectionery to increase her range of goods.

loans.name: Kurbonoy

texts.en:
Kurbonoy G. is 35 years old. She is married and the loving mother of four children. Kurbonoy has been selling children's clothing for more than 15 years to supplement her family’s income. Her husband works as a farmer. It is Kurbonoy’s ambition that her children become professionals who are independent, important people in society. She swears that she’ll keep working hard so that she can reach that goal.

With her loan, Kurbonoy will buy a greater variety of goods to add to her stock in order to increase her sales volume and attract new clients.

loans.use: To purchase new children's clothing for the spring season.

loans.name: Zukhrakhon

texts.en:
Zukhrakhon lives in Tursunzade, Tajikistan, along with her husband and three children. She started her clothing sales business 10 years ago with the prime goal of helping her husband with the family costs. The business has proved to be a good match for Zukhrakhon as she loves sales and is a proficient saleswoman. All through these years, Zukhrakhon has managed her business with much effort and dedication. The business has also helped her provide education to her three children. In order to keep the business growing, she needs a loan of 2000 Somoni to purchase seasonal clothing. She plans to repay the loan within 8 months. Zukhrakhon and her family need your support.

loans.use: Purchase new clothing for kids for the spring season

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.en:
K. Abdurasul is 47 years old, married and has two children. He and his wife work in a small farm. He has been a farmer since he was young and, now that he has a family, he is especially motivated to succeed. Abdurasul plants several hectares of potato, tomato and cucumber. He is happy with his work, especially since it is so profitable. As long as his farmland is well-tended, he can harvest all year long. His main difficulty is in dealing with insects that affect his crops. This is Abdurasul first loan from IMON International, and he wants to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his crops. The loan will greatly improve Abdurasul’s income and his family's living standard.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Lutfullo

texts.en:
Cattle farming is an economic activity dedicated to the raising of animals in order to generate revenue from the animals and the products they provide. Lutfullo has earned a living from raising cattle since he was young. He's married and has a small child that, according to Lutfullo’s words, is his reason for living. It should be said that the low incomes available to people in this rural area aren't enough to maintain a family and, for this reason, Lutfullo works enormously hard to provide a better standard of living for his family. Lutfullo urgently needs to buy animals such as cows and calves. He's applied for a loan of $500 USD. Be an important part of the growth of Lutfullo’s business.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
U. Dilbar is a widowed mother of her adult son. From a young age, she has been in continuous contact with the noble job of cattle raising. Dilbar learned and inherited this trade from her parents, who dedicated most of their lives to this job. This generous mother, together with her son, raise young calves and sheep for a living.

Thanks to the diligence that they employ day to day when looking after and feeding their cattle, they are quickly managing to multiply their cattle. This hardworking mother’s wish is to buy another calf so that she can take care of her and provide her with food. In the future, she would like to get milk, which she will give to her grandchildren, from this cow. With this goal in mind, Dilbar appeals to your good heart in search of your help. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Ali Aatalah

texts.en:
Ali Aatalah has owned a grocery store for seven years. He is successful in his work because he knows how to treat his clients well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had financiA. issues and he also had health problems. Ali Aatalah decided on this business because he wanted to improve his financiA. situation. 
He is a 40 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their four children. Ali Aatalah is requesting a loan of $1000 US in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Ali Aatalah has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on further growing and improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for a store

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin is a 26 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their two children. Amin has owned a car spare parts shop since 2008. Amin requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase car spare parts for his garage. This is the first time that Amin has requested a loan.

Amin is special because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients can be anybody from his region. Amin decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase car spare parts for his garage.

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Cheng S. K., 39, pictured here with her husband, sells vegetables in the local market of the Kampong Cham province, typically making US$6 each day. She is married and has three children living at home to support. Her husband, Khat Mab, makes approximately US$7 every day working as a taxi driver. Cheng S. K. would like a loan of US$1200 to purchase spare parts and repair her husband's taxi.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and repair taxi.

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
Trương Thị T. (20203050001) is a 52 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Trương is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by DINARI.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 01 (1).


Trương is married and has 3 adult-aged children.  To making a living, Trương is starting a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale.  Trương has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1300.000 IDR a month from these activities.


Trương joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Trương is requesting for the first time a loan from DINARI.  She is requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 IDR which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI.  Trương plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050002) is a 41 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 IDR loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Nguyễn Thị V. (20203050003) is a 51 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 IDR loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  Trương Thị V. (20203050004) is a 40 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 IDR loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050005) is a 51 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 IDR loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Trương Thị T. (20203050001) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Trương là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách 01 (1).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  Trương thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Trương kiếm được khoảng 1,300 IDR.  Trương đã tham gia DINARI để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Trương đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ DINARI.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 IDR.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ DINARI.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050002) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị V. (20203050003) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Trương Thị V. (20203050004) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050005) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về DINARI:

Nhiệm vụ của DINARI là cố gắng giữ giàn một môi trường cho phép người nghèo và tạo cơ hội phát triển kinh tế xã hội cho những chủ doanh nghiệp nhỏ.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Hour

texts.en:
Hour C., 46, pictured here with her husband and her children, is married and lives with seven of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband sell rubber, typically making about US$6 each day and are supported by four children working as workers.

Hour C. needs to earn more money to support her family. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a truck to transport rubber. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase a truck.

loans.name: Anh's Group

texts.en:
Anh Thị Nguyễn was born in 1978 (no: 010114150084). She lives in Lễ Pháp village, Tiên Dương commune, Đông Anh district, Ha Nội city. She has 2 children and one is going to school. She is a group leader.

Everyday she sells vegetables in the market and sometimes she goes to buy scrap metal to resell. She has a monthly income of about 1.500.000 VND (or 90 USD). She wants to borrow 5.886.000 VND (or 350 USD) to breed pigs and poultry.

About the other borrowers in the group:

Chắc Thị Lê was born in 1971 (no: 010114150087). She is a grade school teacher. She has a monthly income of about 1.500.000 VND (or 90 USD). She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND (325 USD) to buy food for pigs.

Liên Thị Bùi was born in 1971 (no: 010114150090). She has 2 children. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND (295 USD) to breed pigs and poultry.

Hà Hồng Lê was born in 1983 (no: 010114150089). He lives with his wife and 2 children. He wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND (or 295 USD) to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: To breed pigs and poultry

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh P. L. is a worker with a monthly income of about 1,500,000 VND. She wants to borrow 2,204,000 VND (~$125 USD ) to breed pigs. She was born in 1982 and lives with her husband and two children.

No: 010114150050.

loans.use: To breed pigs

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei sells underwear and other types of clothing at Image market in Beregovo city. He is not married. His monthly income is 2,500 UAH. Andrei has been in this business for five years. During this time he has learned that having a large assortment of goods, that is on display all the time, is the key to success in this kind of business. Andrei's prices are not high, making the goods more attractive to his customers.

Andrei would like to borrow 1,700 UAH to increase his inventory. He hopes to develop this business further and increase his sales.

loans.use: To increase inventory of clothing

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hồng Thị Nguyễn was born in 1975, and has 2 children. She has a monthly income of about 1.500.000 VND. She wants to borrow 5.886.000 VND to breed pigs and buy trees.

loans.use: To breed pigs and buy trees.

loans.name: Lourng

texts.en: Lourng S., 42, is married and lives with her four children in Kampong Cham province. She sells vegetables and fruit for US$7 each day, while her husband is a wedding chef and makes US$3 each day. Lourng S. is asking for a loan of US$800 to expand her business. In order to increase her profits and possibly raise her standard of living, she would like to reinvest in her vegetables store with the loan given to her through CREDIT.

loans.use: To reinvest in her vegetables store.

loans.name: Bahronjon

texts.en:
Bahronjon A. is an entrepreneurial woman who has worked very hard at the various jobs she has learned over the years. Seven years ago, she decided to stay in the business of raising cattle and sheep. After many years of hard work and dedication, Bahronjon can now see the fruits of her labor. The number of her animals has increased rapidly and they keep getting bigger and more beautiful. She dreams of eventually becoming one of the best cow exporters in the local market. To achieve this, Bahronjon needs to improve her operation. She is requesting a loan of $525 USD to purchase young cattle. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle.

loans.name: Thinh's Group

texts.en:
Thịnh Thị Trần was born in 1965, and has 2 sons. She plants flowers and breeds pigs. Her husband is a farmer. They have a monthly income of about US$95. She wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND to breed pigs and buy manure for her flowers. There are four other fund participants in her group.

Lụa Thị Nguyễn was born in 1958. She sells pork in the market, and wants to borrow 4.578.000 VND to buy more pork to resell.
Liên Thị Trần was born in 1970. She lives with her husband and 3 children in Cổ Dương villarge. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND to grow plants and to buy chicken.
Trọng Thị Trần was born in 1964. She lives with her daughter. She wants to borrow 3.706.000 VND to breed pigs.
Bắc Thị Trần was born in 1955. She wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND to buy pig feed.

loans.use: To breed pigs and to buy manure.

loans.name: Vor

texts.en: Vor S. is married and lives with her young child in Kampong Cham province. She cooks food for garment workers and earns approximately US$2.50 each day, and her husband works in construction. Vor S. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase construction materials and cement mixer for her husband. She believes that these purchases will allow them to increase their income and be able to better support their large family.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Bakam Koffi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un résident du quartier de gblinkomé, il a très tôt abandonné les classes, pour subvenir à ses propres charges, il a commencé en 2005 le commerce de cartes de recharge TOGOCEL et MOOV qu’il vend en gros et en détail à ses clients de façon ambulante. Il est très dynamique et arrive à conquérir tous les jours de nouveaux clients. Il veut agrandir son activité et commencer par vendre des cartes ILLICO, pour cela il doit donc se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 10 boîtes de cartes TOGOCEL, 10 boîtes de cartes MOOV et 5 boîtes de cartes ILLICO.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who resides in the Gblinkomé district. He dropped out of school quite early in order to support himself. In 2005 he started doing commerce in TOGOCEL and MOOV mobile phone cards that he sells wholesale and retail to customers as he goes door-to-door. He is a very energetic man and manages to win over new customers very day. He wants to expand his business first by selling ILLICO cards. To do so, he must resupply himself and is requesting a WAGES loan to buy ten boxes of TOGOCEL cards, ten boxes of MOOV cards, and five boxes of ILLICO cards.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mobile phone recharge cards

loans.name: Komil

texts.en:
Komil A. is 27 years old. He is married and has a small child. Komil is a manufacturer, who produces wooden doors and window frames. His shop is located in his house. After working in this business for 2 years, Komil became an experienced master and now he is teaching students. Because he produces goods of good quality and acceptable prices, Komil has many customers. He sells the doors and window frames from his house, and also has a trading place located in the local market. In general, the business of Komil is very successful and generates a stable income for the family. Now, Komil is planning to purchase additional materials required for the expansion of his business. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting 2500 Somoni for the term of 9 months. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase materials for manufacturing.

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Phương Thị Nguyễn was born in 1976. She lives with her husband and 2 children. Her family has about 200 hens that lay eggs. Her husband is a farmer. They have a monthly income of about 2.000.000 VND. She is a group leader. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy food for her hens. The other borrowers in her group are:
Xuân Thị Trần, born in 1958, lives with her mother. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy goods for her variety store.
Nguyệt Thị Nguyễn was born in 1982. She makes tofu and then sells it at the market near her house. She wants to borrow 4.578.000 VND to buy soy beans.

loans.use: To buy feed for hens.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Heang S., 49, is married and lives with four of her children. She sells vegetables, groceries and porridge in the Prey Veng province, typically making US$5 each day, and is supported by her husband who works as construction worker. Heang would like to take out a loan to expand her grocery’s inventory to meet her clients’ demand.

loans.use: To expand her grocery’s inventory.

loans.name: Trương Thị Hải Group

texts.en:
"H. Trương Thị is a 24 year old female living in the town of Yên Phong-Bắc Ninh. H. is the group leader of a 5 member group loan offered by DINARI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 02 (2).

H. is married and has 2 infant aged children. To making a living, H. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising ducks for sale. H. has just started operating this business and earns approximately 2500.000 IDR a month from these activities.

H. joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. is requesting for the first time a loan from DINARI. She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About the other borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị H. is a 36 year old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 IDR loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Trương Thị X. is a 20 year old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 IDR loan to support her business in the arts sector operating a weaving business.

3.  Trương Thị U. is a 22 year old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 IDR loan to support her business in the arts sector operating a handicraft business.

4.  Trương Thị K. is a 34 year old female who is requesting a 3.360.000 IDR loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

H. Trương Thị (20203050006) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách 02 (2).

Trong khi không pH. chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi vịt để bán.  H. has just started operating this business.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 2,500 IDR.  H. đã tham gia DINARI để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ DINARI.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 IDR.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ DINARI.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20203050007) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2.  Trương Thị X. (20203050008) là 20 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ thuật.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hàng dệt.

3.  Trương Thị U. (20203050009) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ thuật.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hàng thủ công mỹ nghệ.

4.  Trương Thị K. (20203050010) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.360.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về DINARI:

Nhiệm vụ của DINARI là cố gắng giữ giàn một môi trường cho phép người nghèo và tạo cơ hội phát triển kinh tế xã hội cho những chủ doanh nghiệp nhỏ.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Mosili

texts.en: Mosili D. A. is 60 years old and married with 2 children. She has a shop where she sells bags of onions. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more bags of onions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of onions to sell

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo B. is 41 years old and married with 6 children. She sells table water and juice. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more juice and table water to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more table water and juice to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha has been running a tailoring business in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for 10 years. She belongs to the Dodoma road TRM loan group (group code 2023). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. Every day she works at her business for 11 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can improve her business by adding more items. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Martha is married, and has three children: ages 18, 16, and 3. She also cares for four additional dependents.

loans.use: To expand business offerings

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun S., 54, is married and lives with her husband in the Kandal province. Growing rice and selling noodles, she makes US $2 each day. Her husband sells fish, also making US $2 each day. Bun S. is asking for a loan of US $500 to reinvest in her husband's fish stand and repair her house.

loans.use: To buy fish for resale, and for home repair

loans.name: Upendo

texts.en:
Upendo has owned a small shop in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for 5 years. She belongs to the Dodoma road TRM loan group (group code 2023). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works at her business for 13 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to add her current stock to improve her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Upendo is 27 years old, married, and has a 9-month-old child. She also cares for two additional dependents.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa has been married for about 21 years to a farmer named Edwin, living happily in San Isidro, Quirino, Isabela  with their two children, Lorjie, 21 years old and a high school graduate, and Rhea May, 12, currently attending elementary school. Teresa hopes that they can provide the best future for their two children. With her hard working husband, she hopes to improve their living conditions and be able to continue sending their youngest child to school through to college.  
	
For almost 36 years, Teresita has been maintaining the farm that she inherited from her parents. She is now requesting a loan of PHP19, 000.00 in order to sustain their rice and tobacco farm which produces good yields twice a year. The loan will enable them to purchase more fertilizers and other necessary farm inputs.  Since their farm is the only source of income supporting their daily necessities, Teresa wants to make it more productive in order to provide a brighter future for her children.

loans.use: To sustain the rice field.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
“One must be patient and have perseverance to live life successfully,” is the principle of Virginia M.. She is 59 years old, a mother of four children and married to Herminio M.. They are living in a rural community located in Barangay Nangalisan of Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. Most of her children are high school graduates only, unable to pursue their college courses due to a lack of finances. Now, all of her children are married and have their own families.

Virginia earns a living by maintaining their general store business. Her husband also maintains a piggery and small rice farm where most of the income from the store are invested. They use only a small amount for their daily necessities. According to Virginia, she can make a net income of PHP700.00 (about USD $14) per week. This is very little to support their piggery business and their small rice farm. Virginia is seeking the support of the lenders to borrow a loan of PHP19, 000.00 (USD $400). She will use the money as additional capital for their businesses and to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
“Ambitions in life will remain ambitions unless you work for it” said Marlyn A. who is a market vendor in Bagabag Nueva Vizcaya. Marlyn is married to Felix A. Sr. and they were gifted with three children. She resides with her family in Junction, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is an ambitious entrepreneur who aims to become a successful businesswoman someday. She hopes to be able to make her children proud of her. Her eldest child is only a high school graduate, while the two younger ones are presently studying in college. 

Marlyn and her husband work hard to earn a living and give their children their needed support in order to provide good educations. She manages to sell different vegetables, boiled corn, different snacks and also bottled (mineral) water. She is glad that through her daily vending adventure, she is be able to generate around PHP 3,000.00 net income monthly.  This is utilized wisely for their important necessities at home and allowances of their two children in school. Marlyn is applying for a loan amounting to PHP 5,000.00 from the lenders that she will be use as additional working capital for her business in order to grow and to increase her profit.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Adebayo

texts.en: Adebayo K. A. is 38 years old and married with 4 children. Adebayo has two motorcycles that he uses to convey passengers from one location to another within his community in Oyo town. He is requesting a loan in the amount of N50, 000 to purchase one motorcycle to enable him meet the demands of his customers. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase one motorcycle

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
“Praying without ceasing, for with faith in God you can do everything, for nothing is impossible with Him “says Gloria D. who lives in the village of Junction, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. The said inspirational message motivates Gloria not to give up in times of troubles. During those times, she prays and accepts it as a challenge in life. She is a faithful and loving mother of her three children; Jasmin, Jason, and the youngest, Jannel. Her eldest child has already finished her college courses, the second is studying civil engineering course and the third is still a baby.

Gloria hopes to give her children all that they desire in life by working hard and striving for the best in the general store business she has managed for many years. She wants her business to grow and become a grocery store someday. She is thus requesting a loan amounting to PHP5, 000.00 for additional working capital. Gloria prays that her business will improve and is thankful for the financial support of  Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Oyetola

texts.en:
Oyetola F. is 50 years old and married with 3 children. Oyetola has a cassava farm where she produces garri and fufu. To make garri, cassava tubers are peeled, washed and grated or crushed to produce a mash. The mash is placed in a non-water proof bag and allowed to ferment for one or two days, while weights are placed on the bag to press the water out. It is then sieved (or sifted) and roasted by heating in a bowl. The resulting dry granular garri can be stored for long periods. It may be pounded or ground to make a fine flour. Fufu is a thick paste or porridge usually made by boiling starchy root vegetables in water and pounding with a large stick and bowl until the desired consistency is reached. 

Oyetola is requesting a loan of N80, 000 to purchase more cassava to plant for making garri and fufu to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to plant for making garri and fufu to sell

loans.name: Ronel

texts.en:
Ronel is 25 years old and married to Jennifer. His wife works as a barangay (village) treasurer in their village of San Isidro, Quirino, Isabela in the Philippines. They have been blessed with one child, Janel, who is three years old.

Ronel is hoping to lift his family out of poverty. He hopes to be able to support his only child throughout her education. He would like her to complete her college degree in the future.

He manages a one-hectare field of rice and corn. Since he lacks the capital to maintain his farm, Ronel is requesting a loan of $375 (17,000 PHP). His past loans enabled him to increase his income and improve his house by replacing a wrecked roof. He hopes he will have a good harvest and gradually improve his family’s way of life.

Romel knows that, in order to achieve his goal, he must be responsible and pursue a higher goal. He prays to God above that He will guide him toward his life goals.

loans.use: To build business capital.

loans.name: Jennilyn

texts.en:
Jennilyn is 24 years old. She is a resident of Vista Alegre Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya in the Philippines. She is married to Enrico E., who is 36 years old. They have three children: Jennyca Ann, 8 years old, followed by Lyra Kate, 6 years old, and Ayessa Kaye, 2 months old. She wishes all the best for her three daughters and is doing her best to provide for their future welfare.

Jennilyn is involved in a hog-raising business while her husband works as a laborer in their village. They help each other earn income in order to meet their daily needs and save for their children’s studies. Her hog-raising business is going well, and she wants to increase the number of pigs she sells so that when their children grow up and enter to high school and college, she will be able to support their life ambitions.

She is hoping to receive a loan of $225 (10,000 PHP) to buy feed supply for her pigs and purchase additional piglets. With her strong determination and positive thinking, Jennilyn believes that she will be able to attain all her goals in life.

loans.use: To buy feed supply.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa N., 57, lives in Kandal province with his wife and five children. He works as a farmer, typically making about $5 a day. His wife sells fish and vegetables and makes $6 a day.  In the current time of economic difficulties, Hoa N. is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase rice seed and fertilizer so that he can expand his crop. He is an ambitious entrepreneur who one day hopes to set up a grocery store in front of his home. He sees this loan as a way to increase his income, and is confident that his business venture will be successful.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertiliser.

loans.name: Romel

texts.en:
Romel lives in the village of San Isidro, Quirino, Isabela. He is 31 years old and married to Maricel. They are blessed with three children, Nelmark, 12, Romarie, 10, and Marjoe, 5. The three sisters all attend school. The oldest is about to enter high school while the two younger ones are in elementary school.
