Romel is hoping that he will able to provide for all of their needs, especially education.

Romel supports his family by running a rice farm. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide and seeds for the coming planting season. He hopes that ASKI will provide him with working capital to maintain his farming business. His goal is to have a good yield to pay back the loan. Romel is doing his best to support his family and save for his children’s college education. 

His family living situation is good because he, his wife and children share love and unity. One thing he really hopes is that all of them will finish college, and his is willing to work doubly hard to make this happen and achieve his goals in life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insectide and seeds

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị  Trình Group

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị T. is 33 years old and lives in the town of Y. Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She leads a six-person loan group. While each member of this group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 03 (3).

Nguyễn is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Nguyễn owns and operates a livestock-raising business. While she has other means of support, her main source of income is raising pigs for sale.  Nguyễn has been engaged in this business for over four years.

Nguyễn joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and engage in business. She is requesting a new loan to buy breeding livestock.  The loan will be her first from DINARI.  Nguyễn plans to use the revenue generated by this loan to improve her life and expand her small business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
1.  Nguyễn V. H. is a 27-year-old male who is requesting a loan to manufacture furniture.

2.  Nguyễn thị H. is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a loan to manufacture furniture.

3.  Trương Thị Hà is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a loan to manufacture furniture.

4.  Nguyễn Thị N. is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a loan to support her business raising livestock.

5.  Nguyễn Thị Y. is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a loan to support her business manufacturing  furniture.

About DINARI:
The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050011) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố Y. Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Nguyễn là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các tH.nh viên.  Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách 03 (3).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Nguyễn thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nguyễn kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 IDR.  Nguyễn đã tham gia DINARI để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  0    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 IDR.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ DINARI.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Nguyễn V. H. (20203050012) là 27 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh chế tạo H.ng nội thất.

2.  Nguyễn thị H. (20203050024) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh chế tạo H.ng nội thất.

3.  Trương Thị Hà (20203050013) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh chế tạo H.ng nội thất.

4.  Nguyễn Thị N. (20203050014) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

5.  Nguyễn Thị Y. (20203050015) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh chế tạo H.ng nội thất.

Về DINARI:
Nhiệm vụ của DINARI là cố gắng giữ giàn một môi trường cho phép người nghèo và tạo cơ hội phát triển kinh tế xã hội cho những chủ doanh nghiệp nhỏ.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to expand various small businesses

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn believes that “patience is the knot which secures victory; it is in the garden of patience that strength grows best.” 

This is her inspiring message, and she recalls it whenever facing challenges. She is a housewife who makes a living selling vegetables in a nearby village. Her goal is to help her husband meet some of the needs they have at home. They live in Nangalisan Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya and have four children who are all studying, two in college and one each in high school and elementary school.

They earn income from a rice and vegetable farm managed by her husband, while Evelyn sells vegetables in town. They plant and harvest twice a year, and work very hard to provide necessities like education. Evelyn hopes to secure this loan to maintain their vegetable and rice farm, and her sale of vegetables in their village. She hopes that with their patience and sacrifices, they will succeed in business through the support of lenders and guidance of our Lord.

loans.use: to expand a small business growing and selling vegetables

loans.name: Moniera

texts.en:
Moniera and Tirso M. are simple people who live peacefully in Barangay Nangalisan, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. They have been blessed with three children and know that parenthood is a great responsibility. The couple support their children, both in terms of basic necessities and education. They also provide their children with moral and spiritual support, and are doing their best to earn and save for their future.

Moniera manages a village store where she sells different grocery and frozen items. She buys most of her products in the Solano Public Market. She is seeking a loan to improve her business, increase her income and better support her family. She believes that the small amount she is asking to borrow will be a big help to her business and her family.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
“Hardship of life is not a valid reason to give up, but a challenge to move forward,” sayd Judy S. who is a sidewalk vendor in their small village. Dhe is married to Niel S.. The couple lives happily with their four children in Quirino Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. Three of their children are presently studying in college and the youngest is still in high school. Judy is working hard to earn more income to help support the studies of their children.

Her husband is operating a tricycle transport business to earn income while Judy ventures into vending. She sacrifices most of her time to sell food, snacks, fruits and vegetables. She also sells food & snacks on public utility buses and at the bus terminals. Her daily vending is worth the sacrifice because she has many customers, says Judy, and this helps develop her business activity further. Judy is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000.00 ($125 US) which she will add to her current vending capital. Judy is also hoping that somehow, this will allow them to be able to expand their livelihood for the welfare of their children.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar P. has been a widow for nearly eight years. She lives peacefully in the village of San Isidro, Quirino, Isabela. She has three children: Marjie, 36 years old, was luckily to be given the chance to work abroad as a Domestic Helper, second is Lenielyn, 34 years old, who was not able to finish her secondary schooling, and third is Noel, 28 years old. All of her children are married and striving to combat life’s difficulties. Pilar and her children are helping each other to surpass every challenge in life.

Pilar has been renting a one hectare piece of farmland that she and her son, Noel, along with his family, cultivate in order to generate income for their daily needs. Sadly, their income is not enough to sustain their business and to provide their basic needs. At present, Pilar is requesting to take a loan of PHP 11,000.00 ($250 US) in order to buy fertilizers and seeds for their farming. They also require diesel fuel for a hand tractor that they are using to cultivate their farm. Pilar hopes that through the loan, she will be able to manage the entire farming from planting through to harvesting. She hopes to generate a good yield after 4-5 months from now. Pilar is praying that lenders will lend her financial support in order to earn more profit from her farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for farming.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
“Success often comes to those who dare and act, seldom goes to the cowards who are ever afraid of the consequences” is the guiding principle of Rosalinda L. in facing the difficulties of life. She is a responsible housewife, married to Federico L., Jr. They live happily in Barangay Vista Alegre of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. They are blessed with five children. Their first two children have graduated from college while the younger three are presently studying in college. Rosalinda patiently maintains her hog-raising business in order to support her husband in providing their children’s education. 

Rosalinda’s husband operates a tricycle transport business in their village. The couple works hand in hand in order to give their children a better life by supporting their ambitions to finish their studies. By maintaining their hog-raising business and daily tricycle operation, her family is able to struggle through the current economic crisis. At present, Rosalinda is hoping to borrow additional working capital of PHP 8,000 ($175 US) to buy hog feed supplies and to pay for maintenance of her husband’s tricycle.

loans.use: To buy hog feed and pay for tricycle maintenance.

loans.name: Babatunde

texts.en: Babatunde S. A. is 31 years old, married, and has 3 children. Babatunde sells sheet roofing to builders. He is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more sheet roofing to sell. He says thanks to kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sheet roofing to sell.

loans.name: Jovenson

texts.en:
Jovenson is married to Irene, a housewife who is presently taking care of their one-year-old son. Jovenson feels that he needs to be more responsible, especially now that he has a child. He promises to work, to the best of his ability, to provide his family with everything they need. 

Jovenson maintains one hectare of rice field as the source of income for his family. However, his income is not enough to sustain his business. That’s why he is seeking a loan for the maintenance of the farm. He is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 16,000 ($350 US) to purchase enough fertilizers and seed variety for his farming. After nine years farming, Jovenson knows what’s best for his farm. He wants to prepare the farm to harvest a good yield next harvest season. He wants to earn more profit to provide for the needs of his family, including to send his child to school and to finish college someday. He hopes that he can meet this goal with all the strength and patience he exerts in his farming.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds for farming.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 37 years old and married with 5 children. She has a store where she sells provisions. She is requesting the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose P. is 58 years old and works as a farmer in their small village. He resides in the rural area of San Isidro, Quirino, Isabela. He has been a widower for sixteen years. He is blessed with two children; Mario, 37 years old and already married, and Rudelyn, 32 years old, a high school graduate, and now a widower also. Jose lives with his son Mario, and they help each other in maintaining their rice farm for their survival.

Jose P. plants rice and corn in his farm. But he doesn’t have enough capital to maintain his farm, especially for buying seeds and fertilizer. Thus, he is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP12,000 because he believes that it will help him in his agriculture business. He is already planning to buy inputs needed for planting like fertilizer, seeds and other miscellaneous. Jose P. is working hard for his children, and also his grandchildren. He helps support them in their studies. Jose believes that through his sacrifices and patience, he will be able to attain all his dreams in life. .

loans.use: buying inputs for his farm

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is happily married to Herminigildo E. who is a farmer in their village. Rice and corn farming is the only source of income for their family. The couple lives in San Isidro, Quirino, Isabela. They have been blessed with three children. Their eldest and youngest children were not able to finish their high school studies, while their second child is a graduate of education. Elizabeth and their youngest child are responsible for helping Herminigildo maintain their rice and corn farm. Elizabeth is also helps her husband in generating financial support for their farming needs.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP15,000 that they will utilize to buy fertilizer and hybrid seeds for their farming. They live by means of farming and it serves as their livelihood. They are always looking at increasing their harvest in order to increase their profits. Elizabeth has already re-paid her first loan from KIVA lenders and is now borrowing again for their farming sustainability.

The couple and their children are close. They always help each other especially in times of trouble. Elizabeth is doing her best to provide their basic needs. She is dreaming that someday they will able to uplift their poor living conditions with the help of the lenders and Almighty God.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hybrid seeds

loans.name: Herlosita

texts.en:
“In every sacrifice, there is a reward that waits” is the inspirational quote of Herlosita E.. She is 54 years old and married to Hipolito E. who is a farmer in their village. The couple lives in the village of San Isidro, Quirino, Isabela. They have been blessed with four children. Jilbert is the eldest, next is Bernard, the third is Gerald, and Henry is the youngest.

Rice and corn farming is their family’s only source of income. Herlosita always gives her helping hand to her husband in order to provide for their family’s needs. Herlosita assists her husband in their rice and corn fields to improve their family’s income since it currently is not enough to sustain them. She is turning to ASKI for a loan since they lack capital to purchase needed farming inputs such as fertilizer, rice and corn seed varieties, pesticides and herbicides. They will also need money to pay for labor to help during planting season. She is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 that will be used to support their farming business.

Herlosita hopes she will be able to earn more money in order to support her youngest child’s college education, giving her the opportunity to apply for a better job someday.

loans.use: buying fertilizer, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Fanesa

texts.en:
Fanesa is a resident of Purok 2 (district 2) of San Isidro, Quirino, Isabela. She is 33 years old and married to Samuel S. who is 35 years old and a farmer in their village. They are blessed with one child, John Ray, who is 10 years old and attending primary school. Fanesa is glad and thankful that in their family there is cooperation and they are bonded with love.

Fanesa works with her husband in their rice fields which serve as their source of income. Fanesa is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 11,000 for her farming needs. Every harvest, she only earns a net income of PHP 10,000 because some of her harvested rice is used for their rice consumption. Fanesa has been managing the business for almost 12 years and she always hopes to have an increase in production in order to send her child to school all the way through college.

Fanesa stated that if you commit everything to God, He will do the rest that is best for you. But, it should also be accompanied by actions, she added.

loans.use: For farming needs

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena has owned a small shop in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa  for 2 years. She belongs to Mbuma east group loan (Group code 2005). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $80. Lena works at her business for 11 hours daily.

Lena is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her shop to improve her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Lena is 45 years old, single, and has three children: aged 25, 18 and 12. She also cares for three additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more items for her shop, to improve her business.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn was the housewife of Joel A.. However, due to their incompatibility, according to Merlyn, they decided to separate. Their three children were left in her custody. She is striving hard to give her children a good education. Her eldest child is Joel,15 years old, who is forced to work in Subic (10 hours away from home) because of the family’s financial crisis. The two youngest, Jenessa and John Lloyd, are both attending the primary level of education. The family lives in the village of San Isidro, Quirino, Isabella.

Corn farming is the source of income for Merlyn and her family. With her income from corn farming, she can provide the necessities for their family. At present, Merlyn is requesting to renew her loan of PHP 15,000 for the same purpose as before. She will use the amount to buy fertilizers, seeds, deisel fuel for the cultivation of her fields and to pay the hired farm workers. According to Merlyn, the loan she had borrowed last time was really of great help. Since she again lacks capital, Merlyn decided to seek the assistance of KIVA lenders again for the her business. Merlyn hopes that in the future, her children will finish college. To achieve her goal she is working hard and sacrifices a lot. She wants to give her family a good future and to lift them out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Ry C., 28, pictured with her husband at the field, is a professional tailor who lives in the Kandal province with her husband and one young child. She typically earns US$2 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and also a farmer. On average, combining both businesses, he makes US$6 per day. Ry would like to take out a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her husband so that he can grow more crops.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Pedrico

texts.en:
Pedrico is a 42-year old farmer from the village of San Isidro, Quirino, Isabela. He is married to Jennilyn, 37 years old, who used to manage a hog-raising business. The couple has been blessed with two children: Jeric, 13 years old, who only finished his second year of high school, and Peter John, who is 4 years old. Pedrico is very thankful that his family has a good family relationship, and his wife is very loving and supportive of him.

Pedrico is requesting to avail a loan of PHP10,000 ($225 US) that will be utilized for his rice farm. According to Pedrico, this amount will enable him to avoid asking for credit from lenders in their town, who charge high interest rates. He believes that joining ASKI (the lending partner) will be of great help towards the growth of his farming. With the loan, he will be able to pay for farming supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, labor compensations, and other expenses.  

Pedrico, being a father of two children, is dreaming that his children will someday finish their studies in college. This is why he works so hard. He also hopes to be able to save more money from farming to pursue the business of hog-raising that his wife has done previously. This would give them an additional source of income, which would help in providing for life’s necessities.

loans.use: To pay for farming supplies and hired farm workers.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza has owned a small food store in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa  for 7 years. She belongs to Mwenge East group loan (Group code 2025).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items (tomatoes, sugar, rice, carrot, beans and etc) to add to her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.

Eliza is 37 years old, married, and has three children: aged 20, 17 and 10. She also cares for five additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her store.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer Y. is a 30-year-old farmer.  He and his wife, Norma, have been blessed with one child, Elisi. Elisi is 18 years old and has just graduated from high school, but unfortunately is not able to pursue a college degree at the moment due to financial difficulties. Elmer's family lives in the peaceful area of San Isidro in Quirino, Isabela. He strives to sustain his farm to further support his family’s immediate needs.

Elmer is thankful for the financial support provided to him last year by the Kiva lenders, and is requesting a second loan amounting to 16,000 Phillippine pesos (or about $350 US) for his farming needs. He has been farming for 10 years, growing rice and tobacco. He will use the money to purchase the necessary materials for his agricultural business which he needs for the upcoming planting season. Elmer also hopes to raise his family’s standard of living and be able to support his daughter’s college studies.

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Tu's Group

texts.en:
Tú T. Vương was born in 1984. She sells fruit in a market. Her husband sells tickets at a bus station. They have 2 children, one of which currently attends school. They have a monthly income of about 3,500,000 Vietnamese dong (or about $200 US). Tu wants to borrow 4,142,000 dong (or about $245) to buy more fruit to resell in the market. There are 3 other fund participants in her group, and their requests are as follows:

Quảng Văn Nguyễn was born in 1970. He wants to borrow 5,450,000 dong (or about $295) to breed pigs.

Hải Thị Nguyễn was born in 1956. She wants to borrow 654,000 dong (or about $40) to buy goods to resell.

Mai Thị Nguyễn was born in 1969. She wants to borrow 5,450,000 dong (or about $295) to buy traditional Chinese medicine to resell.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to resell in the market

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Ánh Thị Nguyễn was born in 1984. She sells vegetables in the market near her house. Her husband is a builder. They have two children, one of which is going to school. They have a monthly income of about 2,500,00 Vietnamese dong (or about $140 US). This is her first microfinance loan. She wants to borrow 2,232,000 dong ( or about $125) to buy more vegetables.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables

loans.name: Mufutan

texts.en: Mufutan is 44 years old and married with 5 children. He sells drinks to his customers. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira (or about $700 US) to purchase more drinks to sell. He thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: Irina is married with two children. She owns a business that offers ritual services in her city. She has been helping her relatives and neighbors to bury their family members and saw the demand for those services. Irina decided to start this business six months ago to meet that demand. She would like to get a loan of 1,600 Ukrainian hryvnia (or about $225 US) to purchase various fabrics and other items used in ritual services. She hopes that in this way she can help the people in her town when someone dies.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for ritual services

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Tam S. is 53 years old and lives with his wife in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He is a policeman and makes 3 USD per day, while his wife, pictured here, has run a grocery store in the market for years and earns 11 USD every day. The couple has three children: one is a student, one is married, and one is a security guard. Tam S. would like to take out a loan to purchase grocery items for his wife's store, to meet customers' demands.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items

loans.name: Mohamad Issam

texts.en: Mohamad is a 22-year-old man living in Ouzai, Mount Lebanon. He began working as a car mechanic two years ago, when he started fixing his friends' cars in front of his house. Today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow $800 to expand his business and move it off the street and into a proper garage.

loans.use: To expand his mechanic business and relocate it in a proper garage

loans.name: Nhat

texts.en: Nhật K. Đỗ was born in 1968 (no. 010117070029). She is a tailor. She is living in Phuc Loc village, Uy No commune, Dong Anh district, Ha Noi. She has one child. She is learning at the university. She has a monthly income of about 2,000,000 VND. She has to work hard. She needs 5,450,000 VND (about 325 USD) to buy cloth to make clothes. She is sitting to the right side of the picture.

loans.use: To buy cloth to make clothes

loans.name: Truong's Group

texts.en:
Q. Trong T. is thirty years old and lives in the town of Yen Phong in Bac Ninh.  Q. is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by DINARI, one of Kiva's field partners.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.


Q. is married and has four school-aged children.  To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.  While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income from the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  Q. has been engaged in this business for over eight years.


Q. joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation through engaging in business activities.  She is requesting a loan that will be used to purchase medication for her livestock.  This will be the first loan taken out by this borrower.  Q. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Doan T. Bac is twenty-eight years old and is requesting a loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.


2.  Trong T. Hong thirty-three years old and is requesting a loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.


3.  Doan T. Tuyen is twenty-two years old and is requesting a loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector, operating a furniture-making business.


4. Nguyen T. Cai is fifty-four years old and is requesting a loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.


5.  Trong T. Q. is twenty-two years old and is requesting a loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector, operating a furniture-making business.


6.  Nguyen T. C. is twenty-seven years old and is requesting a loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.


7.  Nguyen T. T. is twenty-three years old and is requesting a loan to support her business in the retail sector, running a general store.


About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

loans.use: To buy medication for her livestock.

loans.name: Elie

texts.en: Elie is twenty-nine years old and married with one child. He lives in Hauch A. Oumara in Zahle. He started working with his father eight years ago to become the electrician he is now. Elie is requesting a loan to purchase a new toolkit so he can work more efficiently.

loans.use: To purchase a new toolkit.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok P. is a construction foreman who lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He typically makes $5 a day, and his wife earns $2 a day as a professional tailor. This couple has four children, all of whom are in school. Sok P. needs a loan to purchase construction materials.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Josiah

texts.en: Josiah A. is thirty-two years old and married with three children. Josiah sells bags of charcoal. He is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. He is thankful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Saheed

texts.en: Saheed is thirty years old and married with a child. He has cameras that he uses for video coverage and for photography. He is requesting a loan to purchase a camera and more film. He is thankful to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a camera and film

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 42-year-old married man with three children and lives in Shwaifat, Mount Lebanon. He has owned his own business since 1984 when he first started waxing tiles and painting houses. Now, Hussein is requesting to borrow $800 USD to purchase the necessary equipment for his upcoming project.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Brak

texts.en: Brak P. is 45 years old and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She runs a grocery store, earning about $3 USD per day. Her husband raises and sells pigs, and also makes rice wine, typically making $5 USD a day altogether. To earn more money, Brak P. needs a loan to expand her grocery store's stock.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store’s stock

loans.name: Chijoke

texts.en: Chijoke is 30 years old and single. He has a shop where he sells plumbing materials, and is now requesting a loan of 100 000 NGN to purchase more plumbing materials to sell. He sends his thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plumbing materials to sell

loans.name: Bibian

texts.en: Bibian O. is 42 years old and married with 3 children. She sells motorcycle spare parts. She is requesting a loan for the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 25-year-old man living in Hay Madi, located in Baabda, Mount Lebanon. He has owned an aluminum manufacturing and assembly shop for the past three years, and had two previous years of experience in the field. Today, Ali wants $1,200 to further expand his project.

loans.use: To expand his project

loans.name: Bunmi

texts.en: Bunmi B. is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She sells jewelry. She is requesting a loan for the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more jewelry to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline A. is a 43-year-old widow with four children. She retails groceries and is requesting the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Roth

texts.en:
Roth T., 48, a widow with six children living in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, typically makes about $2 each day by selling food to workers in the local garment factory. Her daughter, Kem Srey Leak, a garment factory worker, makes about $2 each day as well. Roth would like a loan of $200 to purchase rice. 

Roth, on the right, is pictured with her daughter and her grandson.

loans.use: To purchase rice.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (20201070008) is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. H. is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by DINARI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Trung Bạn 07 (7).

H. is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, H. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While this is not her only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. H. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2500.000 IDR a month from these activities.

H. joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. H. is requesting a loan of 4.256.000 IDR, which will be used to purchase medication for the her livestock. This is her first loan through DINARI. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Nguyễn Thị H. is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.256.000 IDR loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector, operating a furniture-making business.

2. Nguyễn Thị M. is a 35-year-old woman who is requesting a 2.016.000 IDR loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

3. Nghiêm Thị C. is a 39-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 IDR loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector ,operating a furniture-making business.

4. Nguyễn Thị S. is a 22-year-old woman who is requesting a 2.016.000 IDR loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector, operating a furniture-making business.

5. Nguyễn Thị L. is a 52-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.704.000 IDR loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

-------------------------------------------------------- H. Nguyễn Thị (20201070008) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Trung Bạn 07 (7).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán. H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 2,500 IDR. H. đã tham gia DINARI để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ DINARI. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.256.000 IDR.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ DINARI.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Nguyễn Thị H. (20201070009) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.

2. Nguyễn Thị M. (20201070010) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.016.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3. Nghiêm Thị C. (20201070011) là 39 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.

4. Nguyễn Thị S. (20201070012) là 22 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.016.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.

5. Nguyễn Thị L. (20201070013) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.704.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về DINARI:

Nhiệm vụ của DINARI là cố gắng giữ giàn một môi trường cho phép người nghèo và tạo cơ hội phát triển kinh tế xã hội cho những chủ doanh nghiệp nhỏ.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase medication for livestock and to expand the businesses of the group members.

loans.name: Sanoussi

texts.fr: Cette dame est une veuve qui vit seule avec ses 03 enfants dans le quartier d’amoutiévé, l’activité qu’elle exerce et qui lui permet de subvenir aux charges de sa famille est le commerce des articles de mercerie et la vente de boissons, ce commerce lui réussit bien. , elle exerce son commerce près du marché d’amoutiévé.Elle veut commencer le commerce de produits cosmétiques pour augmenter ses recettes et bien subvenir aux charges de sa famille, elle  a déjà obtenu un crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé et sollicite de WAGES son deuxième crédit afin d’acheter des produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
This lady is a widow who lives alone with her three children in the Amoutiévé district. Her work, which enables her to provide for her family, involves commerce in sewing supplies and in beverages. It’s a business that is very successful for her. She operates near the Amoutiévé marketplace. She wants to begin commerce in cosmetics to increase her receipts and to do well in supporting her family. She has had a loan before that she has repaid. She’s requesting her second loan from WAGES in order to buy cosmetics.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana M., 43, is married and has six children, two sons and four daughters, some of whom are in senior high school while the others are in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Juliana works to support her husband, a farmer, in providing for the family by trading in smoked fish. Juliana buys the fish from markets in nearby communities and sells them at the local market on a table top. She has been in business for twenty years and is now requesting a loan to procure smoked fish in bulk. She hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita, 25 years old and married with three children, has a store where she sells clothes and operates a beauty salon. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell and says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina A. is thirty years old. She is divorced and has two sons, both of whom are in primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Paulina works very hard as a single parent to provide for the family. She trades in smoked fish, buying the fish from the markets in the nearby communities and selling at the local market. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy smoked fish in bulk. She hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish in bulk.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is thirty-five years old and married with five children. She sells provisions, and is requesting a loan to purchase more provisions to sell. She says "Thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for her store.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is thirty-five years old and married with six children, two sons and four daughters. Some of her children are in  senior high school while others are in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Martha works as a trader to help her husband provide for the family. Her husband is a food crop farmer. Martha trades in smoked fish, buying the fish from markets in nearby communities and selling at the local market.  She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure smoked fish in bulk. She is hopeful of giving her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha S. is forty-two years old. She is married and has five children, four sons and one daughter. Some of her children attend the senior high school while others go to junior high or primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She works to help her husband provide financially for the family. Her husband is a teacher by profession. Martha trades in smoked fish. She buys smoked fish from markets in nearby communities and sells from a tabletop at the local market. She has been in business for ten years and is asking for a loan to buy fish in bulk. Martha hopes to provide her children with the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: Hope O. is twenty-seven years old and single with no children. He has a store where he rents out chairs, and he also has a studio where he takes photographs. He hopes for a loan to purchase more chairs. He offers his thanks.

loans.use: To  purchase more chairs

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara E. is 56 years old. She is a widow with 7 children. She sells medicine. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN100,000 ($700 US) so that she can purchase more medicine to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia B. is 36 years old. She is married and has four children, one son and three daughters. She says one of her children is currently learning a trade. The rest are in junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the busy commercial town called Ejura, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Afia works to help her husband financially support the family. Her husband is a farmer and she is a baker. Afia bakes bread. She supplies the greater proportion of her product to retailers and beverage sellers. She buys bags of flour and other ingredients from nearby wholesale markets. She sells some of the bread at a table in the local market. Afia has been in business for twenty years and wants a loan so that she can purchase bags of flour and the other ingredients (margarine, sugar, etc.) in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education that she can afford.

loans.use: To purchase bulk flour, bulk ingredients for bread making.

loans.name: Essohazi Robert

texts.fr: Ce monsieur  a pour activité le commerce de boissons locales  alcoolisées appelées « DEHA », il exerce ce commerce depuis  2000, son ancienneté fait qu’il maîtrise bien ce commerce, il est marié et père de 02 enfants, c’est cette activité qui lui permet de subvenir aux charges de sa famille. Il prépare lui-même ces boissons à base de palmiers qu'il met dans des bidons. Ainsi son stock de boissons étant épuisé, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 250 palmiers afin de préparer la boisson.
texts.en:
This gentleman’s business involves commerce in local alcoholic drinks called “DEHA”. He has been in this business since 2000. His seniority means that he has a good command of his business. He is married and the father of two. This business is what enables him to provide for his family. He himself makes these drinks from palm trees. He puts the product into drums. Since his stock of drinks is exhausted, he’s requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 250 palm trees in order to make the beverage.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm trees to make drinks

loans.name: Osaretin

texts.en: Osaretin is 29 years old. She is married with no children. She rents VCDs (video compact discs) to her customers within her community to make a living. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 ($350 US) to purchase more VCDs. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more VCDs

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty O. is 32 years old and she is married with 4 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. She sells provisions. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN100,000 ($700 US) to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Mrs. Sen K., 47, has a small store next to her house where she sells produce items. She sells all kinds of vegetables, cooked ingredients, and sweets for kids. She earns an average of $3 per day to feed her family. K.'s husband, working as a military policeman, is the other source for the family's income. The humble couple has four children: two are teenagers and attend school, whilst the others are married and live separately. As K.'s business is the main source of income for the family, she has applied for a loan so that she can increase the size of her workshop. She plans to buy more products to sell so she can earn additional income.

loans.use: To increase size of workshop and to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Precious

texts.en: Precious W. is thirty years old and married with one child. She has a beauty salon where she styles hair for her customers, and she also sells cosmetics. She hopes for a loan to purchase more cosmetics to sell. She is thankful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Goodnews

texts.en: Goodnews E. is twenty-seven years old and married with one child. She sells provisions. She hopes for a loan to purchase more provisions to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline I. is thirty-two years old and married with two children. She sells clothes and shoes and hopes for a loan to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. Roseline is thankful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian O. is thirty-seven years old and married with five children. She sells drinks and hopes for a loan to purchase more drinks to sell. She sends her thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Etudo Xonam

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié à une femme qui est couturière, il est père de 02 enfants et réside avec sa famille dans le quartier d’adidogomé, il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale et c’est cette activité qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il a commencé ce commerce depuis 2005 . Son stock actuel est épuisé et il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit afin de s’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
This gentleman is married to a woman who is a seamstress. He is the father of two children and resides with his family in the Adidogomé district. His income-generating business involves commerce in grocery items. This business is what enables him to meet the needs of his family. He started this business in 2005. His current stock is exhausted, and he’s requesting his first loan from WAGES in order to buy grocery items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: Nuon K. is twenty-nine years old and lives in Pursat province in Cambodia where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows all kinds of crops, and plants twice a year. She is a good mother to five children, all of whom attend school. Her husband helps her in the farming business. Nuon will use the loan to pay for plowing and to grow a potato crop.

loans.use: To pay for plowing and to grow potatoes

loans.name: Abieyuwa

texts.en: Abieyuwa U. is 40 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is a tailor and she also sells tailoring materials like zippers, thread, lining, etc. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 (US $350) so that she can purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Ruos

texts.en: Mrs. Ruos R., 24, is a good homemaker who cares for children and cooks tasty meals for her family. She is married and has two children who are going to school. Besides her housework, she also helps her husband with his fishing business. The head of the family is Mrs. R.'s husband, who makes an income by catching fish in and around Tunle Sap Lake. Recently, R.'s husband has not been able to go fishing because he lacks necessary fishing equipment. R. has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase nets and traps for fishing.

loans.use: To purchase nets and traps for fishing.

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr: Cette femme est une résidente  du quartier d’avédji telessou,  elle a pour activité l’exploitation d’un débit de boisson local appelé « Tchouc », elle a commencé cette exploitation depuis 1998, elle prépare elle-même cette boisson à partir du mil, pour préparer efficacement cette boisson elle utilise le charbon de bois. Son stock de mil étant épuisé, elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter 03 sacs de mil, 10 bol de maïs, 01 sac de charbon de bois et divers. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants, avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce elle aide son époux dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
This woman is a resident of the Avédji Telessou district. Her business is a sales outlet for a local drink called “Tchouc”. She began this business in 1998. She herself makes this beverage from millet. To produce it effectively, she uses charcoal. Her stock of millet being exhausted, she’s requesting an initial loan from WAGES to buy three sacks of millet, ten bowls of corn, one sack of charcoal, and various items. She is married and the mother of five children. With what she earned from her commerce, she helps her husband with household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy millet, corn, and charcoal

loans.name: Tort

texts.en: Mrs. Tort M., 26, lives in Pursat province, Cambodia where she owns a farmland that she inherited from her grandparents. The farmland is used to grow crops, which she plants twice a year. She is a good mother of one lovely young child who is enrolled in school. She is married to Yeb, age 52, who sells wood-carvings that depends on wood from the forest. In order to help the family's physical labors in the farming work, M. is applying for a loan to buy a male buffalo so she can rent it out to other farmers to make additional income. (Mrs. M.'s husband, Yeb, is pictured.)

loans.use: To buy a male buffalo for farming use.

loans.name: Kep

texts.en: Mrs. K. L. is 27 years old and married. She currently lives in Pursat Province where she earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. The pigs are raised for their offspring and for slaughter. She has been running her business for more than four years and is currently earning approximately $2.50 per day. She has three children, all three of whom are single. To help cover a little more of the family's financial needs, her husband sells firewood. K. L. is applying for a loan, as capital, to buy a water buffalo and piglets to raise. (K. L.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is divorced with 4 children and has received an education through primary school. Since 2008, she has worked as a trader selling soft drinks and other food supplies at Bronybina near Elmina. Mary uses her income to pay for school fees and bills. She will use this loan to purchase more soft drinks in crates and other food supplies to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save and to work on completing part of her house.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks in crates and other food supplies to sell.

loans.name: Ruos

texts.en: Mrs. Ruos C., 51, sells a few grocery items from her home. Her husband Thol, 62, makes a living by driving a motorbike taxi. Besides their current work, they are also local rice cultivators. In order to support the business actions and to earn extra an income, C. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva. They will use the money to buy a cow for plowing their field and to purchase more grocery inventory to continue selling. The older couple has four children who are married and live independently.

loans.use: To purchase grocery inventory for selling and to also buy a cow to plow rice field.

loans.name: Balawè

texts.fr: Madame B. est une résidente du quartier d’anomè qui et un quartier périphérique de la  ville de Lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu depuis 2000 le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle  a ouvert à cet effet une boutique qu’elle a appelé « JARDIN DU COURAGE », son stock étant épuisé, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit afin de s’acheter 08 sacs de riz, 10 bidons d’huile, des cartons de pâtes alimentaires, 02 cartons de détergents « OMO » et d’autres produits d’alimentation générale. Elle est mariée et a 02 enfants
texts.en:
Ms. B. is a resident of Anomè, which is an outlying district of the city of Lomé. Since 2000, she has been earning revenues from her work selling grocery items. To do so, she opened a shop she called “JARDIN DU COURAGE”. Her inventory being exhausted, she wants to stock up again and is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to buy eight sacks of rice, ten drums of oil, some boxes of pasta, two boxes of OMO detergent, and other grocery items. She is married and has two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en: Since 1998, Matilda E. has worked as a trader selling porridge and donuts in Elmina.  She is married, has one child and has received an education through Senior High School. While Matilda works as a trader, her husband is employed as a taxi driver. She is responsible for paying school fees and her family’s light bill. Her loan will be used to buy more products such as oil, flour and millet. She will use these products to prepare the food that she sells. She hopes to save the new profits from her business so that she can build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for the porridge and donuts that she sells.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a taxi motorbike

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr: Cette femme a commencé depuis 2005 le commerce de charbons de bois, ce commerce marche bien pour elle, elle fait ce commerce en gros et en détail, étant la seule dans son quartier à exercer cette activité, elle arrive donc à réaliser d’importantes recettes. Elle veut agrandir son commerce pour cela elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 25 sacs de charbons de bois, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays plus précisément dans la ville de Sokodé parce que dans cette ville le sac de charbon de bois est moins coûteux. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce elle contribue avec son époux aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
In 2005, this woman started doing commerce in charcoal. Her business is doing well, operating wholesale and retail. Being the only one in her district in this business, she therefore manages to realize sizable revenues. She wants to expand her business. To do so, she’s requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 25 sacks of charcoal. Supplies are gotten from inland locations, in the city of Sokodé to be precise, because charcoal is less expensive there. She is married and the mother of three. With what she earns from her commerce, she helps her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Kayivi

texts.fr: Madame A. Kayivi vit à Agomé-Glozou dans la préfecture des lacs, localité dans laquelle elle est née en 1951. Mariée et mère de neuf (09) enfants, elle s’était investie très tôt dans sa jeunesse dans le fumage et la vente de poissons dans sa localité, une activité qui très lucrative qui lui permet de faire face aux besoins de sa famille. Pour répondre aux sollicitations de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, elle sollicite un financement en vue de d’accroître sa capacité production et ses revenus. Ce qui lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et celle de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. A. Kayivi lives in Agomé-Glozou, in Lacs prefecture, where she was born in 1951. She is married and the mother of nine. Very soon in her youth, she had invested herself in the smoking and selling of fish in her town. It’s a very lucrative business enabling her to address family needs. To respond to the requests of her evermore numerous customers, she’s requesting financing with the goal of growing her production capacity and her revenues. This will enable her to improve living conditions for her and her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To smoke and sell fish

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary C. is married, has 2 children and has received an education through Senior High School. Since 1997, she has worked as a trader selling items such as red oil, coconut oil and palm kernel oil at Boatse, near Elmina.  While Mary is employed as a trader, her husband works as a fisherman. Mary uses her income to help her husband in paying school fees. Mary will use the loan to purchase more oil for selling. Mary plans to save and reinvest the new profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: To purchase more oil for selling.

loans.name: Sogbadji

texts.fr: Mme A. Sogbadji est âgée d’une quarante deux (42) ans. Elle est mariée et a à sa charge cinq (05) enfants. Elle mène comme activité la vente de légumes (piments secs, oignons, ails…) et des poissons fumés dans le marché de son village. Sa clientèle devenant de plus en plus nombreuse, elle sollicite un crédit pour constituer un stock suffisant de marchandises afin de répondre aux demandes de ses clients. Cela va doper ses revenus et améliorer ses conditions sur le plan économique.
texts.en:
Ms. A. Sogbadji is 42 years old. She is married and has five children to support. Her work involves selling vegetables (dried chili peppers, onions, garlic,...) and smoked fish at the marketplace of her village. Because her customers are becoming more and more numerous, she's requesting a loan to build up a big enough stock of merchandise to respond to the demands of her customers. This will boost her revenues and improve her financial situation.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell vegetables and smoked fish

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr: Agée de quarante sept (47) ans, Mme Thérèse M. est mariée avec quatre (04) enfants à charge. C’est une femme très dynamique qui se bat pour le devenir de ses enfants et de sa famille. Pour cela, elle mène comme activité la préparation et la vente de la bouillie à base de mais tous les matins dans son village. Cette activité lui permet de faire face aux besoins élémentaires de ses enfants. Pour accroître ses bénéfices, elle sollicite un crédit pour constituer un stock important de mais, matière de base entrant dans la préparation de la bouillie.
texts.en:
Ms. Thérèse M., age 47, is married and has four children in her care. This is a very energetic woman who struggles for her the future of her children and family. To do so, she has a business making and selling cornmeal porridge each morning in her village. This enables her to address the essential needs of her children. To grow her profits, she's requesting a loan to build up a sizable stock of corn, the basic ingredient that goes into making the porridge.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock corn for selling porridge

loans.name: Sergiu

texts.en: Sergiu S. runs a business in furniture making. The business has been launched by his wife. Sergiu mostly works growing grain. In 2005, Sergiu took a loan in the amount of 50 000 lei for a term of 2 years from Microinvest. That loan was used towards the purchase of additional agricultural machinery, three tractors and arable land to grow cereals grains. He reimbursed all debt without any delay. Now, Sergiu and his wife, have two furniture stores. In May, they opened an office where the production of furniture is made under individually requests from their customers. At the moment he buys furniture accessories like glass, handle, laminated parquet from Mobvaro SRL, with which has an agreement. Monthly, customers order 30-40 units of furniture sets. The purpose of this is to purchase a lathe.

loans.use: to purchase a lathe.

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en: Since 2000, Agartha P. has worked as a trader selling various items including clothes and maize at Bronybina, near Elmina. She is married, has one child and has received an education through Primary School. While Agatha works as a trader, her husband is employed as a carpenter.  Her loan will be used to buy more goods, including clothing, for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more goods including clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more shoes

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah B. is married, has one child and has received an education through Senior High School. Since 2006, she has worked as a trader selling canned tomatoes, beans and rice at Elmina. While Sarah works as a trader, her husband is employed as a computer mechanic. Sarah will use the loan to purchase more food supplies for selling. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sarah plans to save towards buying a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies for selling.

loans.name: Vasyl

texts.en:
Vasyl sells manufactured retail items in the central market of his home town. He has been in this business for seven years. Currently, his income amounts to 5,000 Hryvnia. He is married with two beautiful daughters. His family lives in Khoost.

Vasyl can be characterized as a businessman of honesty and responsibility. His experience working in the accounting sphere has helped him manage his finances and distribute profit reasonably. Vasyl is seeking this loan of 6,000 Hryvnia to re-stock his merchandise. One of his long-term plans is to open new vending locations and expand his trade as a result.

loans.use: To refresh his inventory

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married. She and her husband, Ivan, live in Khoost. Mariya earns her living by working as a market entrepreneur in the central market of her home town. She sells household goods. Mariya has been in the market for 10 years. She has her own clientele who always come to buy certain products from her. Her net profit is about 3,000 Hryvnia. 

Mariya’s business can be characterized as stable and consistently growing. She is always very friendly with her customers. Mariya enjoys her work, and it shows through in her attitude and business approach. This time she is requesting a loan of 7,000 Hryvnia to increase assorted merchandise and increase her sales as a result.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is married and has two daughters who are 19 and 13 years old. They live in Vasilyevka. Yuryi sells groceries from his little food store. His vending location is well known for good prices that are lower than market prices. Yuryi knows his customers’ preferences and always offers them only good quality groceries. He has been in the grocery trade for about 7 years. His business has been marked with consistent stability. Currently, his gross income is about 12,000 Hryvnia a month. 

Yuryi is running a neat small grocery store. He is hoping to invest a loan of 7,000 Hryvnia in additional merchandise which will help him increase his turnover capital eventually. Yuryi has a vision for the expansion of his trade and we believe it will be helpful in his entrepreneurial endeavors. The loan will help Yuryi to persist, take small steps at a time and achieve success which we think will be absolutely inevitable.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more products

loans.name: Elda Karina

texts.es:
Elda Karina es casada, tiene 32 años de edad y 2 hijos pequeños, los dos asisten a la escuela primaria, su esposo es vendedor ambulante y le ayuda con los gastos de su casa.  Su negocio es una tienda de productos básicos y además tiene una tortillería a la cual le puso el nombre de “Tonny”.
El préstamo lo necesita para invertir un poco más en sus negocios, ella quiere invertir en la compra de más alimentos como arroz, frijoles, aceite y otros.
Su sueño es incrementar su negocio, tener mayores ingresos, y sacar adelante a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Elda Karina is married, 32 years old, and has 2 small children who are in elementary school. Her husband is a traveling salesman and he helps cover the household bills. Her business is a market of basic proucts and she also has a tortilla shop that she named "Tonny". She needs this loan in order to invest in her business endeavors. She would like to invest in the purchase of items such as rice, beans, oil, and more. Her dream is to grow her business, earn more money, and move forward with her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise for her market and tortilla shop

loans.name: Estefana

texts.es:
Estefana es viuda, tiene 52 años de edad y 4 hijos, ya todos mayores de edad y casados.  Ella tiene una tienda llamada “Buenos aires” en la cual vende artículos de primera necesidad, también vende gas y agua por garrafones. Su negocio se encuentra en Villa Nueva, Guatemala.
Ella necesita un nuevo crédito para surtir su tienda,  y de esta forma obtener más ganancias.  Su sueño en manejar un capital propio u obtener mejores ganancias, ya que es única proveedora de ingresos en su familia.
texts.en:
Estefan is a widow, 52 years old, and has 4 children who are all married adults. She has a shop named "Buenos Aires" where she sells basic need items, such as gas and water by the jug. Her business is located in Villa Nueva, Guatemala. She needs a loan in order to grow her business and earn more profits. Her dream is to manage her own money and earn higher profits, especially since she is the main provider for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise for her store that sells basic need items

loans.name: Sveta

texts.en:
Sveta is raising a son on her own. She is used to handling many routine issues herself and knows how to manage her small venture really skillfully. Sveta is an entrepreneur from Novomoskovsk, southeast of Ukraine. She runs a business selling women’s lingerie in the central city market. Her venture has been characterized by stable and consistent growth and development in the last 8 years. Currently, her profit amounts to 2,500 Hryvnia a month.

Sveta’s merchandise is always in demand. She likes to please her customer’s tastes and always tries to refresh her stock whenever she can. This time, Sveta is requesting a loan of 6,000 Hryvnia to increase assorted lingerie items and further increase her trade. Her desire to persist and succeed is a solid guarantee of current loan repayment.

loans.use: To purchase assorted inventory

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is a single mom. She is raising her son on her own and works really hard to meet all the needs of their family and pay her bills. Irina lives in Novomoskovsk and sells denim clothing in the central marketplace. Irina has been running this business for 15 years. Her income is 4,500 Hryvnia a month. 

Some of her strongest entrepreneurial characteristics are integrity and consistency. Irina is very determined. She tries to remain optimistic in every situation. This time, she is seeking a loan of 16,400 Hryvnia to purchase assorted inventory, attract new potential customers (which is difficult in the current financial recession), and help her build her sales.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela es comerciante de productos cosméticos de la línea AVON que  comercializa en la ciudad de La Paz y El Alto; ella es estudiante de la Universidad Salesiana de la Carrera de  Ciencia de la Educación; sus ingresos le permiten cubror su manutención. Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Villa Cooperativa – Rió Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de más cosméticos para incrementar su capital de operaciones en la activad que ella tiene.

Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la calificación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Mariela sells AVON products in the cities of La Paz and El Alto. Her income allows her to cover the tuition for a degree in education at the Universidad Salesiana. She lives in her parents' house in Villa Cooperativa – Río Seco, El Alto. She will use this loan to purchase more cosmetics and increase her working capital. This is her first loan with Impro, but she has been approved for receiving the requested sum.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to expand her business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es pequeño agricultor y productora de leche de vaca con que elabora quesos por cantidad para la comercialización de los mismo en las ferias populares de la ciudad de La Paz; el esposo trabaja de obrero de tractorista en el pueblo; estas actividades son su principal fuente de ingreso con las que cubren la manutención de sus dos hijos de 1 y 4 años de edad; viven en la casa de sus padres ubicado en la Provincia Ingavi – Achica Baja (a dos horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto). 

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad lo cual le ayudará a obtener mas leche para la producción de  quesos y mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es el cuarto  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle este préstamo.
texts.en:
Margarita is a small agricultural and dairy farmer who makes cheeses and sells them in the markets of La Paz. Her husband works as a tractor driver in the town. These activities are their main sources of income, which they use to support their two children, 1 and 4 years old. They live in their parents' house, which is in Achica Baja, in Ingavi Province, two and a half hours from El Alto. She will use the loan to purchase a dairy cow, which will give her more milk for her cheese production and increase her income. This is her fourth loan from Impro, and she has been approved because of her history of faithful payment.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow to increase her cheese production

loans.name: Estefa

texts.es:
Estefa es persona de la tercera edad pero sigue trabajando como pequeño agricultor y productora de leche de vaca con la que elabora quesos para la comercialización de los mismo en la feria de Viacha; esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de su hija y nieta; viven en casa propia ubicado en la Provincia Ingavi – Achica Baja (a dos horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto). 

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad para obtener mas leche y aumentar su producción de  quesos.
 
Es el cuarto  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle este préstamo.
texts.en:
Estefa is now elderly but she is still working as a small agricultural and dairy farmer. She uses the cows' milk to make cheeses, which she sells at the Viacha market. This is her primary source of income, and she uses it to support her daughter and granddaughter. They live in a house they own in Provincia Ingavi – Achica Baja, two and a half hours from the city of El Alto. She will use the loan to buy a dairy cow to get more milk and increase her cheese production. This is her fourth loan with Impro, and her history of faithful payment has ensured its approval.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow to increase her cheese production

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es pequeña agricultora y productora de leche de vaca con la que elabora quesos por cantidad para la comercialización de los mismo en las ferias populares de la ciudad de El Alto y La Paz; vive con sus dos hijos de 14 y 15 años quienes le ayuda en el cuidado de las vacas; viven en casa propia ubicado en la Provincia Ingavi – Achica Baja (a dos horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto). 

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad  para incrementar la producción de  quesos que son muy requeridos en la feria y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es el tercer  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarlo otro préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Julia is a small agricultural and dairy farmer who makes cheeses and sells them in the markets of El Alto and La Paz. She lives with her two children, 14 and 15 years old, who help her take care of the cows. They live in their own home in Provincia Ingavi – Achica Baja, two and a half hours from El Alto. She will use the loan to purchase a dairy cow, which will give her more milk for her cheese production and increase her income. This is her third loan from Impro, and she has been approved because of her history of faithful payment.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow to increase her cheese production

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
Isidora es persona de la tercera edad pero sigue trabajando como pequeña agricultora y productora de leche de vaca con la que elabora quesos para la comercialización de los mismo en la feria de Viacha; esta es su principal fuente de ingreso con la que cubre sus gastos personales; viven en casa propia ubicado en la Provincia Ingavi – Achica Baja (a dos horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto). 

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de una vaca lecheras de mediana calidad misma que la ayudará para mejorar la producción de los quesos y mejorar sus posibilidades de mayores ingresos.
 
Es el cuarto  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarlo otro préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Isidora is now elderly but continues to work as a small agricultural and dairy farmer. She uses the cows' milk to make cheeses, which she sells at the Viacha market. This is her primary source of income, and she uses it for living expenses. She lives in her own house in Provincia Ingavi – Achica Baja, two and a half hours from the city of El Alto. She will use the loan to buy a dairy cow, which will help her increase her cheese production and expand her income opportunities. This is her fourth loan with Impro, and her history of faithful payment has ensured its approval.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow to increase her cheese production

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza
Felicitas es casada, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Felicitas viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende verduras y ropa a pedido, a donde viaja los días lunes y regresa los días viernes, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado de la ciudad de San Francisco.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa.
Los sueños de Felicitas son ayudar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales, mejorar su negocio y tener un negocio en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Banco Comunal Alianza. She is married, 50 years old, and has four children. On Mondays she travels to the jungle around Ayacucho to sell vegetables and clothing in the city of San Francisco, and returns home on Fridays. Felicitas needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will invest in purchasing clothing. Her dreams are to help her children become successful, to expand her business, and to establish a business in the city of Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora es pequeña agricultora y productora de leche de vaca con la que elabora quesos por cantidad para la comercialización de los mismo en las ferias populares de la ciudad de El Alto; vive con su hijo que trabaja de transportista inter provincial.
