Lleva 5 años en este trabajo y lo más difícil es trasladar las artesanías desde su taller hasta su puesto, debido a que son muchos los fardos que lleva. Para el futuro, espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad sus prendas. Este es el segundo préstamo de Mery con MFP y al igual como hizo con su primer préstamo, está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy responsable, ya que siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en el grupo. Con los 1000 soles comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad de prendas que teje y aumentar el stock de su puesto.
texts.en:
Mery is a 23 year old young woman who is very hard working and dedicated. She lives in the house that she inherited from her parents and hopes to be able to get ahead with her work. Her craft stand is located in the San José market (an important market in the city of Juliaca), which is very busy due to the attractive and original models that she weaves. She always receives her clients, who are primarily tourists, with a smile and she very happily shows them the crafts that she sells. What she likes most about her work is to weave as since she was a young girl she has had a lot of passion for this art. She has been doing this work for 5 years and the most difficult part is to transport her crafts from her workshop to her stand as there are many bundles that she brings. In the future she hopes to have a larger store where she can sell her items with greater ease. This is Mery's second loan with MFP and like she did with her first loan she is prepared to make all of her payments on time. In her communal bank she is very responsible as she is always up to date on the agreements at which the group arrives. With the 1000 soles she will buy more wool to increase the quantity of items that she weaves and increase her stand's stock.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es: Natividad es una mujer de 36 años, cuya meta es tener una mejor vida, vive en su propia casa la cual construyó con mucho esfuerzo, sabe que todos los sacrificios que hace son por tener la vida que siempre soñó. Tiene un taller de metales, en el cual realiza estructuras metálicas como triciclos, carretillas, estantes, etc, sus productos son muy solicitados debido al buen acabado que tienen, cuanta con dos trabajadores que la ayudan a cumplir con los pedidos rápidamente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es entregar a tiempo los pedidos que le hacen, lleva 8 años en este negocio y lo que le resulta más difícil es transportar los metales desde el lugar donde los compra hasta su taller. Para el futuro, espera hacer crecer su negocio y convertirlo en uno de los talleres más importantes de Juliaca. Este es el primer préstamo de Natividad con MFP y está dispuesta a trabajar mucho para pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy alegre y responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los 1000 soles solicitados planea comprar más metales para fabricar más estructuras metálicas y así mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Natividad is a woman of 36 years of age whose goal is to have a better life. She lives in her own home which she built with great effort. She knows that all of the sacrifices that she makes are to be able to have the life of which she has always dreamed. She has a metal workshop in which she makes metal structures such as tricycles, wheelbarrows, shelves, etc, Her products are in high demand because of the good finishing that they have. She has two workers who help her to finish the orders quickly. What she most likes about her work is to deliver the orders on time. She has been in this business for 8 years and what is most difficult for her is to transport the metals from the place where she buys them to the workshop. In the future she hopes to grow her business and make it into one of the most important workshops of Juliaca. This is Natividad's first loan with MFP and she is prepared to work hard to make all of the payments on time. In her communal bank she is very happy and responsible and this is why she is much loved by the rest of its members. With the 1000 soles requested she plans to buy more metals to build more metallic structures and through this improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Metal

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es: Nelida tiene 45 años, siempre ha luchado por salir adelante y mejorar su vida, vive en su propia casa con sus 3 hijos; Edwin de 26, Jesús de 23 y Cinthia de 7 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Su negocio es la venta de bolsas de mercado, las cuales sale a vender a la calle de forma ambulante, en busca de clientes que deseen llevarse una de sus llamativas bolsas, sus coloridos productos son muy solicitados en los mercados, ya que la gente siempre tiene cosas que llevar hasta su hogar. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes e informarse de las cosas que suceden en su localidad. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil para ella es tener que caminar todo el día bajo el intenso sol, lo cual la cansa mucho y hace que las fuerzas se le gasten, aun así sabe que esforzándose mucho lograra alcanzar sus metas. Para el futuro, espera tener un pequeño puesto donde pueda vender sus bolsas de mercado sin tener que caminar tanto. Este es el primer préstamo de Nelida con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo si no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy admirada por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los 1000 soles solicitados planea comprar más bolsas de mercado para incrementar la cantidad que vende.
texts.en:
Nelida, 45 years old, has always struggled to get ahead and improve her life. She lives in her own house with her 3 children; Edwin 26 years old, Jesús 23 years old and Cinthia, 7 years of age, who are the reason for all of her efforts. Her business is the sale of shopping bags, which she sells in the street as a traveling salesperson in search of customers who wish to take one of her attractive bags. Her colorful products are in high demand in the market as people always have things that they need to take home. What she likes most about her work is to speak with her customers and find out about the things happening in her area. She has been doing this activity for 20 years and the most difficult thing for her it to have to walk all day under the intense sun, which tires and exhausts her, although she knows she is working hard to be able to achieve her goals. In the future she hopes to have a small stand where she can sell her shopping bags without having to walk so much. This is Nelida’s first loan with MFP and she knows that she has to make all of her payments on time if she does not want to cause problems for the members of her communal bank where she is very admired for the responsibility that she demonstrates. With the 1000 soles requested she plans to buy more shopping bags to increase the quantity that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Increase Merchandise

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia es una joven muy alegre, tiene 23 años, vive en un cuarto alquilado y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, para ello, está dispuesta a trabajar mucho. Recorre las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca en busca de artefactos usados para comprar, posteriormente los arregla y vende, puesto que se dedica a la venta de artefactos de segunda mano, negocio muy rentable, ya que tiene muchos clientes que compran sus artefactos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es arreglar los artefactos, se distrae mucho haciéndolo, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil es recolectar los artefactos usados, ya que la gente no quiere venderlos a precios bajos, aun así Patricia sigue recorriendo las calles, con el firme propósito de tener una vida más digna. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está muy decidida a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente para acceder a otro préstamo posteriormente, en su banco comunal es muy tranquila y siempre está atenta a los acuerdos a los que llegan las demás socias. Patricia invertirá los 1000 que solicita en la compra de más artefactos usados, para después de arreglarlos venderlos.
texts.en:
Patricia is a very happy young woman who is 23 years old. She lives in a rented room and has a great desire to get ahead for which she is prepared to work hard. She travels the streets of Juliaca in search of items to buy, which she then fixes and sells as her business is the sale of second-hand goods. The business is very profitable as she already has many clients who buy her items. What she most likes about her work is fixing the items as she entertains herself doing it. She has been doing this activity for 5 years and the most difficult thing is to collect the used items as people do not want to sell them at low prices. Even so, Patricia continues traveling through the streets with the firm purpose of having a more dignified life. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is very dedicated to making all of her payments punctually to be able to access another loan in the future. In her communal bank she is very calm and is always mindful of the agreements that the other members make. Patricia will invest the 1000 that she is requesting in the purchase of used items to then fix and sell them.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Merchandise

loans.name: Ronal

texts.es: Ronal es un joven muy conciente y trabajador, a sus 19 años vive en un cuarto alquilado y lo que más desea es culminar sus estudios universitarios, para poder sobresalir en la vida. Su juventud no fue un impedimento para que pudiera poner su negocio de llamadas telefónicas, el cual es muy concurrido, ya que está ubicado en un lugar muy céntrico, como es el mercado Laykakota (mercado importante de la ciudad de Puno), cuenta actualmente con 4 cabinas, las cuales le dan los ingresos necesarios para pagar sus estudios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede aprovechar el internet que utiliza el locutorio, para realizar sus trabajos universitarios e investigar sobre algunos temas. Lleva un año en esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su negocio, teniendo que cerrar sólo cuando va a la universidad. Sus anhelos son terminar sus estudios y mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es el primer préstamo de Ronal con MFP y está dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy querido, ya que es el más joven del grupo. Con los 1000 soles solicitados planea poner una cabina más, para así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Ronal is a very conscientious and hard working young man. At the age of 19 he lives in a rented room and what he most desires is to finish his university studies to be able to get ahead in life. His youth was not an impediment for him to open his call center business, which is very busy as it is located in a very central location, the Laykakota market (important market of the city of Puno). He currently has 4 cabins, which gives him the income necessary to pay for his studies. What he most likes about his work is that he can take advantage of the internet that the call center uses to do his university projects and research about some topics. He has been doing this activity for a year and what he likes least is having to remain inside of the business all day long, only closing when he goes to the university. His wishes are to finish his studies and improve his quality of life. This is his first loan with MFP and he is prepared to make all of his payments on time. In his communal bank he is much loved as she is the youngest in the group. With the 1000 soles requested he plans to add another cabin to be able to improve his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add a telephone cabin to his business

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria G. D. C. vive en Cuscatlan departamento Cojutepeque junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Ana posee su propio negocio, una pupuseria y venta D. huacales, a pesar que Ana llego hasta el nivel básico D. estudios, esto no ha sido impedimento en llevar una buena administración en sus negocios prueba D. ello es, que tiene 10 años D. atender y administrar la pupuseria y la venta D. huacales. El  esposo D. Ana también trabaja, aunque fuera D. casa, ya que él se dedica a la mecánica automotriz donD. obtiene ingresos diarios D. 12 $ , mismo dinero que la familia utiliza para los gastos D. la casa. Ana solicita un crédito para comprar materiales utilizados para la elaboración D. las pupusas como frijoles, aceite, maíz y también para surtir su inventario D. huacales.
texts.en:
Ana Maria G. D. C. lives in the Department of Cuscatlan in Cojutepeque together with her husband and two children. Ana has her own business, a pupusa shop and she sells wooden crates. Although Ana only has an elementary school education this has not been an impediment to the good administration of her businesses. Proof of this is that she has been attending to and administering her pupusa shop and selling wooden crates for 10 years. Ana's husband works outsiD. of the home. He works as an automobile mechanic where he gets daily wages of $12, which is the money that the family uses for the household expenses. Ana is requesting a loan to buy materials used to make pupusas such as beans, oil, and corn and to diversify her inventory of wooden crates.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for the pupusa shop and purchase of wooden crates

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago es un joven de 29 años, muy alegre y conciente de que tiene que trabajar duro para sobresalir en la vida, vive en la casa de sus padres a quienes desea dar una buena vejez. Santiago pasa sus días manejando su taxi, no importa si es de día o de noche, sigue recorriendo las calles en busca de clientes que deseen llegar sanos y seguros a su destino, su ánimo alegre y sus dotes de conversador hacen que los clientes lo busquen para que los movilice, además que conoce muy bien las calles de la ciudad de Puno y siempre brinda un servicio rápido. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es pasear por las calles, ya que se distrae mucho, lleva 10 años realizando este trabajo y lo que menos le gusta es tener que lidiar con algunos pasajeros que no quieren pagar, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y tiene que realizarlo. Para el futuro espera comprar otro taxi y hacerlo trabajar para mejorar sus ingresos. Este es el primer préstamo de Santiago con MFP y está dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable y solidario. Con los 1000 soles que solicita hará arreglar su taxi, que con el paso del tiempo ha ido sufriendo daños.
texts.en:
Santiago is a young man who is 29 years old. He is very happy and aware that he has to work hard to survive in life. He lives in his parents’ house, and he wants to give them a good old age. Santiago drives a taxi. It doesn’t matter if it’s day or night; he continues traveling the streets in search of clients that want to arrive safely and soundly at their destination. He has a happy demeanor, and his conversational skills make his clients look for him to take them around. In addition, he knows the streets in the city of Puno well and always offers a fast service. What he likes most about his work is driving through the streets, since it passes the time. He has spent 10 years in this job, and what he likes least is to have to fight with some passengers that don’t want to pay, even though they know this is his job and he has to do it. For the future, he hopes to buy another taxi and use it for work in order to improve his earnings. This is Santiago’s first loan with MFP, and he is ready to pay all of her payments on time. He is a very responsible and supportive member of his community bank. With the 1000 soles that she requests, he will repair his taxi, which, over time, has been damaged.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia es una mujer admirable por el empeño que le pone a las cosas que hace, tiene 39 años y vive en un cuarto alquilado, ella está dispuesta a cualquier sacrificio con tal de tener una vida mejor. Su negocio de venta de golosinas está ubicado en uno de los parques más importantes de la ciudad de Juliaca, ha puesto todo su empeño en hacer de su pequeño negocio uno de los más concurridos por lo clientes, los cuales la prefieren debido a la amabilidad con que los trata. Los 10 años que lleva en este negocio le han servido para ganarse un lugar preferencial en el parque, ya que está ubicada en la esquina más transitada, donde es mucho más fácil de encontrarla. Lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, pero lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto sin poder ir a ningún lado. Para el futuro, espera tener una tienda de golosinas, la cual le pueda dar mejores ingresos. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, en su primer crédito fue muy puntual y espera poder serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida. Con los 2000 soles que solicita planea comprar más productos para incrementar la mercadería que vende.
texts.en:
Sonia is an admirable woman because of the effort that she has put into the things that she has. She is 39 years old and lives in a rented room. She is ready for any sacrifices as long as she has a better life. Her sweets-selling business is located in one of the most important parks in the city of Juliaca. She has put all of her effort into having her small business be one of the most popular with clients, who prefer her business because of kindness with which she treats them. The 10 years that she has spent in this business have allowed her to earn a preferred location in the park, since it located in the busiest corner, where it is a lot easier to find her. What she likes most is to talk with the neighboring merchants, but what she likes least is to have to spend all day in her stand without being able to go anywhere. For the future, she hopes to have a sweets store, which will give her more earnings. This is her second loan with MFP. In her first loan, she was very punctual and hopes to continue that now as well. She is a very beloved member of her community bank. With the 2000 soles that she requests, she plans to buy most products to increase the merchandise that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora Alicia M. R. vive en el departamento de Ahuachapán, Dora está acompañada y tiene solo una hija de 10 años de edad, Dora tiene una venta de verduras donde posee 10 años de experiencia en este negocio, Dora obtiene buenas ventas;  ya que su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la terminal de buses de Ahuachapán, donde sus clientes la buscan por que los precios son muy buenos al igual que sus productos, Dora está solicitando este crédito por que quiere comprar variedad de verduras para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dora Alicia M. R. lives in the department of Ahuachapán. Dora is accompanied and has one ten-year-old daughter. Dora sells vegetables, which she has spent ten years working. Dora has good sales, since her business is located in the Ahuachapán bus station, where her clients look for her because her prices and products are very good. Dora is requesting this loan because she wants to buy a variety of vegetables to offer her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina es una señora de 44 años, está casada, tiene 5 hijos, 4 de ellos ya son adultos y viven  en Lima, y sólo uno los acompaña en sus jornadas de cultivo. Con una enorme sonrisa nos muestra sus cultivos de lechugas, las cuales ha sembrado en su  chacra al costado de su casa. También siembra papa, alverjas y olluco, cuyas ganancias le han servido para educar y mantener a sus hijos, que gracias a su trabajo les brindó la secundaria completa en la ciudad de Tarma. Catalina trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, por ello se levanta a las 4.00am para preparar los desayunos y el almuerzo para después ir a trabajar, con la finalidad de terminar de educar a su último hijo. Ahora está viendo la posibilidad de sembrar de forma paralela las hortalizas y los tubérculos, para evitar tener meses sin dinero suficiente, ya que la cosecha de lechugas las realiza cada dos a tres meses. Este es su 4to crédito con MFP, y al igual que en sus anteriores préstamos se compromete a pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas. El dinero que viene solicitando en esta oportunidad es para la compra de fertilizantes para el abonado de sus chacras.
texts.en:
Catalina is a forty-four-year-old woman, is married and has 5 children, four of whom are adults and live in Lima. Only one of her children accompanies her in the farm. With a big smile, she shows us her lettuce crops, which she has sown in her farm next to her house. She also sows potatoes, peas, and olluco (a tuber), whose earnings have allowed her to educate and take care of her children. Thanks to her work, she offered her children complete secondary educations in the city of Tarma. Catalina works with her husband. She wakes up at 4:00 am to make breakfast and lunch and later goes to work, with the goal of finishing funding the education of her last child. Now, she is seeing the possibility of sowing vegetables and tubers at the same time, so that she can avoid having months without enough money, since the lettuce harvest occurs every two or three months. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and just like in her previous loans, she promises to pay her installments punctually. The money that she is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers to fertilize her farms.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Mavila

texts.es:
La señora Mavila tiene 55 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen del Carmen y  vive en el sector Santa Rosa del sector de Cochaya  caserío de Salpo,  provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudio hasta quinto grado de primaria, pero no continuó estudiando debido a que no contaba con el apoyo de sus padres, pues su situación económica era muy precaria.
Se unió con su pareja a los 35 años y actualmente tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales solo uno trabaja independientemente.
Su actividad económica consiste en la venta de gaseosas, galletas y compra-venta de quesos.
Su primer crédito fue de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas lo que invirtió en su negocio.
Con este crédito de 500 soles, el cual cancelará en 6 cuotas, comprará quesos e insumos para la implementación de su bodega.
Mavila sueña con tener un negocio muy grande.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mavila is 55 years old. She belongs to the Virgin of Carmen Community Bank and lives in the area of Santa Rosa in Cochaya in the hamlet of Salpo in the province of Otuzco, La Libertad, Perú. She has studied until fifth grade of primary school, but she didn’t continue studying because she didn’t have the support of her parents, because their financial situation was very precarious. She has been married with her husband for 35 years and, at present, she has 5 children, of whom only one works independently. She sells sodas, cookies, and buys and sells cheeses. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she repaid in 4 installments, and she invested it in her business. With this loan of 500 soles, which she will repay in 6 installments, she will buy cheese and supplies to stock her store. Mavila dreams of having a very big business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheese and supplies to stock her store

loans.name: Crecia

texts.es: Crecia es una madre de 41 años de edad, está casada, tiene 5 hijos quienes viven en su casa apoyándola en los trabajos agrícolas. Se levanta muy temprano, para preparar el almuerzo y eso de las 8.00am parte a la chacra donde la espera su esposo. Tanto ella como sus hijos tiene que caminar de 2 a 3 kilómetros para llegar a sus terrenos temporales, donde sólo siembran papas y arvejas.  Pero desde hace 2 años cuentan con chacras de regadío ubicadas cerca de su casa donde vienen sembrando hortalizas como col, lechugas, cebollas chinas etc, ya que estos productos le son muy rentables en los meses de enero, febrero y marzo.  Es por ello, que a estos terrenos no los deja descansar, y constantemente los viene abonado con fertilizantes químicos, para hacer muy fértil la tierra. Crecia observa con mucha atención e interés el desarrollo de cada una de sus plantas y de ese modo va cultivándolas las veces que requieran y detectando las posibles plagas que puedan acechar. Ella está muy complacida con sus sembríos, ya que la agricultura le brinda los recursos suficientes para vivir cómodamente. Son cuatro prestamos consecutivos que ya ha solicitado Crecia con MFP y no ha tenido ningún problema con sus pagos, ya que los ha cumplido con regularidad, en su banco comunal es muy activa y preocupada por los demás integrantes. El dinero que solicita lo plantea invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos, calcula que le costará alrededor de 2000 soles, con el resto del dinero comprará víveres para el consumo familiar.
texts.en:
Crecia is a mother, who is 41 years old. She is married and has 5 children, who live in her house, supporting her in the agricultural work. She wakes up very early to make breakfast, and from 8:00 am, she goes to the farm, where she waits for her husband. She and her children have to walk 2 or 3 kilometers to arrive at her temporary land, where they only grow potatoes and peas. For the last 2 years, though, they have counted on the irrigated farms located near the house where they sow vegetables like cabbage, lettuce, Chinese onions, etc, since these products are very profitable in the months of January, February, and March. Because of this, these lands do not lay fallow and they are always fertilized with chemical fertilizers, which make the land very fertile. Crecia watches the growth of each of her plants with a lot of attention and interest, and, in this way, she cultivates them for the times they require and detects the possible pests that can threaten them. She is very pleased with her fields, since agriculture offers her sufficient resources to live comfortably. She has requested four consecutive loans from MFP and has not had any problem with her payments, since she has complied regularly. In her community bank, she is very active and is worried about the rest of the members. She plans to use the money she requests to invest in the purchase of chemical fertilizers. She calculates that this will cost her around 2000 soles, and with the rest of the money, she will buy supplies for the family’s consumption.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La señora Delia es socia del Banco Manuela Ramos  del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente tiene 1 hijo, vive en el Jr. Cristo Rey barrio Alianza y cuenta con estudios de segundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año e inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio, ella venda carne de ganado vacuno.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mayor cantidad de productos para su negocio, comprará carne de ganado vacuno.  Su mayor deseo es construir su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Delia is a member of the Manuela Ramos Bank in the district of Mazocruz, in the province of Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 23 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child. She lives in Jr. Cristo Rey in the Alianza neighborhood. She has completed secondary school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 1 year and began with a loan of 300 new soles, which allowed her to increase the capital for her business. She sells cattle meat. At present, she needs a new loan in the amount of 500 new soles. This loan will allow her to buy more products for her business. She will buy cattle meat. She biggest dream is to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle meat

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther es una señora de 50 años, está casada, tiene 6 hijos, 5 de ellos migraron a la capital, y  ahora viven con el último en su casa, quien la apoya en todos los trabajos que realiza. Desde niña se ha dedicado a las labores agrícolas y está muy contenta con los trabajos que realiza, además que cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, por lo que los trabajos de la chacra no los siente tan pesados. Una vez que han cosechado sus productos, los dos son los encargados de comercializarlos en el mercado de la ciudad  de Tarma. Para ellos, se preparan desde las 11.00pm hasta la 1.00am poniendo su carga en un camión, y eso de 4.00am ya están en el mercado. La última vez se dieron con la sorpresa de que el saco de la papa había bajado y sus ventas no les resultaran muy rentables. Esther viene trabajando su 4to crédito consecutivo con MFP y en todo este tiempo ha sido responsable, así como los demás integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para que realice el barbecho (preparar la tierra para la siembra) de sus chacras temporales, asimismo comprará fertilizantes químicos para abonar.
texts.en:
Esther is a 50 year old woman who is married and has 6 children. Five of her children have moved to the capital. She and her husband live with the youngest, who supports them in all of the work they do. Since she was a child she has done agricultural work and is very happy with the work she does. She also has the support of her husband, which makes the farm work feel less burdensome. Once Esther and her husband have harvested their crops, they sell them in the market in the city of Tarma. To do this, they work from 11pm until 1am loading their products onto a truck, and at 4am they are in the market. The last time, they were surprised by a drop in the price of a sack of potatoes, and their sales were not very profitable. Esther has taken out 4 consecutive loans with MFP and during this entire time she has been responsible, like the other members of her communal bank. The money that she is requesting is to prepare the fallow land for planting on her seasonal plots, and to purchase chemical fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Prepare her land and purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Florinda tiene 46 años, es casada, tiene 7 hijos, D. los cuales ahora sólo vive con dos D. ellos en su casa propia, quienes la apoyan en sus labores agrícolas. Serena y tranquila como las manzanillas D. sus chacras, posa Florinda posando en una D. sus plantas. Los últimos años le han resultado ser muy rentables, ya que cada viaje que realiza a la ciudad siempre carga sus hierbas para mate y con las ganancias solventa sus pasajes. Pero no sólo se dedica a la siembra D. manzanilla, sino también tiene papa, ollucos y alverjas. Durante toda su vida se ha dedicado a los cultivos agrícolas, y está muy complacida con esos trabajos, los que le ha permitido educar a sus hijos y darles una vida muy cómoda. Y una vez cosechados sus productos opta por comercializarlos a los mercados D. la ciudad D. Lima, porque le resultan más rentables a comparación D. los mercados D. Tarma. Ahora tiene planes D. implementar un servicio D. Internet para su hija menor que está estudiando en la ciudad, para que D. ese modo pueda solventar sus gastos D. su educación. Florinda es fundadora D. su banco comunal, tiene el cargo D. presidenta, durante varios créditos consecutivos, donD. demostró ser muy responsable en cada uno D. sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra D. fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos D. papa y olluco.
texts.en:
Florinda is 46 years old, married, with 7 children. Only 2 of her children currently live with her in the house she owns, and they help her with her agricultural work. Calm and serene like the chamomile in her plots, Florinda poses in one of her fields. The past few years have been very profitable, since every time she goes to the city she always takes her maté herbs and with the earnings she covers the cost of the trip. In additional to chamomile, she also grows potatoes, olluco (another root vegetable), and peas. She has done agricultural work her whole life, and she is very happy with this work, which has allowed her to educate her children and proviD. them with a very comfortable life. Once her crops are harvested, she prefers to sell them in markets in Lima, because they are more profitable than the markets in Tarma. She is now planning to start an Internet service for her youngest daughter who is studying in the city, in order to help pay the costs of her education. Florinda is the founder of her communal bank. She is the president, and through various consecutive loans she has shown herself to be very responsible in each of her payments. The money she is requesting is for the purchase of chemical fertilizers for her potato and olluco crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter tiene 46 años de edad, es un padre de familia muy abnegado y de “mil oficios”, tiene 3 hijos y cuenta con una casa propia. De joven se dedicó a realizar los trabajos agrícolas, actividad heredada de sus padres; pero para él la agricultura, algunas veces, es de escasa producción y muchas veces no se recupera lo invertido. Por ello que hace 5 años viene dedicándose a la crianza de cuyes, pero sin dejar sus cultivos de papa, ni alverjas que en ciertas temporadas le son muy rentables. Su mayor tiempo les dedica a sus animales, ya que quiere convertirse en un empresario exitoso. Inició su negocio con cuyes de una raza menor, pero ahora está cambiando a una raza de mejor calidad, participando en todas las ferias agropecuarias para exhibir a sus roedores. Walter nos muestra en la foto, orgulloso, su “cobaya”, de un tamaño considerable. Para la alimentación de sus cuyes siembra alfalfa en sus chacras de riego, ya que con pasar de los meses sus animales se están incrementado y eso le demanda mayor cantidad de pasto. Él está muy feliz porque este negocio le ha permitido relacionarse con ingenieros, de quienes pudo obtener información muy valiosa para mejorar su actividad. Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP, donde todo este tiempo vino pagando de forma muy puntual, asimismo ha cumplido la función de tesorero, cargo que cumplió con mucha honestidad y cabe mencionar que es el único varón en su banco comunal, por lo cual es el más querido por el resto de las socias. En esta oportunidad ha decidido en invertir en la compra de chacras sembradas de alfalfa o avena para alimentar a sus 200 cuyes, así como en la compra de fertilizante para sus cultivos de papas.
texts.en:
Walter is 46 years old. He is a very self-sacrificing head of the family and has "a thousand jobs". He has 3 children and owns his own home. From the time he was young, he has done agricultural work, an activity he inherited from his parents. But for him, agriculture sometimes results in scarce production and many times he does not recoup his investment. For this reason, he has been raising guinea pigs for the past 5 years, though he has not stopped planting potatoes and peas, which in certain seasons are very profitable. Walter dedicates most of his time to his animals, as he wants to become a successful business owner. He started his business with guinea pigs of a lower quality, but now he is upgrading to a lineage of better quality, participating in all of the livestock fairs to exhibit his rodents. In the picture, Walter proudly shows us his female guinea pig, which is quite large. In order to feed his guinea pigs, he plants alfalfa in irrigated plots, since with the passing of the months he has more animals and requires more pasture. He is very happy because this job has enabled him to work with engineers, from whom has is able to obtain very useful information to improve his business. This is the fourth loan that he has taken out from MFP, and he has always paid very punctually. He has also served as the treasurer, a role he performed with great integrity. It is also worth noting he is the only man in his communal bank, and is therefore the favorite of the rest of the female members. With this loan he has decided to purchase fields planted with alfalfa or oats to feed his 200 guinea pigs, as well as fertilizer for his potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed for his animals

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda tiene 37 años, vive con Jesús, su esposo y su hijo Yomar de 6 en su casa propia. Ambos se dedican a la compra y venta de madera, desde hace un año para cubrir los gastos de su pequeño Yomar, nombre que le pusieron en honor a su negocio, el cual les arroja bueno resultados gracias a todo el empeño que le ponen, ya que Jesús viaja constantemente a otras provincias para dejar los pedidos que le hacen. Este negocio le resulta muy rentable, siendo sus servicios muy cotizados y obteniendo un buen dinero por todas sus ventas. A Hilda siempre le ha gustado su negocio y aunque a veces hay cosas feas como que la gente no paga a tiempo sus pedidos y tiene que estar detrás para cobrarles, siempre ha puesto mucha energía y ganas a su trabajo, ya que no está sola, cuenta con su esposo, y porque no, el pequeño Yomar también la apoya en todas las labores que tienen que realizar, haciendo un buen equipo con el cual espera salir adelante en bien de su porvenir. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual y responsable en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita es para comprar mayor cantidad de madera para vender en otras provincias y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Hilda is 37 years old. She lives with her husband, Jesús, and her son Yomar, age 6, in a house that they own. For the past year, Hilda and her husband have been buying and selling wood to cover the expenses of little Yomar. They named their business after Yomar, and it has delivered good results thanks to the hard work that they put into it. Jesus travels constantly to other provinces to delver the orders that they receive. This business has been very profitable, and their services in high demand, and they earn good money on each of their sales. Hilda has always liked sales. Even though she sometimes has to deal with unfortunate situations, like clients who don't pay for their orders on time and have to be reminded constantly to pay, she has always put a lot of energy and desire into her work. She is not alone, she has her husband, and, why not - little Yomar who support her in all of the work she undertakes. They make a good team and hope to get ahead and improve their future prospects. This is Hilda's first loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual and responsible for all of her payments. With the money she is requesting she plans to buy a larger quantity of wood to sell in other provinces and increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more product to sell

loans.name: Kuna Guapa Group

texts.es:
El inicio del presente comité fue la señora Angelina E. quien se informo  del programa, invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.

La srta. María Leticia E. se dedica a la artesanía  de sombreros de karanday, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo de esa manera obtener mayor comodidad y mas producción.

La Sra. Yolanda Beatriz O. se dedica a la artesanía en cueros, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo logrando así mayor productividad.

La Sra. María Lys Martínez se dedica a la venta de lencería en general, invirtió el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderías al por mayor pudiendo de ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.

La Sra. Angelina E. tiene una despensa, invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías para surtir su negocio.

La Sra. Mirtha Liliana A. es costurera, invirtió su dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo tijera telas, hilos, etc.

La Sra. Pastora P. tiene una cantina en una escuela de su barrio, invirtió el dinero en la compra de  mercadería en general para surtir su negocio.

La Sra. Elva D.  se dedica a la venta de comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías para la elaboración de los comestibles de ese modo ofrecer mayor variedad de comestible a su clientela.

La Sra. María Cristina P. es costurera,  invirtió el dinero en la compra de materiales para su trabajo pudiendo de ese modo obtener mayor productividad.

La Sra. Cecilia B. se dedica a la venta de comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías para la elaboración de los comestibles.

La Sra.Vicenta  A. se dedica a la venta de frutas,  invirtió el dinero en la compra de frutas al por mayor para luego venderlas y ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad.

La Sra. Eusebia C. es modista, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo logrando así mayor eficacia y calidad en sus prendas. 

La Sra. Zunilda Elizabeth Rodríguez es artesana en sombrero de karanday, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo.

La Sra. Fabiana Centurión es comerciante, invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías en general de esa manera surtir su negocio ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.

La Sra. Marcelina R. se dedica a la venta de prendas,  invirtió el dinero en la compra de prendas en general logrando así surtir sus mercaderías y ofrecer mayor variedad a su clientela.

La Sra. Sonia Giménez  se dedica a la venta de artículos de mercería, invirtió el  dinero en la compra de artículos de mercería en general obteniendo más variedad de mercaderías que ofrecer a sus  clientes.

 La Sra. Elena M. es artesana e sombreros de karanday, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo.

La Sra. Francisca O. se dedica a  la venta de carbón, invirtió el dinero en la compra de carbón en cantidad para luego venderlos y obtener una buena ganancia.

La Sra.Mirta González se dedica a la venta de artículos de limpieza, invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumo para la elaboración de los productos.

La Sra. Elvia E. se dedica a realizar manualidades, cotillón para acontecimientos en general, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo.
texts.en:
The present committee was started by Mrs. Angelina E. who gathered information on the program, invited and organized her friends to form part of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs. Miss Maria Leticia E. makes hats from karanday. She invested the money in the purchase of tools for her work and in this way be more comfortable and have greater output. Mrs. Yoanda Beatriz O. does leatherwork. She invested the money in tools for her work, in order to achieve greater productivity. Mrs. María Lys Martinez sells lingerie. She invested the money in the purchase of wholesale merchandise in order to be able to offer greater selection to her customers. Mrs. Angelina E. has a small grocery store. She invested the money in the purchase of merchandise for her business. Mrs. Mirtha Liliana A. is a seamstress. She invested her money in the purchase of tools for her work such as scissors, fabrics, threads, etc. Mrs. Pastora P. has a cantina in a school in the neighborhood. She invested the money in the purchase of general merchandise to stock her business. Mrs. Elva D. sells prepared food. She invested the money in the purchase of ingredients to make food and in this way be able to offer greater variety to her customers. Mrs. María Cristina P. is a seamstress. She invested the money in the purchase of materials for her work, enabling her to increase her productivity. Mrs. Cecilia B. sells prepared food. She invested the money in the purchase of ingredients for making the items she sells. Mrs. Vicenta A. sells fruit. She invested the money in the wholesale purchase of fruit so that she can sell it and offer her customers greater variety. Mrs. Eusebia C. is a dressmaker. She invested the money in the purchase of tools for her work, in order to achieve better efficiency and quality in her garments. Mrs. Zunilda Elizabeth Rodríguez is an artisan who makes hats from karanday. She invested the money in the purchase of items for her work. Mrs. Fabiana Centurión is a shop owner. She invested the money in the purchase of general merchandise to stock her business and provide greater selection to her customers. Mrs. Marcelina R. sells clothing. She invested the money in the purchase of clothing, stocking up o merchandise and offering better selection to her customers. Mrs. Sonia Giménez sells hardware. She invested the money in the purchase of general hardware to have a greater selection to offer her customers. Mrs. Elena M. is an artisan who makes hats from karanday. She invested the money in the purchase of items for her work. Mrs. Francisca O. sells charcoal. She invested the money in the purchase of charcoal in quantity, so that it can be sold for a good profit. Mrs. Mirta González sells cleaning products. She invested the money in the purchase of ingredients to make her products. Mrs. Elvia E. creates crafts and decorations for events. She invested the money in the purchase of items for her work.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes, fabric, karanday, drinks, meat, sausages, corn, bread, herbs, oil, sweets, vegetables, fruit, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La señorita Norma López de 44 años vive en la casa de sus padres a quien le cuida y se hace responsable de ellos ya que son adultos.

La señorita Norma empezó el negocio hace 4 años con un capital que consiguió trabajando en el exterior donde estuvo trabajando por 4 años , empezó con una mercería y con el correr del tiempo lo convirtió en una ropería.

El sueño de Norma es que su negocio crezca cada día y con eso aumentar sus ingresos mensuales, para que el día de mañana pueda llevar una vida más cómoda.

Solicita estos préstamos para compra de mercaderías como pantalón vaqueros, remeras, championes, carteras, conjuntos de buzos, camisa, desodorantes, ropa interior,  bijouteri, zapatillas, perfumes en general. Así aumentará su stock de mercaderías y ofrecer de esta forma variedad a sus clientes
texts.en:
Norma López is 44 years old. She lives in her parents' home, where she cares for them now that they are elderly. Norma started her business 4 years ago with capital that that she had made while working abroad for 4 years. She began with a notions shop and over time she converted it in a clothing shop. Norma's dream is for her business to grow each day and to increase her monthly earnings, so that she can have a more comfortable life in the future. She is requesting these loans for the purchase of merchandise such as jeans, t-shirts, sneakers, wallets, sweatsuits, shirts, deodorant, underwear, jewelry, slippers, and perfume. With this she will increase her stock of merchandise and offer greater selection to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of men’s and women’s jeans, t-shirts, sneakers, wallets, deodorant, underwear, jewelry, slippers, and perfume

loans.name: Rosabella

texts.es:
La Señora Bellarosa de 39 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Juan de 45  años de edad. El Matrimonio tiene tres hijos todos  ellos estudiando. 
    La  Sra. es propietaria de una despensa en el cual se inició en el año 2002  El cual inicio con un pequeño ahorro que contaba. Ella ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada gracias a la buena atención  que les ofrece a sus clientes.  En dicho negocio recibe la ayuda de sus Hijos.  Su Marido está trabajando en una panadería hace más de 15 años, así ayudando también para los gastos de la casa.
     Ña Bellarosa como un sueño personal, desea ampliar su negocio para llegar a ofrecer mejor comodidad y más variedades de productos a sus clientes.
     La clienta  solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías varias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bellarosa is 39 years old. She is married to Juan, who is 45, and they have 3 children, who are all students. Mrs. Bellarosa is the owner of a small grocery that she opened in 2002. She started the business with the small savings that she had. She now has a well established customer base thanks to the good customer service that she provides. Her children help her in her business. Her husband has been working at a bakery for more than 15 years, thus also helping cover household expenses. Mrs. Bellarosa's personal dream is to expand her business to be able to offer greater convenience and product selection to her customers. She is requesting a loan to puchase additional merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. K. is 27-years-old and the mother of one young child who is enrolled in the local school. She currently sells different kinds of vegetables in Phsa Kroam Market located in Siem Reap Province. Her husband, San, is the other provider of the family's financial income. He works as a motor taxi driver. K. is determined to use this loan in order to buy vegetables to sell. The remainder will be used to replace a motorcycle.
The two people shown in the picture are Mrs. Heng K. and her husband.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La  señora Lourdes, es de San Estanislao, tiene casa propia.
Es propietaria de una tienda de ropas, que esta ubicada en el mercado de la ciudad, con 10 años de funcionamiento, con clientela formada y un buenas ventas, ya que tiene buenos precios y calidad sus mercaderìas, tambien el buen trato con los clientes.
Desea ampliar su local para poder tener màs variedad de ropas y otras cosa que los clientes solicitan.
texts.en:
Senora Lourdes is from San Estanislao and lives in her own house. She is the proprietor of a small clothing shop located in the city market. She's had the business for 10 years, and with her high quality merchandise, great customer service and good prices, she has a solid customer base and good sales. She would like to expand her small shop and offer a greater variety of clothing as well as other items her customers are requesting.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her small clothing shop to offer more variety to her customers

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La Sra. Irma J. cuanta con 46 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Ramón Ruiz y tienen 7 hijos, de los cuales 3 son profesionales y los demás en edad escolar.

La actividad que realiza la Sra. Irma es la venta, en su propio local, de bienes de primera necesidad, tales como yerba mate, azúcar, fideo, harina, panificados, etc., además se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas, como empanadas, milanesas, croquetas y otros.
Para poder comenzar con este negocio, el cónyuge quien es  constructor, había conseguido trabajar en una obra muy grande en donde consiguió un buen capital por dicho trabajo y de ahí comenzaron a montar la despensa.
En la actualidad es una de las despensas de mayor consideración en la zona y su éxito se debe a la buena atención, buena calidad de los productos, buen precio y además de ofrecer variedad de mercaderías.
Actualmente el Señor Ramón sigue dedicándose a su profesión, que sigue dandole un ingreso importante para la familia.
Es importante mencionar que tienen casa propia, y el orgullo de tener en la familia a tres hijos profesionales, dos docentes y una contadora pública.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de mercaderías, como ser arroz, fideo, azúcar, yerba mate, panificados, bebidas gaseosas, almidón, etc.
Una de las metas que se han propuesto, es la de hacer profesionales a sus otros hijos, y darles la oportunidad que ellos no tuvieron cuando jóvenes.
texts.en:
Irma J. is 46 years old and married to Ramon Ruiz. They have 7 children, 3 of them are grown up and working and the others are still attending school. Irma has a small shop where she sells staples such as tea, sugar, noodles, flour, bread, as well as some fast food items such as empanadas and fried meats.

She was able to start the business with the help of her husband, who works in construction. He had worked on a large project which paid well, and so she had the capital to launch her store. Today it is one of the larger stores in the area, and her success is due to her good customer service, high quality and variety of products, as well as good prices.

Ramon continues to work in his profession, which generates an important income for the family. It's important to mention that they have their own home, and they are proud to have a family with three children who are now professionals, two are teachers and one is an accountant.

The requested loan will be used to purchase merchandise such as rice, noodles, sugar, tea, bread, sodas, etc. One of their main goals is that their other children will also become professionals, and have opportunities that Irma and Ramon never had when they were young.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store,  such as rice, noodles, tea, sugar, bread, etc.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Mrs. Yon V. is shown providing food to her family's pig that she raised two months ago. She is 54-years old and the mother of ten children: nine are single and one is married and lives separately. Five of her single children are working in different occupations. Her husband helps with her business. The family always takes time to grow rice during the farming season.
Mrs. V. and her husband hope to reduce taxi expenses. Therefore, they would like a $600 loan in order to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Progreso Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de señoras sencillas, trabajadoras que se unieron con el fin de alcanzar un crédito para uso e inversión en sus oficios, ellas  poseen las ganas de trabajar en grupo, tienen  espíritu emprendedor y por sobre todo las ganas de progresar conjuntamente es por eso que  unieron  con el propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida en lo personal, familiar y en sus negocios, atravez de la formación de un grupo solidario en donde están  dispuestas a ayudarse, de esta forma las señoras asumen una responsabilidad  de manera conjunta,.- Algunas Señoras se le otorgara un crédito de 500.000 gs. Otras 300.000 gs.

Las integrantes del grupo son: 

Rogelia M. - 	Macatera vta de ropas
Karen Griselda V. - 	Macatera vta. De ropas usadas
Lucida M.	 - Almacén
Ignacia E. - 	Macatera vta. De utensilios, mercaderías
Lorenza G.- 	Venta de Frutas y Verduras
Saturnina N. - 	Vendedora Ambulante de mandioca
Antonia C.	- Almacen
Gregoria M.  - 	Vendedora de queso y miel
Maxima C. - 	Vendedora ambulante De Verduras
Maria Marlene R.	- Vta. De frutas y verduras
Liduvina L.	- Vta. de Gallina
Justine C.	  - Vat. De gallina
Rosalie C.	 - Copetín
Claudia E.	 - Despensa, Almacen
Gloria R. E.  - 	Almacén y vta. de verduras
Arminda G.	 - Despensa
Maura Andresa M. - 	Merceria
Silvina Rolón	 - Vendedora ambulante de menudencias
texts.en:
This group of working women have come together with the objective of obtaining a loan to invest in their respective businesses. The women benefit from the collective spirit of hard work and above all the desire to achieve success together. This is why they've come together to improve their personal, family and professional situations through the formation of a group. The women support each other and share responsibility for the loan together. Some of the women will receive 500gs and others 300gs. The members of the group are: Rogelia M. - Clothing sales Karen Griselda V. - Clothing sales Lucida M. - General store Ignacia E. - General store Lorenza G.- Sales of fruits and vegetables Saturnina N. - Door to door sales of cassava Antonia C. - General store Gregoria M. - Sales of cheese and honey Maxima C. - Door to door vegetable sales Maria Marlene R. -Sales of fruits and vegetables Liduvina L. - Sales of chickens Justine C. - Sales of chickens Rosalie C. - Sales Claudia E. - General store Gloria R. E. - Vegetable shop Arminda G. - Shop Maura Andresa M. - Shop Silvina Rolón - Sales

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell and grow their respective businesses, including fruits, vegetables, chickens,  cheese, as well as other household items

loans.name: La Buena Economia Group

texts.en:
Edwin B. and this group of entrepreneurs live in Sabana de la Mar, a beautiful small town located on the northeastern coast of the Dominican Republic. It is the northern limit of the Hato Mayor province with the Samana bay. From here, ferries transport passengers to Samana, which is a beautiful peninsula with many tourist attractions. Sabana de la Mar itself has good beaches and is the takeoff point to visit a rain forest national park, Los Haitises. Despite its potential for tourism, especially "eco-friendly" tourism, Sabana de la Mar is a very underdeveloped, sleepy town by the Atlantic Ocean.
Edwin has a small repair shop where he sells parts for vehicles. This is his very first loan and he hopes to buy enough motorcycle parts for his inventory. In small towns, motorcycles are the most popular transportation. But, the condition of the roads makes it hard for their owners to keep them in good shape. This has brought Edwin a good clientele that trusts him to find even the most difficult motorcycle part.
Edwin has three young children. They are ages 8 and 6, and the youngest is just two months old. Edwin is working very hard to make sure that his children do not lack anything, especially the little baby. He dreams of seeing them grow up in a house of his own. He would like to set up his auto repair shop in a space he will own. Some of the borrowers on this loan have already completed two loan cycles successfully with Esperanza International.
This picture was taken at the Hato Mayor office. The young man at the very back and and the woman whose head is partially visible on his right are not members of the group. Thank you for helping us support these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle parts for repair shop

loans.name: Amarsanaa

texts.en:
Amarsanaa G. lives with her husband and three teenage children in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. All three children are attending a local high school. Her husband is a fireman for the central heating station of the town. In order to contribute to the family of five, she started a small retail business selling dairy products in 2000. She purchases dairy products from herder families and sells them at a stall she rents in the local food market. She sells milk, curds, cream and cheese.

Her business capital has increased from 80,000 MNT ($1 = 1,400 MNT) in the beginning to 400,000 MNT. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and make sure that all her children receive a good education. She requests a loan to purchase more dairy products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products for her business

loans.name: Chham

texts.en:
The humble couple shown in the picture here is Mrs. S. and her husband, who are the parents of three children. All three of their children are single and attend school. Presently, the family makes their daily revenue by selling fresh fish in the busy market. They usually go to buy fish where it is sold in bulk at the lowest prices and then sell them on a retail basis to gain income.

To reduce the cost of family's transportation, Mrs. S. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva as capital to buy a motorcycle so that she can use it to transport fish to sell at the market more quickly.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Dashzeveg

texts.en:
Dashzeveg T. lives with his wife and three children in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Two of their children are local high school students. Dashzeveg has a small business selling firewood. His wife is a big fan of Dashzeveg's business and she helps any way she can.

Since 2004, Dashzeveg has been cutting firewood and selling it in small bags to local restaurants and cafeterias. Since the beginning, his business capital has increased from 100,000 MNT ($1 = 1,500 MNT) to 800,000 MNT. He has gained the trust of cafeteria owners who are happy to purchase firewood from him. In the future, he would like to expand his business by adding more cafeterias and restaurants to his clientele list. He requests a loan to purchase wood for his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood for his business

loans.name: Enhbayar

texts.en:
Enhbayar L. lives with his wife and three teenage children in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. All three children are high school students. Enhbayar has a small retail business selling secondhand shoes. His wife also works with him in his business. In 2000, Enhbayar started out by selling cheap secondhand shoes and clothes in the local market. He purchases secondhand clothing from the wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. When he travels to Ulaanbaatar, his wife sells clothes and shoes at the market from his stall. In the near future, Enhbayar hopes to expand his business by adding new high demand clothing items. Enhbayar and his wife's ultimate goals are to make sure that all their children receive a good education and pursue their dreams without financial strain.
He has requested a loan to purchase more secondhand clothes for his business.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing for his business

loans.name: Chhuorn Rours Village Bank Group

texts.en: Sixteen people living in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. The group president is Mrs. Chhuorn R., a 56- year-old who aL. with her husband, Mr. Koeut Saroeun, makes and sells rice wine. The couple have five children who are pig breeders. Since their pig breeding business is doing well, they want to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Chhuorn R. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase income and improve her family living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Mrs. Savoen Bol Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank consists of twenty one members and is located in Dei Eth Koh Phos village in Kandal province. The group plan to use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Savoen B. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Mrs. Savoen B. is 35 years old and the mother of a child who is too yoU. to work or study. She is a clothes seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well she has many customers who need new fashions, so she has decided to request a loan to purchase more clothes to resell and to support her customer's needs. Her husband, Mr. Nao Lach, is a construction worker.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to resell and to support her customers

loans.name: Mrs. Chreob Lim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty one people living I. Sdau Kanleng village I. Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Chreob L. is 31 years old and acts as village bank president. She is employed I. a garment factory and also breeds pigs. As her pigs are getting bigger and bigger and she does not have enough money to buy pig food to breed them, she has decided to request a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Chim Samnang, is a security guard and they have three children, two of whom are enrolled I. the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

Two members I. this group loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s maI. product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy pig food to breed pigs.

loans.name: Mrs. Ra Chhean Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank consists of twenty members located in Sdau Kanleng village in Kandal province and they plan to use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Ra C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Mrs. Ra C. is 35 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to study. Her husband, Mr. D. Sorin, is a construction foreman. Mrs. Ra C. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow mangos; however her field is infertile, which has an impact on her crop. In order to solve this problE., she needs to buy fertilizer to increase crop production, so has asked for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her mango growing business.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan S. is 55 years old and the divorced mother of two children. One of her children sells groceries while the other one attends the local public school.

Mrs. S. is a domestic nurse who owns a pharmacy with different kinds of medicine for sale. She also examines the patients who live near her house in the village. She has had this business since 1972. In order to meet patient demands, Mrs. S. would like a loan for $1100 to purchase additional medicine. She plans to use the rest of the loan for her child's grocery business.

loans.use: To purchase additional medicine.

loans.name: Daysi Patricia

texts.es: Daysi Patricia S. R. vive en El departamento de Ahuachapán. Daysi está acompañada con José, quien es el padre de sus tres hijos, José se dedica a la profesión de electricista, pero sus ingresos salariales de su trabajo, no son suficiente para mantener  a su familia, es por ello; que Daysi una mujer muy luchadora,  puso un negocio de venta de sombreros en el mercado central. El producto que Daysi comercializa es muy demandado en la zona, ya que es un lugar donde las personas utilizan mucho este accesorio como manera de protección del sol cuando se encuentran trabajando en la agricultura, Daysi lleva solo 4 años en el negocio pero tiene expectativas para hacerlo crecer, es por ello que solicita un crédito para comprar más variedad de sombreros para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Daysi lives in Ahuachapan with her partner Jose. Together they have 3 children. Jose is an electrician, but his salary is not sufficient to maintain their family. For this reason, Daysi, who is a very determined woman, started a businesses selling hats in the central market. Her products are in great demand in the area, where people use hats a lot as protection against the sun while working in the fields. Daysi has just 4 years in this business, but she expects it to continue to grow. She is requesting a loan to purchase more variety of hats to offer to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a wider variety of hats to offer her customers, and continue to grow her business

loans.name: Aura Concepción

texts.es: Aura Concepción R.  vive en Armenia municipio de Sonsonate.  A pesar de no haber terminado su educación básica, Concepción siempre conto con la visión y esperanza de montar un negocio propio. Tras años de esfuerzo y trabajo, logro montar una pequeña pupuseria cerca de la esquina de su pueblo. Fue con fe y sudor, que Aura Concepción ha logrado mantenerse por cuatro años con su pupuseria, que ha empezado a crecer. Actualmente ella solicita un préstamo para comprar materia prima que le permita expandir su negocio y continuar con su crecimiento económico y personal.
texts.en:
Concepcion lives in the municipality of Sonsonate. Aside from not having finished her basic education, Concepcion always had the vision and the hope of running her own business. After years of effort and work, she was able to open a small restaurant on the corner in her neighborhood. It's been with faith and sweat that she has been able to maintain her business for 4 years, and now it has started to grow. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials needed to expand her business, and continue to improve her personal and economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand her business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel  N. vive en el pueblito de Armenia, en el departamento de Sonsonate en el occidente del país.  Hace ya cinco años, empezó con su proyecto de  negocio propio, una tienda y abarrotería que monto en su propia casa, pues era incapaz de cubrir los costos de un local aparte. Su esposa Josefina vive con él, y le ayuda en el manejo de la tienda. Además de administrar el negocio, Daniel también se encarga de toda la casa, y cubre los gastos económicos mensuales. 
Daniel N. solicita un préstamo  para comprar nuevas mercaderías como cereal, bebidas y detergentes, con el fin de enriquecer su inventario y ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor gama de productos.
texts.en:
Daniel lives in the village of Armenia in Sonsonate, in the west of the country. 5 years ago he set up his own business. He now runs a shop and general store from his own home, which is more cost effective than a separate location. His wife, Josefina, helps him manage the business. In addition to running the store, Daniel is also in charge of the house, and he covers the monthly costs for the family. He is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise such as cereals, drinks and detergents, to expand his inventory and offer his customers a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store and offer his customers a greater variety of products

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru:
Ханифа Каримова проживает в городе Истаравшане. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Ханифе 47 лет, занимается она посевом лука. Поливает землю водой из канала, который находится рядом с местом ее деятельности.
 Муж Ханифы, Гулом Каримов, вместе со своими сыновьями занимается животноводством и подрабатывает сторожем ночной смены в сталовой "Озодчон".
 Ханифа хочет получить займ в размере 700 сомони сроком на 8 месяцев, для посева и выращивания лука. С этой целью она подала заявку на сайт Кива.
texts.en:
Hanifa K. lives in the town of Istaravshan. She is married, has three children and is 47 years old. She plants onions that she irrigates with water from the nearby canal. Hanifa's husband, Gulom Karimov, and their sons raise livestock and work nights as security guards at the Ozodchon cafeteria. Hanifa wants to take out an eight-month loan in the amount of 700 somoni to plant and raise onions, and with this goal in mind applied to Kiva to do so.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Planting and raising onions

loans.name: Korng's Group

texts.en:
Three people are requesting this small loan. They are all residents of Phnom Penh. They have selected Mrs. O. to be the group leader.

Mrs. O. is 50 years old. She is a humble women who earns a living as a local rice farmer. She has been in the farming business for fifteen years and is currently earning around $2 per day. Her husband has had a job as a construction foreman in the village for years. All four of Mrs. O.'s children are working with her husband's business building houses. Mrs. O. is applying for a loan to purchase bananas to sell for additional income, and also to grow rice crops during the rice dry season.

The other two borrowers are Mrs. P. and Mrs. T.. Mrs. P. is 42 years old. She is a farmer who would like a loan to support her farming business. (Mrs. P. was not available to photograph so her husband is in the photo instead.) Mrs. T. is a 58 year old widow who is requesting a loan to begin selling grocery items.

loans.use: To purchase bananas to sell.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.ru: Абдуллоев Мухаммад мужчина в возрасте 43 лет, женат имеет 3 детей. Мастер по ремонту и обделке квартир. Также он мастер штукатурщик. Кроме своего дохода он имеет дополнительный доход с бизнеса откорма и продажи скота. Сейчас у него дома две коровы и маленький телёнок.Жена Мухаммада занимается продажей молока , которое даёт их корова.Для увеличения голов скота Мухаммад решил получить кредит.
texts.en:
Muhammad A. is a 43-year-old man, who is married and has three children. Muhammad is a master craftsman, specializing in apartment remodeling and repair. He also does plaster work. In addition to that income, he earns money raising and selling cattle. At home, he presently has two cows and one young calf. Muhammad's wife sells the milk, which their cow gives. Muhammad decided to take out a loan to increase the size of their herd.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Mahkam

texts.ru: Дадобоев Махкам , мужчина 26 лет, женат имеет одну дочку. Сам занимается торговлей репчатого лука оптом. Его точка реализации расположена возле его дома. Проживает он в Костакозе.Также параллельно Махкам занимается откормом и продажей крупного скота. Для закупа корма и увеличения голов скота Махкам решил получить повторный кредит.
texts.en:
Mahkam D. is a 26-year-old man, married and has one daughter. He is an onion wholesaler, and his sales outlet is near his home in Kostakoz. In addition, Mahkam raises and sells large-horned cattle. Mahkam decided to take out another loan to purchase feed and increase the size of his herd.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Дадобоева Махбуба женщина 31года. Работает продавщицей в частной аптеке, где получает заработную плату. Её доход очень мал и не хватает для полного проживания, её муж работает на стройке, где заработок не постоянный .Поэтому Махбуба вместе с мужем занимается уходом за скотом. Махбуба уже кредитуется третий раз. Получив  кредит,  Махбуба планирует отремонтировать свой хлев и закупить корм для своих коров.
texts.en:
Mahbuba D. is a 31-year-old woman. She works in a private pharmacy, where she receives a salary, but her income is very small and not sufficient to survive to meet their needs. Her husband works in construction and the work is not steady, so Mahbuba and her husband raise cattle. This will be Mahbuba's third loan. With this loan, Mahbuba plans to make repairs to their cowshed and purchase cattle feed.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru:
Барно Ашурова женщина 43 лет, проживает в городе Истаравшане, получила среднее образование. Замужем, мать четырех детей. 
 Барно с юношеских лет обучалась швейному мастерству, и на сегодняшний день она считается одной из опытных портних в своем городе. У Барно много клиентов, для которых она шьет национальные платья и халаты. Помогает ей в этом мастерстве, ее дочь. Она тоже, с огромным желанием обучилась швейному мастерству у своей мамы.
 Барно запрашивает займ в размере 1200 сомони, для приобритения дополнительной швейной машинки.
 Дополнительно к ее бизнесу, деньги ей присылает сын, который работает в Российской Федерации.
texts.en:
Barno A. is a 43-year-old woman, who lives in the town of Istaravshan. She graduated from high school, and is married and the mother of four children. Barno has sewn since she was a teenager, and today is considered one of the most experienced seamstresses in her town. Barno has many customers for whom she sews traditional dresses and robes. Her daughter assists her in the business, and greatly desires to become a master of the craft like her mother. Barno is requesting a loan in the amount of 1200 somoni to acquire another sewing machine. In addition to income from the business, her son, who has taken a job in Russia, sends her money.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing machine

loans.name: Karmin

texts.en: Karmin is a 45 year old single woman living in Furn El Chebbak in Mount Lebanon. She has owned her own fruit and vegetable store since 2006. Today, she is requesting a loan for $1000. She will use this loan to redecorate and make the shop more heartwarming in order to attract a wider range of clients.

loans.use: To redecorate her fruit and vegatable shop.

loans.name: Samieh

texts.en: Soumaya is 49 years old and married with three children. She lives in Kfarshima, Mount Lebanon. She has been working as a food provider since 1995, when her mother first taught her the business. Today, she wants to borrow $1000 in order to increase her stock.

loans.use: To increase the stock of her food provider business.

loans.name: Houda

texts.en: Houda is 40 years old and married with three children. They live in Ouzai, Mount Lebanon. She sells beauty products and jewelry from her home. She has been working in the industry for nine years. Today, Houda is hoping to borrow $1000 to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of beauty products.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро женщина , которая кредитуется в Микроинвест уже третий год.Она занимается бизнесом продажи посуды по районам Карачкум и Канибадам.Закупает товар Зухро с Худжандского оптового рынка.Зухро каждый свой займ использует для увеличения своего оборота.Помогает ей по бизнесу её муж.Ездит она на рынки два раза в неделю.Остальные дни она работает на консервном комбинате.Зухро благодарна Микроинвест за финансирование и поддержку.
texts.en:
This is the third year that Zuhro has had a loan with MicroInvest. She has a business selling tableware in the districts of Karachkum and Kanibadam. Zuhro purchases her goods from the Khujand wholesale market. Zuhro has used each of her loans to increase her turnover. Her husband assists her with the business. She goes to the market twice a week. On the other days, she works at the canning plant. Zuhro is grateful to MicroInvest for the funding and support.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail sale of tableware

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: Manal is a 21 year-old single woman with a home-based business living in Jnah, Mount Lebanon. She sells beauty products, lingerie and jewellery to the neighboring areas. Today she is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase merchandise to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Wadih

texts.en: Wadih is a 22 year-old single parent supporting two children and living in Dekwaneh, Mount Lebanon. He has been working as an auditor for the past three years. Today he wants to borrow $1,200 to improve his productivity by buying a laptop computer.

loans.use: To buy a laptop computer
