loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Sary is a 22 year-old single man living in Gharifeh, Mount Lebanon. He has been a taxi driver for the past three years, when he first received his driver's license. Today he is requesting to borrow $1,200 to fix mechanical issues in his taxi.

loans.use: To fix mechanical issues in his taxi

loans.name: Makhsuda

texts.en:
F. Makhsuda is 27 years old. She is married with three children. Makhsuda has had a lot of success selling calf meat and she never misses an opportunity to expand the space that she has at home to raise animals so that she can sell them at the local market. Her desire is to increase her merchandise so that she will have a stable position in the market. Makhsuda always puts in a lot of effort and her main motivation is her love for her dearest children. Makhsuda would like a loan of $525 USD so that she can buy more animals to sell their meat.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 36 year-old married man with one child living in Ghaza in the Bekaa Valley. He has been working as a contractor since the year 2000. Today Ali is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase a machine for his materials.

loans.use: To purchase a machine

loans.name: Hushbahtchon

texts.ru:
Хушбахтчон Гадойбоев водитель. Он управляет маршрутным такси, развозит людей по маршруту Истаравшан-Зафарабад.
 Хушбахтчону 34 года,сам он проживает в Истаравшане со своей семьей. Женат на Сайере Махсумовой, имеет 2 детей. 
 Он запрашивает займ в размере 1300 сомони, и хочет потратить его на ремонт автомобиля, так как ежедневно развозит людей, и отвечает за их безопасность.
texts.en:
Hushbahtchon G. is a driver. He drives a passenger van on the Istaravshan to Zafarabad route. Hushbahtchon is 34 years old, and lives with his family in Istaravshan. He is married to Sayera Mahsumova and has two children. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1300 somoni and wants to spend it on vehicle repairs, since he drives people on a daily basis and is responsible for their safety.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат кредитор в Микроинвест с 2007 года, она работает на автобазе контролёром.Саломат в выходные дни ездит на торговлю в районы Спитамен, Мастчох.Её оборот за два года заметно увеличился,выходя из этого доход также увеличился.Саломат хочет получив следующий кредит пополнить ассортимент своего товорооборота.Муж Саломат в отъезде в Россию на заработках.За период  своей кредитной истории Саломат ни разу не подводила в погашении, и целенаправлено использует каждый свой займ.
texts.en:
Salomat has been a loan customer of MicroInvest since 2007. She works as an inspector at the auto center. On her days off, Salomat trades in the Spitamen and Mastchoh districts. Over the course of two years, her turnover has increased significantly, and the resulting income has also increased. With this next loan, Salomat wants to expand her selection of goods. Her husband has taken a job in Russia. Over the course of her loan history, Salomat has never defaulted and she puts each loan to good use.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of dishes

loans.name: Salomadjon

texts.en:
H. Salomadjon is 51 years old and is married. She lives with her four children in her own house, which is stocked with basic necessities. Salomadjon has owned a small general store for more than 12 years. She sells foodstuff for everyday use such as sweets, flour, macaroni, sugar, preserved food, soft drinks, etc. Salomadjon runs her business from her home and her children help her. The motive for requesting a loan is to be able to purchase more merchandise to stock the business. More stock of goods will attract more clients and generate good monthly income to help her family. Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working! 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Saba

texts.en:
M. Saba is a married mother of two children. She has spent all her life in touch with the land since her parents and grandmother taught her how to farm. Agriculture and livestock are her passions, and she is highly motivated as these are the source of livelihood for her family. Her husband is also a farmer and helps her with the business. She raises young cows and bulls until they are grown enough to be sold. Her dairy-producing cows are well-fed and cared for at the stables she has constructed in her home. She nurtures her animals with such care that she has a name for every animal. She would like to expand her business and purchase more young cattle. To reach her aspirations, Saba calls out to your generous hearts to receive the loan that she is requesting.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase young cattle

loans.name: Farzona

texts.en:
S. Farzona is an enterprising woman with a deep desire of improving her family's quality of life. She is a married mother of a little daughter. Farzona has been a seamstress since she was very young, and she learned tailoring at her mother's office. With a lot of effort, she has been able to open her own shop at her home and has been successful because her customers have recognized the high quality of her products. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. Farzona is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni for 9 months to purchase new fabrics for sewing national dresses. You can help improve her family's quality of life. Farzona is very grateful for your generosity and support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics for sewing national dresses

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход мужчина 50 лет, женатый , имеет троих взрослых детей.Сам хочет получить очередной второй кредит.Свой кредит он хочет использовать для замена шин своей машины марки "ГАЗЕЛЬ".На которой он обслуживает жителей города Худжанда уже пятый год.Первый займ он использовал для обнавления салона своей автомашины.Он рад что в кредит можно осуществить свои планы и с заработка постепенно погашать его.
texts.en:
Farhod is a 50 year old man, he is married and has three grown children. He would like to take out a second loan. He would like to use his credit to change the tires on his car “Gazelle,” which he uses to provide services to Khujand residents for five years now. He used his first loan to remodel the interior of his car. He is happy that he can use credit to make his plans come to fruition and use his earnings to slowly pay it back.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires

loans.name: Jura

texts.en:
Jura S., 58 and married, operates a business baking “lepeshka”- the national bread. The main income-earner in the family, he says this business is profitable, not being subject to seasonality. With the help of his sons, Jura arises early each day, baking the lepeshka and bread together so that people will have fresh product on their tables for breakfast. He purchases all the ingredients such as flour, salt, and yeast in the local market and now requests a loan of 2500 Somoni for the term of 9 months to increase bread production to meet demand. Specifically, the loan will be used to purchase flour and coal for baking the “lepeshka”. Jura deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase flour for baking the national bread ,“lepeshka”.

loans.name: Musharaf

texts.en:
Musharaf T. is a mother working arduously in agriculture to help her husband with the household expenses in order to improve their quality of life and provide their three children with life’s necessities. During the season, Musharaf works on the land from early morning till late night with the help of her eldest son. At the same time, she runs a business processing and selling dried fruits to earn an additional profit. Musharaf is requesting a loan in order to expand this latter business. Please help this woman of great strength and courage to keep working. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. loans.use: To purchase dried fruits to expand the business.

loans.name: Azamat

texts.en:
G. Azamat is a young man who, little by little, reaches his goals through perseverance and dedication. Thanks to his personal strengths and desire to provide a better future for his family, he has progressed from salesman to becoming his own boss. Approximately two years ago, Azamat rented a place which had deteriorated badly, with terrible conditions, and there he started his business. Since then, he has expanded his grocery and now it is one of the best known groceries in his community.

Azamat is now requesting a loan of $400 US with a term of 12 months, to increase the stock of foodstuffs in his store. Azamat is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while, to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to diversify stock

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil is a 47 year old married man with two children living in Zouk Mosbeh, Mount Lebanon. He is in the drawing business; he plans and then executes the requested drawings. Today, Kamil would like to borrow $1,200 to further improve his business by purchasing a machine to draw and then execute the shapes requested on different fabrics.

loans.use: To purchasing a drawing machine.

loans.name: Mavdjigul

texts.en:
Mavdjigul M. has operated a clothing sales business in the market of “Muboriz” in Gissar for 2 years. Enterprising and hardworking, Mavdjigul has succeeded in her business due to her experience and a joyful spirit. With the profits of her business, she supports her parents. Mavdjigul is currently seeking a loan for $500 USD to enlarge the assortment of her clothing. She promises that she will repay the loan in 10 months and thanks everyone for their support.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new children's clothes for the spring season.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 26 year old single man living in Saida, southern Lebanon. He has owned his own second-hand clothing store for the past two years and currently wants to improve the store front. Therefore, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 to do so.

loans.use: To improve the store front.

loans.name: Hayssam

texts.en: Hayssam is a 40 year old married man living in Ghobeiry, Mount Lebanon. He owns a men's clothing store that he started on his own in the beginning of 2009 after having 3 years of experience in the field. Today, Hayssam is requesting to borrow $1,000 to increase his inventory.

loans.use: To increase his inventory.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is an 18 year old man living in Barja, Mount Lebanon. He has owned a mini-market since 2005, when his father taught him the business. Today, he wants to borrow $1,200 to increase his sales by purchasing a mini-van to be able to deliver to the surrounding villages.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-van.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en: Nada is a 42 year old married woman with three children living in Katermaya, Mount Lebanon. She has been a home-based tailor since 2003, but has been working in this field for the past 27 years. Today, Nada is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase textiles.

loans.use: To purchase textiles.

loans.name: Kharamgul

texts.en:
Kharamgul S. is an enterprising business owner. She has a place at a market where she sells children's clothing. Her business is doing well and provides a large part of her family’s income. Kharamgul is divorced and has a son. She has requested a loan of $400 USD to help purchase a new supply of inventory. Today is a good day to help someone in need. Don’t hesitate, your support will be a big help to this woman. Thanks! 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new children's clothing for spring season.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is a 28 year old single woman living in Saida, southern Lebanon. She has owned her own clothing store since 2005. Today, Sajida is requesting to borrow $1,200 to increase her purchases.

loans.use: To increase purchases.

loans.name: Lotus Group

texts.en:
Jacob M., aged 35, is single with one son of 5 years. He has had a table top business, selling vegetables and fruit, for four years now. He works from 6 am to 9 pm daily and he is able to earn a monthly profit of about $75. 

This will be Jacob’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He wants to increase his capital so that he can buy more vegetables and fruit.

Jacob will share this loan with his group Lotus. The group has 18 members. They will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture Jacob is seated in front, first on the left.

loans.use: To increase capital to buy more fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en:
By her own initiative, when Adolat was 23 she learned how to make traditional dresses using a sewing machine. This activity has made it possible for her to contribute to her family's income and satisfactorily meet the most urgent needs of her two small children. Every item of clothing Adolat produces is superior, and due to this her orders have markedly increased. She has some very large orders that would be impossible to fulfill if she didn't have an assistant. Her incredible energy, fortitude, and commitment to her clients drives her to offer them new and improved service. To this end, Adolat wants to speed up her dress production by purchasing more fabrics. To accomplish her objective, she is asking for a $500 USD loan to buy new modern fabrics and she promises to repay the loan in 12 months. With your help, you can make her dream come true. Adolat thanks you for your generous contribution.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics for sewing traditional dresses.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира удачно без проблем заканчивает свой очередной займ .Она хочет получить повторно сумму чуть поменьше, для расширения своего бизнеса. Она торгует на рынке города Худжанда , в центре рынка.Мунира продаёт шампуни Российского пр-ва, различные чистящие средства для дома.Муж Муниры умер 12лет назад, по болезни почек.Поэтому ей трудно в жизни, хотя ей помогает её сын. Микроивест рад помочь Мунире в расширении её бизнеса.
texts.en:
Munira, successfully, without problems is finishing up her loan. She would like to take out another sum that is a little bit smaller in order to grow her business. She sells at the Khujand market at the center of the market. Munira sells shampoos made in Russia and various cleaning products for the home. Munira’s husband died 12 years ago from a kidney disease. This is why she has a difficult life, even though her son helps her. MicroInvest is happy to help Munira expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of shampoo and cleaning supplies

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en: Vasif was born in 1983. He lives in the village of Murshud Oba in the Khachmaz region.  He started his farming business two years ago. Now he needs a loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Хобилов Дилшод мужчина 24 лет женат , детей не имеет. Дилшод кроме откорма скота имеет дополнительный доход с бизнеса продажи строительных материалов. Его  точка расположена на рынке Костакоза. В его отсутствии за скотом ухаживает его жена , которая нигде не работает , но учится в университете на заочном отделении.Для увеличения оборотного капитала бизнеса животноводства Дилшод хочет получить кредит.
texts.en:
Dilshod H. is a 24 year old man; he is married and does not have children. Dilshod in addition to fattening cattle has additional income from the sale of construction materials. His sales location is located at the Kostakoz market. In his absence, his wife takes care of the livestock. She does not work anywhere but studies at the university in the correspondence division. Dilshod would like to get a loan in order to increase his working capital for raising livestock.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fatten and sell livestock

loans.name: Fakhraddin

texts.en: Fakhraddin was born in 1966 and is married with two children. They live in the village of Zardabi in the Guba region. He has been in the dairy business for six years.  He needs a loan to buy two cows to build up his dairy business.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Changamukeni Group

texts.en:
Pascal M. is thirty years old and single with two children, ages six and two.  He started a general store six years ago and works from 6am to 10pm every day. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around $59.

This will be Pascal’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania (one of Kiva's field partners).  He used the previous loans to start a retail shop and to increase inventory in both stores, and he has paid back his loans successfully.  He wants to use the new loan to increase the inventory of both businesses.

Pascal will share this loan with his group "Changamkeni". The group has fifteen members. These members  hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Pascal is first on the left in the back row, wearing a white t-shirt.

loans.use: To increase the inventory in both shops.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Cette dame a abandonné les études au lycée, ayant quelques notions de gestion, elle s’est lancée dans la vente de produits d’alimentation générale et de produits cosmétiques, elle a ouvert une boutique qu’elle a appelé « ETS GRACELIA », elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé, elle exerce son commerce non loin d’avédji et est très connu dans son quartier. Une partie de son stock est épuisée, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour renouveller son stock. Elle est mariée et a 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This lady left off her studies at the high school level. Having some notion of managing a business, she began selling groceries and cosmetics. She opened a little shop she calls « ETS GRACELIA ». She buys her supplies in the big open-air market of Lomé. Her sales point is not far from Avédji and is well-known in her neighborhood. Part of her inventory is sold out, and she would like to replenish it. She is requesting her first loan from WAGES to replenish her stock. She is married and the mother of 3 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of groceries and cosmetics for re-sale

loans.name: Edoh Koffi

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme réside dans le quartier de Kagomé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé,  il est  un jeune célibataire qui travaille dur pour subvenir à ses besoins, il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce  de produits d’alimentation générale, il exerce son commerce dans une boutique. Voulant agrandir son stock il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 10 cartons de spaghetti, 3 cartons de savons « BF », 7 cartons de lait « Peak », 5 Bidons d’huile rouge, des cartes de recharges et divers.
texts.en:
This young man lives in the Kagomé district, an outlying neighborhood of the city of Lomé. He is single and works hard to support himself. He earns a living selling groceries in a shop. Wishing to expand his stock, he is asking WAGES for his first loan to buy 10 cases of spaghetti, 3 cases of "BF" soap, 7 cases of « Peak » milk, 5 jerry cans of red (palm) oil, rechargeable phone cards, and various other items.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of groceries, etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Bo

texts.en: Bo S. is thirty-one years old and married with two children, both of whom go to school. She lives in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband sell rubber. Typically, they make only about $20 in revenue each day.  In light of these economic difficulties, Bo is asking for a loan to purchase rubber in bulk in order to get a special discount. This purchase can help increase her daily income.

loans.use: To buy rubber in bulk.

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Ven K. is twenty-six years old and lives in Kampong Cham province. She has two young children and works as a farmer to earn a living. On average, she is able to make $1 every day. Her husband is on the staff of World Vision Organization. Ven needs to take out a loan to start raising pigs.

loans.use: Raise pigs.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan T., pictured here with her husband, is thirty-four years old. They have three children and reside in Kampong Cham province. She works in a grocery store, making around $10 in revenue per day, while her husband is a police officer who makes $3 every day. Two of their children are in school and one operates a coffee shop. To bring more money into the family, Mrs. Chan T. would like to take out a loan to reinvest in her son’s coffee shop.

loans.use: To reinvest in her son’s coffee shop.

loans.name: Oem

texts.en: Oem M. is forty-five years old and married. She lives with seven of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband work a farm and breed ducks, typically making $6 each day. Her family is also supported by two of the children who work in the fields. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have created a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Oem M. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan to purchase feed for her ducks, a purchase that she believes can bring an increase to her daily income.

loans.use: To buy feed for her ducks.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen C. is fifty-two years old and married with four children. The family resides in the Kampong Cham province. Her husband, pictured here, operates a motor-taxi business and makes $10 in revenue every day. Pen's business, making baskets, typically makes about $2.50 a day.  Two of their children are workers and two are in school. Recently, her husband's motorbike has become unreliable, even after being repaired many times, so Pen wants a loan to replace the motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme est un célibataire qui vit seul dans le quartier d’avédji, pour pouvoir subvenir à ses propres besoins, il a commencé en 2006, la vente de produits d’alimentation générale, sa clientèle a augmenté, pour pouvoir les satisfaire convenablement il doit augmenter son stock, il sollicite alors de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de riz, 10 cartons de pâtes alimentaires, 10 sachets d’eau « VOLTIC » , 5 cartons de tomates en Boîtes, 01 carton de beurre , 01 carton de mayonnaise « JAGO », 1 cartons de détergents « MOMO MAGIC » et divers produits d’alimentation générale. Avec ce qu’il gagne de son commerce il aide aussi ses frères.
texts.en:
This a young unmarried man who lives alone in the Avédji district. To support himself, he started selling grocery items in 2006. His customer base has grown, and to meet the expectations appropriately, he must augment his inventory. He's therefore requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy ten sacks of rice, ten boxes of pasta, ten bags VOLTIC water, five boxes of canned tomatoes, one box of butter, one box of JAGO mayonnaise, one box of MOMO MAGIC detergent, and various other grocery items. With what he earns from his commerce, he also helps his brothers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Awleyikpè

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois et de tubercules, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la ville de sokodé, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2001 au marché local d’adidogomé, son stock de marchandises actuel ne lui permet pas de satisfaire convenablement ses clients, n’ayant jamais obtenu du crédit de WAGES, elle sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter 15 sacs de charbons de bois, 10 sacs d’ignames et divers. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a lady who earns an income from commerce in charcoal and tubers. She acquires her supplies from inland locations, in the city of Sokodé. She has been in this business since 2001 at the local marketplace in Adidogomé. Her current inventory of merchandise prevents her from satisfying her customers appropriately. Never having had a loan from WAGES, she's requesting her first loan to buy fifteen sacks of charcoal, ten sacks of yams, and other items. She is married and the mother of three.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal and yams

loans.name: Uktam

texts.ru:
Уктам Холов  родился в 1979 году. Женат, отец 4 детей. Проживает в Истаравшане.
 Имеет десятилетний трудовой стаж. Он мастер-столяр по изготавливанию дверей и окон. Сырьем в его деле служит дерево.Для закупа сырья ему необходимы денежные средства. Узнав о нашем Фонде от соседа, который так же является нашим активным клиентом, он обратился к нам, за помощью. Ознакомился с условиями кредитования и подал заявку на получение кредита в размере 1600 сомони.
 Отец Уктама Холова живет вместе со своим сыном и его семьей, и вкладывает в семейные расходы часть суммы, получаемой от своей работы повором в сельской средней школе. Он поддержал своего сына в вопросе получения кредита от "Микроинвест", и уверен что после использования полученного кредита, дела его сына ускорятся и  улучшатся.
texts.en:
Uktam H. was born in 1979. He is married and is a father of four children. He lives in Istaravshan and has a ten year experience at his job. He is a carpenter and makes doors and windows. The raw material is mostly wood and to buy the raw materials he needs financial means. He has found out about this fund from a neighbor who is also our current client, so Uktam has come for help.
He has become familiar with the lending terms and has applied for a loan in the amount of 1600 somoni (US$425). Uktam's father lives together with Ukram's family and adds his earnings from his job working as a cook in a village school into the family's budget and expenses. He supported his son in the decision to take out a loan from MicroInvest and is certain that after using this loan his son's business will speed up and improve.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials - wood

loans.name: Bo

texts.en: Bo N. is thirty-eight years old and married with three young children, all too young to go to school. They live in Kampong Chhnang Province. She currently earns her daily income by planting crops on her own farmland that was inherited from her grandparents. Her husband is thirty-four years old and owns a car which he runs as a taxi service. Bo saw that the investment her neighbor made in selling groceries was a profitable one. That is why she has decided to seek a loan as capital to begin running a grocery store out of her house.

loans.use: To sell groceries from her house.

loans.name: 003-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Thoai  Nguyen Thi is fifty-three years old and lives in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Thoai is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by one of Kiva's field partners, the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 003-Quang Hung.

Thoai is married and has two adult children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  Thoai  has been engaged in this business for over five years.

In 2004, Thoai joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Thoai has successfully repaid previous loans.  One loan was used to purchase young livestock to raise and sell.  She is now requesting a new loan which will be used to purchase more young livestock.  This will be her ninth loan.  Thoai  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Pham Thi Dinh is fifty-five years old and is requesting a loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

2.  Nguyen Thi Loan is thirty-three  years old and is requesting a loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

3.  Nguyen Thi Phuc is sixty years old and is requesting a loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

About the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of "Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women" (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

loans.use: To buy young livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Hurshedjon

texts.ru:
Хуршеджон Махмудов вот уже 7 лет работает маляром. Он один из членов группы по ремонту жилья.Ежедневно,кроме выходных, с 7 утра и до 8 вечера, Хуршеджон трудится на работе, занимаясь покраской стен и полов квартир и домов.
 Он женат, имеет 2 детей.Хочет получить займ в размере 200 сомони, для приобретения необходимых основных средств для ремонта.  
 Кроме ремонта домов и квартир, он подрабатывает таксистом. Развозит клиентов по месту требования, и делает это в нерабочие дни.
texts.en:
Hurshedjon M. works as a painter for seven years now. He is one of the group members for home repairs. Hurshedjon works hard painting the walls and floors in houses and apartments every day from 7am to 8pm except weekends.

He is married and has two children. He wants to take out a loan in the amount of 200 somoni (US$75) to buy the necessary materials for the remodeling. Besides doing home renovations he also works as a taxi driver part time. He transports customers to their destinations and does that on his days off.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru:
Азиза мать четверых детей, проживает в Чкаловске в секционных квартирах.Она имеет бизнес продажи хозяйственных товаров, в ларьке возле дома.Её ларёк не такой уж большой, но имеет ассортимент нужных для дома товаров.Азиза кредитуется уже третий год.Каждый свой кредит она использует на закуп товаров.
По закупу ей помогает её дети.Муж работает водителем такси.Азиза до поздна торгует в своём ларьке.Она сама утверждает, что в кредит её очень выгодно поддерживать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Aziza is a mother of four children. She lives in the city of Chkalovsk in section apartments. She has own business selling home products in a kiosk near her home. Her kiosk is not very big, but has an assortment of necessary home products. Aziza has been taking out loans for three years now. She uses each loan to buy more goods. In this her children are helping her. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Aziza works in her kiosk very late. She assures that with loans it's very profitable to support her business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy home products

loans.name: Holida

texts.ru: Холида кредитор в Микроинвест с 2007 года.Она имеет свой маленький бизнес продажи кухонных принадлежностей( вилок, ножей, ложек).Товар привозит из города Истаравшана, из знаменитого оптового базара.Её оборотный капитал потихоньку увеличивается, благодаря кредитам она продолжает свою деятельность, а также и улучшает уровень жизни семьи.Торгует она на рынке Худжанда, каждый день.Из-за большого стажа торговли у Холиды много своих постоянных клиентов, которые покупают у неё товар.На фото Холида в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Holida is a client of MicroInvest since 2007. She has her own small business selling cutlery such as forks, knives, spoons. She brings the goods from Istaravshan from the known wholesale market. Her working capital increases little by little and thanks to the loans she is continuing her business and also improves her living conditions. She sells on the market of Khujand every day. Holida has an extensive experience in sales and has many regular customers who buy the goods from her. On the photo Holida is on her day of getting the loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy forks, knives and spoons

loans.name: Kolaban Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kolaban est constitué de cinq  femmes mariées (dont 3 monogames et 2 polygames) qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent à Kapelekoulou  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république  du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur neuvième  prêt solidaire, tous les passés ont été bien remboursés.
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de chaussures, de bois de chauffe, de vêtements, des fruits et légumes, la restauration (haricot, riz) et la teinture.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 50 colis de chaussures, 2 sacs de 50kg de haricot et 3 sacs de 100 kg de riz pour la restauration. Elles s’approvisionnent dans les marchés de Bamako (capitale du Mali), de Médine à Sikasso ville et dans les localités avoisinantes. Les marchandises sont vendues dans les différents  marchés de Sikasso et dans les familles à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant et en détail .
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Kolaban ambitionnent  acheter pour certaines, un terrain à usage d’habitation et d’autres ouvrir leur propre boutique à Sikasso.
texts.en:
The Kolaban group consists of five married women (2 in monogamous households and 2 in polygamous ones) who are 37 years old on average and have 5 children on average. They live in Kapelekoulou, one of the districts in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers, and are seeking their ninth solidarity (group) loan. All their previous loans were repaid without problems. They run various businesses which include, among others, preparing food (rice and beans), dyeing, and selling shoes, firewood, clothing, fruits and vegetables. With this new loan, they intend to buy 50 packages of shoes, two 50-kg bags of beans, and three 100-kg bags of rice for food preparation. They supply themselves at the markets in Bamako (the capital of Mali), Medine, Sikasso, and in the neighbouring villages. Their goods are sold at various markets in Sikasso and to families door-to-door, to a clientele composed of men and women, most of whom pay in cash at retail. They each foresee realizing an average monthly profit of 22,500 FCFA, of which one portion will be used for their families' needs, and the rest invested in their businesses. Some of the women of the Kolaban group aspire to buy a plot of land to live on, and the others hope to open their own shops in Sikasso.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items

loans.name: Marufat

texts.ru:
Маруфат  Солиева занимается животноводством 10 лет. Купив домашний скот определенный период она откармливает его, а затем перепродает.Так же, дома у Маруфат есть дойная корова, молоко которой она перерабатывает и продает соседям своего кишлака.
 Маруфат женщина 43 лет,проживает в Истаравшане с мужем и детьми. 
 Дополнительный доход в ее семью приносит выращивание сельхозкультур, в котором помогает ее муж, и пошив национальных женских платьев,в котором ей помощник ее дочь.
 Маруфат узнав об условиях кредитных продуктов нашего Фонда, подала заявку на получение кредита в размере 1600 сомони, сроком на 6 месяцев, для закупа корма для скота и переработки молока.
texts.en:
Marufat S. has been raising livestock for 10 years. After purchasing livestock she fattens it for a specified period and then sells it. Also, Marufat has a dairy cow at home; she processes its milk and sells it to her neighbors in the village. Marufat is a 43 year old woman; she lives in Istaravshan with her husband and children. Additional income for her family is earned by growing crops, which her husband helps with and the sewing of traditional women’s dresses which her daughter helps with. Marufat, having found out about the terms of the credit products from our Fund, applied to get a credit of 1600 somoni for a 6 month period in order to purchase feed for the livestock and for milk processing.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feed and milk processing

loans.name: Nisolat

texts.ru: Нисолат женщина 55 лет, которая продаёт женскую одежду на воскресных больших базарах Худжанда.Товар привозит с Бишкека, сама, ездит на такси один раз в месяц.Нисолат хочет для расширения летнего ассортимента товаров получить очередной кредит.Она ни разу пока не нарушала критерии кредитования и во время погашает свои займы.Нисолат на месте своего бизнеса во время торгового дня.
texts.en:
Nisolat is a 55-year-old woman that sells women's clothing at Khujand's big Sunday bazaars. She brings in the goods herself by taxi once a month from Bishkek. Nisolat would like to take out a loan to expand her range of summer items. She has always complied with the terms of her loans, and made her payments on time. Nisolat is at her place of business during the workday.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of women's clothing

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe  Badeya  sont toutes mariées dans des familles  monogames avec une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et  4 enfants. Elles habitent à Médine  un des  quartiers de la ville de Sikasso  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur  onzième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but  de  satisfaire le besoin de la  clientèle et augmenter leur profit. Tous les prêts précédents ont été  remboursés sans difficulté. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de savons, de fruits, de tubercules (pomme de terre et igname). 
Elles comptent acheter,  50 cartons de savons, 20 colis de fruits, 15 sacs de pomme de terre et 200 kg d’igname. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso, Bamako et dans  les villages environnants. Les marchandises sont vendues au comptant, en détail et à crédit au grand marché de Sikasso ville  sur place, à domicile et de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour aider les maris à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités et le remboursement du prêt.
Les femmes du groupe Badeya ambitionnent de devenir des commerçantes grossistes à Sikasso.
texts.en:
The four women of this Badeya group are all married and come from monogamous families with an average age of 42 and on average, 4 children. They live in Médine, a neighborhood of the town of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They are on their 11th loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with the intention of satisfying the needs of their clientele and increasing their profit. All the preceding loans were reimbursed without difficulty.

They have diverse businesses, among others selling soap, fruit, root crops (potatoes and cocoyams). They intend to buy 50 cases of soap, 20 containers of fruit, 15 sacks of potatoes, and 200 kg of cocoyams. They do their buying at the big open-air market of Sikasso, in Bamako, and in the surrounding villages. The merchandise is sold for cash, retail and for credit in the big market of Sikasso town where they live, out of their homes, and door-to-door, to a clientele composed of women and men.

They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 18,000 F CFA of which part will be used to help their husbands support their families and the rest will be reinvested into their businesses and used to reimburse the loan. The ambition of the women of this Badeya group is to become wholesalers in Sikasso.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Markaz

texts.en: Markaz was born in 1955. He is married, has 4 children. This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan town Fizuli, settled in the Shukurbayli village of Fizuli. Three years ago he started a taxi business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 Azerbaijan New Manats to buy the spare parts for improving his taxi business.

loans.use: Spare parts for taxi

loans.name: Дилрабо

texts.ru: Дилрабо женщина , которая кредитуется в Микроинвест второй раз.Она жительница города Худжанда,, 13 микрорайона.Рядом с домом у неё расположена её точка торговли.Она продаёт продукты питания.Из-за отдалённости данного микрорайона , все жители покупают товары у Дилрабо.Т.к у неё не большая наценка на товары, у Дилрабо много клиентов, и торговля всегда кипит.По бизнесу её помогает её сын, который вместе с матерью закупает товар на оптовом рынке.На снимке Дилрабо в своём ларьке.
texts.en:
Dilrabo is a woman who is borrowing from MicroInvest for a second time. She is a resident of the city of Khujand, district 12. She has a sales location next to her home. She sells food products. Because of the far location of her district all the residents purchase products from Dilrabo. Because she has a small premium on her products, Dilrabo has a lot of customers and sales are always brisk. Her son helps her in her business; he purchases products together with his mother at the wholesale market. On the photo is Dilrabo in her store.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of food products

loans.name: Davron

texts.ru:
Даврон Косимов по национальности узбек, проживает он в г.Истарвшане.
Основной деятельностью, который приносит хорошую прибыль в его семью,является животноводство. У Даврона огромный 18 летний опыт в этой сфере деятельности. Дома, он имеет 7 голов крупнорогатого скота. 
 Даврону 45 лет, он живет с женой Мукаддас и 4 детьми. Жена Мукаддас, помогает ему в уходе за крупнорогатым скотом.Кроме этого, супурги занимаются сельским хозяйством, а сам Даврон подрабатывает штукатурщиком. В этой же сфере деятельности, ему всегда помогает сын Чавшан.
 Займ Даврон хочет получить для откорма скота,с последующей его продажей. 
 Требуемая сумма 1200 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Davron K. lives in the city of Istaravshan. His primary business, which brings in a good profit for his family, is animal husbandry. Davron has an 18-year experience in this business field. He owns 7 cattle at home. Davron is 45 years old and lives with his wife Mukaddas and 4 children. Mukaddas helps him to take care of the livestock. Besides this business, the husband and wife are also involved in agriculture, and Davron works as a plasterer. His son Chavshan helps Davron with the latter work. Davron wants to obtain a loan to feed and then sell livestock. He needs a sum of 1200 somoni with a term of 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding

loans.name: Sugra

texts.en: Sugra (her husband is pictured)is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, settled in Fuzuli region, in the Kayidish settlement. They have 4 children. They have been in this business for 5 years. Now they need a loan of 2000 Azerbaijan New Manats to buy fruits and vegetables for improving their business.

loans.use: Fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Anzurat

texts.ru:
Анзурат Чумаева работает санитаркой в городской больнице Истаравшана. Но так, как санитарки получают очень маленькую заработную плату, она дополнительно занимается животноводством у себя дома. Помогает ей муж Мазбут.
 Анзурат хочет получить займ 1200 сомони, для закупа корма для скота и переработки молока.
 Анзурат мать двоих детей, ей 42 года, содержать семью родителям помогает сын Анзурат. Он зарабатывает на хозяйство, изготовлением окон и дверей на заказ.
 Семья Чумаевых проживает в городе Истаравшане.
texts.en:
Anzurat C. works as an orderly at a hospital in the city of Istaravshan. However, because orderlies make very little money, she is also involved in animal husbandry at home. Her husband Mazbut helps with the business. Anzurat wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 1200 somoni in order to purchase livestock feed and for milk processing. Anzurat is a 42-year-old mother of two. Her son helps his parents to support the family. He helps the household by manufacturing windows and doors. The Chumaev family lives in the city of Istaravshan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feed and milk processing

loans.name: Advija

texts.en:
Advija was born in 1968, she is married and mother of two children. Her husband has seasonal work, he is a wall painter. He can earn a good living when he has a job but during the off season Advija`s family spends her husband`s savings. 

Advija is house wife and as with many Bosnian women she keeps busy in her garden producing vegetables for her family. Advija does also poultry in the season. She is the old client of WWI and is now requesting her third loan in the amount of 1,200 Marka to extend her business. She will use this loan to buy vegetable seeds and more poultry. She wants to raise and resell it, thereby providing more household income. That will help her family to live a better life.

loans.use: To purchase seed and poultry

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Señor Carlos Chávez tiene 33 años y está casado con la señora Cinthia González que tiene 22 años de edad. Ambos son padres de dos hijos; una nena de 8 años que sea grande quiere ser enfermera y un varón de 1 año que a su padre le gustaría que sea un respetable abogado.

 El cliente era empleado de un Comercial denominado Deposito El sol, y con un pequeño ahorro inició hace 8 años su propia microempresa, que consiste en la venta de artículos de bazar y mercería. Más adelante tiene pensado tener un local propio, para la venta ya que cuenta con clientela formada. Su esposa también lo ayuda en el negocio.

 El dinero del préstamo será destinado a la compra de remeras y blusas para volver a venderlo.

Desea un país con mayor seguridad y que mejore la situación económica.
texts.en:
Carlos Chávez is 33 years old and married to Cinthia González, who is 22 years old. They have two children, a girl who is 8 years old and wants to be a nurse, and a boy who is 1 year old, who Carlos hopes will be a respectable lawyer.

Carlos was employed by a company called Deposito El Sol, and with a small savings started his own small business 8 years ago, selling clothing. In the future, he hopes to have his own store, as he already has a client base. His wife also helps with the business.

This loan will be used to purchase tshirts and blouses to be sold.

Carlos would like a safer country, and an improved economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
La Sra. Adelaida G. de 40 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Adolfo Báez de 43 años de edad, ellos tienen 2 hijos que están cursando sus estudios primarios.
   Doña Adelaida empezó este negocio con el capital que su esposo junto trabajando como albañil, aproximadamente en el año 2001, ellos venden sus productos recorriendo en los almacenes o despensas, en la actualidad ya tienen su clientela bien formada.
   Ella utilizaría este crédito para comprar más mercaderías atendiendo que venderían más en este tiempo de frio.
texts.en:
Adelaida G. is 40-years-old and married to Adolfo Báez, 43. They have two children, who are in grade school. Adelaida started up her business in around 2001 with capital that her husband earned as a bricklayer. They travel around selling their products to shops and mini-markets. At this point their client base is well-established. Adelaida plans to use her loan to buy more merchandise, because sales will increase during the cold weather.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es trabajadora del hogar, tiene dos hijos a los cuales los mantiene sola  pues su esposo la abandonó, su hija tiene un puesto donde vende chocolates y dulces y con esta actividad colabora a la manutención de su familia, la señora vive en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la calle los pinos, Zona Pasanqueri de la ciudad de La Paz.  


El crédito lo destinará para la compra de dulces y galletas así ampliara más su negocio. 
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Virginia is a home worker. She is the sole support of her two children because her husband abandoned her. Her daughter has a stall where she sells chocolates and sweets, and this contributes to the family maintenance. Virginia lives in a rented housed on Calle los Pinos, in the Pasanqueri zone, in the city of La Paz. She will use the loan to buy sweets and cookies to increase her business. This is her second loan with Impro. An evaluation shows that she qualifies for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweets and cookies for her stall where she sells this type of merchandise.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La Sra Catalina O. de Santacruz tiene 52 años de edad esta casada con el señor Arnaldo Santacruz de 53 años de edad. 

Cuenta que vive en su casa con su esposo y sus tres hijos todos solteros que siguen estudiando distintas carreras Universitarias.  La señora es profesora jubilada, cuando dejo de asistir a la escuela sintió la necesidad de emprender algún negocio ya que ella se siente con muchas fuerzas de seguir trabajando.

Es asi que empezo con una despensa en su domicilio con la ayuda de su esposo que tenia experiencias en ventas ya que se dedicaba a la venta de frutas y hortalizas.

Hoy en dia el negocio es un Autoservis con mucha clientela donde trabaja tambien sus hijos que reciben una remuneración para poder costear sus estudios.

En esta oportunidad solicita un crédito para la compra de harina,azucar,quesos, lacteos, almidón para de esa forma aumentar su stok de estos productos en estas fechas Santas que tendrán mucha demanda.
texts.en:
Catalina O. de Santacruz is 52 and married to Arnaldo Santacruz, 53. She lives in her house with her husband and their three children, who are single and still studying for their college degrees. Catalina is a retired teacher. When she stopped teaching, she felt like she needed to start a business since she had a strong desire to keep working. She opened a mini-market in her house with the help of her husband, who had experience with sales since he had earned his living selling fruits and vegetables. Nowadays the store is self-service with lots of customers, and her children work there, too, to earn money to pay for their studies. Catalina is seeking a loan at this time to buy flour, sugar, cheeses, dairy products, and starch to increase her stock for the holidays, when demand will be high.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, corn, sugar, cheeses, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es pequeña agricultora y productora de leche de vaca con la que elabora quesos por cantidad para la comercialización en las ferias populares de Viacha; también  trabaja como artesana y confecciona mantas para cholitas; el esposo es panadero y con esta actividad colabora con sus ingresos que cubren la manutención de sus cuatro hijos; viven en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la Provincia Ingavi – Achica Baja (a dos horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto). 

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de una vaca lecheras de mediana calidad lo cual ayudará para incrementar la producción de quesos.
 
Es el cuarto  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarlo otro préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Sonia is a small time farmer and producer of cow milk, which she uses to make cheeses to sell at the local markets of Viacha. She also works as an artisan making blankets for little girls. Her husband is a baker and together they are able to cover the family expenses and support their four children. The family lives with Sonia's parents in la Provincia Ingavi - Achica Baja, which is approximately two and a half hours from the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase a milk cow of average quality, which she will use to increase her production of cheeses. This is her fourth loan with Impro. Her good standing and prompt loan payments have qualified her for the loan she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow to increase the production of cheeses.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana Maria es pequeña agricultora y productora de leche de vaca con la que elabora quesos por cantidad para la comercialización en las ferias populares de la ciudad de La Paz, el esposo trabaja de obrero en la empresa de Ladrillos en Viachas; estas actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingreso con lo que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos de 1, 3 y 6 años de edad; viven en la casa alquilada ubicado en la Provincia Ingavi – Achica Baja (a dos horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto). 

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad que  ayudará para el incremento de la producción de los quesos.
 
Es el cuarto  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarlo otro préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is a small farmer and producer of cows' milk from which she makes cheese in quantity for the commerce of the popular fairs of the city of La Paz. Her husband works as a laborer in the brick business in Viachas. These activities are their main sources of income with which they cover the maintenance of their three children, one, three, and six years old. They live in a rented house in the province of Ingavi - Achica Baja, two and a half hours from the city of El Alto. The loan is intended to buy a milk cow of medium quality that will help them increase the production of cheeses. This is the fourth loan with Impro. Their good repayment performance permits the approval of this other requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow to increase the production of cheese.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca tiene 39 años de edad y esta casada con el señor Julio Cesar Pattenden hace 18 años. 

Es ama de casa, comerciante y costurera a la vez. Tiene dos hijos de nombres; Cesar Andres Pattenden de 17 años de edad quien se encuentra cursando el 3º año de la media en el Colegio Nacional Pedro P. Peña y Daisy Gabriela de 13 años de edad cursando el 8º grado en el Colegio Maristas de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo. 

La señora es la que atiende su ferreteria que monto con su marido, ademas trabaja en su profesion que es la costura de ropas sobre medida.

Realizo dicho credito para la compra de más materiales para su ferreteria y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por dicho apoyo.
texts.en:
Ms. Francisca is 39 years old and has been married to Mr. Julio Cesar Pattenden for 18 years. She is a housewife, businesswoman, and seamstress all in one. She has 2 children named: Cesar Andres Pattenden, 17, who is currently in his 3rd year at Nacional Pedro P. Peña high school and Daisy Gabriela, 13, who is in 8th grade at Maristas high school in the city of Coronel Oviedo. It’s Ms. Francisca who takes take care of the hardware store she started with her husband. She also works in her profession, which is sewing custom made clothing. She’s asked for this loan so she can buy more materials for her hardware store and thanks Fundación Paraguaya for its support.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de articulos de ferreteria para la venta.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
El señor Wilson  vive en casa en anticretico, en la zona  de Villa El Carmen, zona periférica de ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora y sus tres hijos.
El señor Wilson es empleado en una fábrica de refrescos y su esposa vende cosméticos casa por casa. 
La vivienda que adquirieron en anticretico se esta deteriorando a causa de las lluvias, lo que trasciende a sus muebles.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción e impermeabilización  de la vivienda.
Esta es la primera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Wilson lives in a house in “anticredito” (a special type of rental arrangement in Bolivia). He lives with his wife and three children in the Villa El Carmen zone outlying the city of La Paz. Wilson works in a soft drink factory, and his wife sells cosmetics door to door. The house they acquired via “anticredito” is deteriorating due to the rains. The water leaks onto their furniture. The loan is to repair and waterproof the house. This is the first time that they have asked for a loan. Their socioeconomic evaluation shows that they qualify for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair and waterproof the house where they live.

loans.name: Martín

texts.es:
El señor Martín M.  vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Alpacoma, área periférica de la ciudad de El Alto, con su esposa y sus tres hijos.
El señor Martín es oficial de policías, con cuyos ingresos sostiene a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de gradas, ya que su deterioro la hace peligrosa para sus hijos menores, además de la habilitación de una habitación-tienda en su domicilio, para que su esposa pueda abrir una tienda de abarrotes y tenga ingresos y mejore los ingresos de la familia.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Martín M. lives with his wife and three children in his own house in the Alpacoma neighborhood, in the vicinity of the city of El Alto. Martín is a police official and with that income he supports his family. The loan he is requesting is to fix the stairs in his house, since they have deteriorated which makes them dangerous for his young children. He also wants to remodel a room in his house so that his wife can open a grocery store and her earnings would increase the family's income. This is the second time that they have requested a loan. The results of their socio-economic analysis are favorable and they have been approved for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Maria O. de 24 años de edad está casado hace un año con el señor Dario Flores de 25 años de edad el matrimonio no cuenta todavía con hijo.

El negocio empezó a funcionar hace un año atrás con un capital que ella pudo juntar, además le ayudo su hermana que trabaja en el mismo ramo. Ella hace 2 años que es funcionaria de la municipalidad de Caaguazú y con lo que pudo ahorrar empezó el negocio. A la mañana el negocio es manejado por el marido de Maria y ella a la tarde ya está por el negocio realizando todo tipo de trabajo como fotocopias, encuadernaciones, trabajo por computadora , además está muy bien ubicada cerca de varias escuelas, colegio y universidad.

La Señora Maria está estudiando la carrera de Derecho, junto con su marido y están próximo por culminar la carrera y el objetivo de la pareja es hacer crecer el negocio y terminar su carrera universitaria.-

Solicita este préstamos para comprar otro máquina y así cumplir con todos los pedidos
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Olmeda, 24, has been married for one year. Her husband, Dario Flores is 25. They do not have children yet. Last year she put her money together and started her business. Her sister, who works in the same field, helped. She worked for the Caagauazú municipality for 2 years. That’s how she was able to save and start her business. Her husband runs the business in the mornings, and Maria runs it in the afternoons. They do all types of work like making photo copies, bookbinding, and computer work. Also, they are well located near several schools, a high school, and a college. Maria and her husband are studying law, and they are close to finishing. Their objective is to expand their business and finish their university studies. She is asking for a loan to buy another machine to be able to complete all of the orders they receive.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a computer

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El Señor Edgar Velázquez tiene 27 años de edad y está casado con su señora quien tiene 32 años. Ambos son padres de una niña de 9 años de edad llamada Guadalupe, quien desea estudiar artística.

  El cliente trabaja en la terminal de ómnibus en donde vende pasajes para La Empresa de Transporte público San Luis S.A., y cuenta con 9 años de antigüedad. Su esposa es ama de casa.

 El préstamo solicitado será destinado para terminación de una vivienda que está construyendo, en donde tiene pensado en un futuro no muy lejano montar un negocio, consistente en una despensa y carnicería ya que cuenta con una ubicación estratégica.

Desea un país con mayores oportunidades para la gente que quiere trabajar.
texts.en:
Edgar Velásquez is 27, and his wife is 32. They have a 9 year old daughter, Guadalupe, who wants to study art. For 9 years he has worked as a ticket agent in the bus terminal for public transportation in San Luis S.A. His wife is a housewife. The loan is to finish the house he is building. In the near future he plans to install a store and butcher shop since they have a strategic location. He would like a country with greater opportunities for people who want to work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction on his house to be able to set up a store

loans.name: Yanacocha Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios del banco comunal  “YANACOCHA”, son vecinos D. la zona D. surquillos, situado en el distrito D. Calca en la provincia del Cusco, ubicado a 1:30 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.

Los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades, teniendo como principal actividad la agricultura y  ganadería, en las épocas D. siembra, en resto del año ellos alternan sus actividades agrícolas con los diferentes negocios, que son, la crianza D. aves D. corral,  la compra y venta D. semillas, D. verduras, D. frutas, D. tiendas D. abarrotes, negocio D. mecánica y reparación. Los socios solicitan el préstamo para poder incrementar más sus productos y así tener mayor productividad.

Ellos se encuentran sumamente agradecidos con el apoyo otorgado mediante este medio y ratifican su deseo D. trabajo duro para poder cumplir sus metas y también se comprometen al pago total D. su préstamo en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank "YANACOCHA" are residents of zona D. surquillos, which is situated in the Calca district in the province of Cuzco, one and a half hours away from the city of Cuzco.

The group members are involved in different activities. During the sowing season their primary activities are agriculture and raising livestock. For the rest of the year they supplement their agricultural activities with other businesses. These businesses incluD. raising poultry, buying and selling seeds, vegetables and fruits, general stores, mechanic work and repair. The group members are soliciting this loan to buy more products with the intent of becoming more productive.

They are very thankful for the help they receive through these means and have all pledged to work hard to reach their goals and pay back their loan within the defined repayment term.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Morris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and run their businesses and farms

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Don Eduardo T. de 62 años de edad está casado con la Señora Amada González de 59 años de edad; el matrimonio cuenta con 7 hijos, todos casados, cinco de ellos son profesionales recibidos de la carrera de  Licenciatura de la Educación.

  Don Eduardo hace ocho años se desempeña como taxista en la terminal de ómnibus de Caaguazú. En dicho rubro se inició alquilando vehículos de sus amigos para realizar el servicio de taxi durante cuatro años. Luego con la platita que iba ganando y ahorrando se pudo comprar su propio vehículo. Actualmente Don Eduardo ya es conocido en la Ciudad de Caaguazú como uno de los Taxistas que mejor atención ofrece  a sus clientes.

  Como sueño personal desea comprar una camioneta para utilizarla en el ramo del taxi, ya que dicho vehículo genera más ingresos.

   El cliente solicito el préstamo para completar el capital que tiene para la compra de una camioneta.
texts.en:
Eduardo T. is 62. His wife, Amada González, is 59. They have 7 children. All of the children are married, and five of them are professionals with degrees in education. Eduardo has been working as a taxi driver in the Caaguazú bus terminal for eight years. He started out renting vehicles from his friends to provide taxi service. He did that for four years. Then, with the money he was earning, he bought his own vehicle. Eduardo is currently known in the city of Caaguazú as one of the taxi drivers who offers the best service. His personal dream is to buy a van to use in his taxi service. A van generates more income. He is asking for a loan to add to the money he has to buy a van.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his tax

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La Señora Graciela de 43 años de edad es separada y vive con su hija Mirta de 20 años de edad.
 
Doña Graciela se hace 7 años decidió emprender su propio negocio de ventas de mercaderías varias.  Ella sale a vender sus mercaderías por el interior del país. Ya cuenta con una  clientela bien formada gracias a la buena atención que les da.

Como sueño personal desea ampliar su negocio y así poder ofrecer más variedades de productos a sus clientes. 

La clienta solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías para su posterior venta.
texts.en:
Graciela is 43, and she is separated. She lives with her 20 year old daughter, Mirta. For 7 years she has had her own business of selling varied merchandise. She goes to the interior of the country to sell her merchandise. She has a good customer base thanks to the good service she gives her customers. Her personal dream is to expand her business to be able to offer her customers a better variety of products. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise to later sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy brand name footwear to sell

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida O. is a 35-year-old married mother of one.  Her son is currently in nursery school. She lives with her husband and son in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana. Vida works to help her husband financially support the family. Her husband is a church pastor in their community and she is a trader dealing in fishing equipment.  She sells items such as nets, ropes, and other equipment in a store at the market square. She buys all the goods in Accra.  Vida has been in this business for over twenty years and wants to use the loan to buy goods in bulk. She hopes to provide her children with the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment in bulk for her store.

loans.name: Janet
