texts.en: Janet A. is 35 years old and a married mother of three children, one son and two daughters.  Her children are currently in primary school or junior high school. Janet lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.  She works to help her husband financially support the family. Her husband is a commercial driver and she is a baker.  She buys bags of flour and other ingredients from Accra and uses them to bake bread which she sells at the local market and also supplies to beverage sellers and retailers. She has been in this business for ten years and would like to use the loan to buy flour in bulk. Janet hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour in bulk for her baking business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia A. is a 35-year-old married mother of four children, two sons and two daughters. All of her children are currently attending primary or junior high school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana. Cecilia works to help her husband provide for the family. Her husband is a commercial driver and she is a textiles trader selling materials such as linen, lace, and printed textiles.  She buys the goods in Accra and sells them in her community and also treks to sell in other towns as well. Cecilia has been in this business for eight years and will use the loan to purchase textiles in bulk. She hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To purchase more textiles for her business.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa De Caaguazu Group

texts.es:
Este comité  integrado por 16 Sras.  a diario trabajan ya que son las que llevan el dinero ganado con sus trabajos para mantener a sus familias, cada una tiene un oficio en donde invertir el préstamo  que la Fundación Paraguaya les brinda  les ayudara  a cada una para invertir en sus negocios y así poder tener mas ganancias.  

Este comite´denominado Kuña Guapa, está integrado con señoras que desean un cambio en sus vidas en lo personal y económico, es por eso que se unieron para conformar un grupo solidario con el fin de contar con una herramienta de trabajo que la fundación Paraguaya les otorga, que es un crédito activo para que ellas hagan un buen uso e inversión en sus oficios diarios, ellas  poseen las ganas de trabajar en grupo, tienen  espíritu emprendedor y por sobre todo las ganas de progresar, y tomar una responsabilidad  conjunta todas ellas.

Las integrantes son: 

Elizabeth G.	- Vendedora Ambulante, Vta. de frutas y verduras
Ramona E. Cañete 	 - Macatera vta. De ropas usadas
Blasia Antonia B.	 - Almacén
Edita B. de Orue	-  Vendedora Ambulante, vta. de mandioca
Mirian C. Benitez	 -  Venta de Frutas y Verduras
Julia R. Diaz	  -  Almacen
Marina R.	 - Macatera vta. De Ropas
Maria Silvia S.	-  Merceria Cotillon
Petrona O. de Morinigo	-  Vendedora ambulante De Verduras
Claudelina González	-  Macatera Vta. De Ropas
Pablina Ester F.	-  Macatera Vta. de cubiertos, utensilios para el hogar
Epifania C.	-  Vta. De Bijouterie
Claudelina C.	-  Macatera Vta. De ropas y perfumes
Cresencia M.	-  Vta. de Frutas y Verduras
Ramona B.	-  Modista
Dominga V.	-  Macatera vta. de utensilios para el hogar
texts.en:
This group is made up of 18 women who work every day, since they are the ones bringing in the money to support their families. The loans from Fundación Paraguaya help the members, each of whom has her own occupation, invest in their businesses so they can earn more income. The members of the Kuña Guapa (Guarani for Hard-Working Woman) group are women who want to make a change in their personal and economic lives. They joined together in a supportive group so they could obtain the tools of the trade that Fundación Paraguaya offers, namely loans that they can invest in their daily occupations. They have the desire to work in a group, enterprising spirits, and, above all, the desire to progress and take responsibility as a group. The members of the group are: Elizabeth G. – Traveling Sales – Fruits and Vegetables Ramona E. Cañete – Used Clothing Sales Blasia Antonia B. – Grocery Store Edita B. de Orue – Traveling Sales - Tapioca Mirian C. Benitez – Fruit and Vegetable Sales Julia R. Diaz – Grocery Store Marina R. – Clothing Sales Maria Silvia S. – Party Notions Petrona O. de Morinigo – Traveling Sales - Vegetables Claudelina González – Clothing Sales Pablina Ester F. – Sales – Cutlery and Utensils for the Home Epifania C. – Jewelry Sales Claudelina C. – Clothing and Perfume Sales Cresencia M. – Sales – Fruits and Vegetables Ramona B. - Dressmaker Dominga V. – Sales of Household Utensils

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: These merchants, saleswomen, and shopkeepers will use their loan to buy more merchandise to sell, including fruits, vegetables, cheese, chickens, etc.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy K., 41, is married and has four children, two sons and two daughters. According to her, all her children are currently in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast, Ghana.

Mercy works to support her family. Her husband is a commercial driver while she is a trader. She trades household items such as soap, coal pot, vegetable oil, vegetables, charcoal, to mention but a few. She procures the goods from Accra. Mercy sells in a shop at the local market. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Mercy is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: Buy household items.

loans.name: Alejandrina Lila

texts.es:
La señora Alejandrina Lila O. M. tiene 34 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Alfa y Omega y vive en el caserío de Carabamba en la provincia de Julcán el departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Tiene estudios superiores, pero no concluyó porque tuvo su segundo hijo y está delicado de salud.  Alejandrina tiene 3 hijos.
Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, tiene una bodega.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas compró artículos de primera necesidad los que vendió a muy buen precio.
Con este crédito de S/.1,000 que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de alimentos y comprará artículos de librería.
Alejandrina sueña con tener un Mini Mercado para poder abastecer mejor a los pobladores de Carabamba.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alejandrina Lila O. M., 34, belongs to the Alfa y Omega community bank. She lives in the village of Caramba, Julcán province, La Libertad department, Perú. She attended college. She did not finish because she had her second son, and his health is delicate. Alejandrina has 3 children. She sells groceries, and she has a grocery store. With her first loan of 300 PEN, which she repaid in 4 payments, she bought basic needs items that she sold at a good price. With this loan for 1,000 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy ingredients for food preparation and bookstore items. Alejandrina dreams of having a mini market to be able to better supply the inhabitants of Carabamba.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food preparation.  Buy bookstore items.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys T., 21, is married and has a son.  According to her, her son is currently in nursery school.  She lives with her son and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana. 

Gladys works to provide for the family.  Her husband is a trader in footwear.  Gladys is also a trader.  She trades ready-made textiles for ladies.  Gladys procures goods from Accra and distributes to retailers.  She also hawks in her community and treks to sell in other towns as well.  Gladys has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy textiles in bulk.  She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: Procure textiles.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
La señora Filomena es socia del Banco Comunal Manuela Ramos  del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 58 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 5 hijos.  Vive en el Jr. Santa Cruz y cuenta con estudios de 2do de primaria.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 10 años e inició su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió comprar mas abarrotes para su negocio.
En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de S/ 2000.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mayor cantidad de abarrotes como arroz, ázúcar, huevos, etc., para agrandar su negocio y surtirlo con más productos.  Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando en la ferias.
texts.en:
Filomena is a member of the Manuela Ramos community bank in the Mazocruz district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 58, married, and has 5 children. She lives on Jr. Santa Cruz. She has a second grade education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 10 years. She started with a loan of 300 PEN, and she bought groceries for her business. She currently needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy more groceries like rice, sugar, eggs, etc. to expand her business and stock it with more products. Her biggest desire is to continue working at the fairs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries like rice, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys M., 26, is married and has two children, one son and one daughter. According to her, both of her children are currently in the primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

She works to provide for the family. Her husband is a car sprayer. Gladys is a food vendor. She prepares and sells Kenkey with fried fish. Gladys procures bags of maize and other ingredients from Kumasi. She sells on a table top at the local market. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk. Gladys is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: Procure bags of maize.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia E., 28, is married and has three children, one son and two daughters. According to her, all of her children are currently in the primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

She works to provide for the family. Emilia’s husband is a caterpillar operator. She is a trader who sells a local drink made from maize. She procures bags of maize from the local market. Emilia hawks to sell and also sells on a table top at the local market. Emilia has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: Procure bags of maize.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A., 47, is married and has two children; sons. According to her, one son is currently in junior high school while the other is a senior high school student. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

She works to provide for the family. Her husband is a commercial driver. Margaret sells porridge. She prepares it in her house and sells in front of her house. Margaret procures bags of maize and beans from the local market. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk. Margaret is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: Procure bags of maize and beans.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina A., 30, is married and has two children, one son and one daughter. According to Sabina, her son has completed junior high school while her daughter is in the primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

Sabina works to provide for the family. Her husband is a motor repairer. She trades in printed textiles materials. She procures the goods from Accra. Sabina hawks to sell in her community and also treks to sell in other towns as well. She also sells utensils. Sabina has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure textiles in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: Procure textiles.

loans.name: Naa

texts.en:
Naa Y., 39, has been a widow for four years. She has two children, one son and a daughter. According to her, the girl is in senior high school while the boy is in primary school. Naa lives with her children in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

She works very hard to provide for the children. Naa is a caterer and takes orders from customers and also cooks to sell as well. She bakes bread and other pastries and supplies to retailers. Naa procures bags of flour and other ingredients from Accra. Naa has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour in bulk. Naa is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: Procure bags of flour.

loans.name: Cristina  Toribio

texts.es:
La señora Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal Dios es Amor del Distrito de Mazo-Cruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente sin hijos, vive en el barrio José Antonio y cuenta con estudios de primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el MMR desde medio año inicio su préstamo con la suma de 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió iniciar su negocio de compra de alpacas vivas. 

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 800.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá hacer crecer su negocio ya que ella compra animales vivos luego los comercializa como carcasa, lo cual le permite incrementar su capital, de la misma forma agradece al MMR por la confianza y el apoyo que brinda a las mujeres para poder apoyar a su familia económicamente.  Su mayor deseo poner una tienda y culminar la construcción de su casa, asi mismo decea poner un criadero de truchas, le gusta las reuniones.
texts.en:
Cristina is a member of the Dios es Amor community bank in the Mazo-Cruz district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 35, in a common law marriage, and has no children. She lives in the José Antonio neighborhood. She completed elementary school. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for half of a year. She started with a loan for 500 PEN, which allowed her to start her business of buying live alpacas. She currently needs a new loan for 800 PEN to expand her business. She buys live animals and later sells the meat. This allows her to increase her capital. She is grateful to MMR for the confidence and support they give women so that they can support their families. Her biggest wish is to have a store and to finish the construction on her house. For herself, she would like to be able to have a trout farm. She likes the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell small livestock like sheep and pigs

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank O., 40, has three children, two sons and one daughter. According to him, all his children are currently school – senior high, junior high and primary school. Frank lives with his children and wife in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

He works very hard to provide for the family. His and his wife are traders. Frank trades in ready-made textiles such as Lacoste, t–shirts, jeans, etc. He procures the goods from Accra and hawks to sell in his community. He also treks to sell in other towns as well. Frank has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure clothes in bulk. He is hopeful to expand his business and give his children the best education he can afford.

loans.use: Buy ready-made clothes.

loans.name: Lelia Goretti

texts.es:
La señora Lelia  es socia del Banco Manuela Ramos  del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 1 hijo, vive en el Jr. José Antonio Chambilla y cuenta con estudios de 5to de segundaria.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años e inició su préstamo con la suma de 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir.
En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 1200.00 Nuevos Soles, con el cual comprará mayor de mercadería (ropa).  Además comprará un juegos de pinbooll.  Su mayor anhelo es comprarse una casa en Puno. Lo que más le gusta de su  Banco Comunal son las reuniones.
texts.en:
Lelia is a member of the Manuela Ramos Bank in the district of Mazocruz, in the province of Collao, in the region of Puno. She is 22 years old, has 1 son, and lives with the father of her son, José Antonio Chambilla. She studied until the fifth year of high school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 2 years, and she started her first loan with the sum of 500 Nuevos Soles [the Peruvian currency], which allowed her to expand her business of selling garments. Currently, she needs a new loan, for which she is asking for 1200 Nuevos Soles, with which she will buy more clothing. She will also buy pinball machines. Her greatest wish is to buy herself a house in Puno. What she likes best about her community bank are the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and pinball machines.

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame A., 32, is married and has five children, two sons and three daughters. According to him, all his children are in junior high and primary schools. He lives with his children and wife in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

He works very hard to provide for the family. His wife is a trader. Kwame is a fitting mechanic. He repairs broken down vehicles and deals in vehicle spare parts such as wheel cover, crank shaft, etc. He procures the goods from Accra and sells at his workshop in his community. Kwame has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure more car spare parts. He is hopeful to expand his business and give his children the best education he can afford.

loans.use: Buy vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael Q., 35, is married and has three children, one son and two daughters. According to him, all his children are in junior high and primary schools. He lives with his children and wife in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

He works very hard to provide for the family. His wife is a trader. Raphael is a carpenter by profession. He makes furniture such as bed, chairs, wardrobes, etc. for sale. He says he takes orders from clients. He procures the working materials such as wood, ply wood, upholstery materials, nails, etc. from Accra. He has a workshop in his community. Raphael has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy more working materials. He is hopeful to expand his business and give his children the best education he can afford.

loans.use: Buy working materials.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia Z., 38, is married and has three children, one son and two daughters.  According to her, all her children are in the junior high and primary schools.  She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.  Amalia works to support her husband financially to provide for the family.  Her husband is a commercial driver.  She trades textiles materials – linen, lace, printed textiles etc.  Amalia procures goods from Accra.  She hawks to sell in her community and also treks to sell in other towns as well.  Amalia has been in business for twelve years and wants a loan to procure textiles in bulk.  She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: Procure textiles.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A., 30,is married and has three children, one son and two daughters.  Her sons attend junior high primary schools.  She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.  She works to support her husband financially to provide for the family.  Her husband runs a drug store.  Elizabeth is a food vendor. She sells porridge.  Elizabeth prepares it in her house and sells by the road side.  She procures bags of maize and beans from the local market.  She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and beans in bulk.  Elizabeth is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: Procure bags of maize and beans.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.es:
La señora Inocencia  es socia del Banco Manuela Ramos del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 74 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive en el Barrio 3 de Mayo y es iletrada (analfabeta).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 12 años e inició su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su negocio de compra y venta de ganado auquénido.
En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de S/ 700.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mas ganado y así poder seguir trabajando.
Manifiesta que le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque recibe capacitación en temas de interés.
texts.en:
Inocencia is a member of the Manuela Ramos Bank in the Mazocruz district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 74, married, and has 2 children. She lives in the Barrio 3 de Mayo. She is illiterate. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 12 years. She started with a loan for 300 PEN, which allowed her to increase her business of buying and selling “auquénido” (a species between the llama and the vicuna). She currently needs a loan for 700 PEN to buy more livestock and be able to keep working. She likes the community bank meetings because she receives training on interesting topics.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fatten “auquénido” (a species between the llama and the vicuna).

loans.name: Renox

texts.en: Renox E. is married with one child.  He has a junior high school education.   For 10 years Renox has worked as a car mechanic and he also sells spare parts at Siwdo in Cape Coast.  His wife is employed as a trader.  Renox uses his income to pay for his family’s financial expenses.  He will use the loan to purchase additional spare car parts for selling and the new profits to expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase additional spare car parts.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
La señora Delfina es socia del Banco Manuela Ramos  del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 53 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 6 hijos, vive en el Barrio Villa Esperanza calle del ejercito y cuenta con estudios de 3er grado de primaria.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 11 años e inicio sus préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta abarrotes.
En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mayor cantidad de productos para su negocio y poder surtirlo, comprará gaseosas, golosinas, huevos,, otros.
Su mayor deseo es comprarse una casita.
texts.en:
Señora Delfina is a member of the Manuela Ramos Bank in the Mazocruz District, Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 53 years of age, living with her domestic partner and has six children. She lives in the Villa Esperanza neighborhood, on Army Street, and has completed a third grade primary education. The Señora has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last eleven years. She began with a loan of 300 New Sols which enabled her to increase her working capital for her business selling groceries. At present, she is requesting a new loan in the amount of 500 New Sols. This would allow her to buy larger quantities of merchandise and to stock up her business. She is going to buy soft drinks, sweets, eggs and other things. Her greatest desire is to buy herself a little house.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, sweets, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora es socia del Banco Comunal Manuela Ramos del Distrito D. Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 60 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 6 hijos, vive en el Av. Tacna y cuenta con estudios D. 1er grado (primaria).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 2 año e inició su préstamo con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. venta D. carnes.
En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto D. 1500.00 Nuevos Soles, con el cual comprará mayor cantidad D. carne y asi seguir trabajando para su vejes.
Lo que le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las reuniones donD. recibe capacitación.
texts.en:
Aurora is a member of the Manuela Ramos Communal Bank in the district of Mazocruz, Collao province, department of Puno. She is 60 years old, married, and has 6 children. Aurora lives on Tacna Avenue and has a 1st graD. education. Aurora has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 2 years. She started out with a loan of 300.00 soles, which enabled her to increase her capital for her meat-selling business. Aurora currently needs a new loan. She is asking for 1500.00 soles, which she will use to buy a larger quantity of meat so that she can continue earning money for her retirement. What Aurora likes most about her communal bank are the savings opportunities and the meetings that offer training sessions.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing meat

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Reyna M. se dedica a laborar arduamente en la venta de leche en el municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León. Ella es una dama que ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio y está comprometida con el bienestar de su familia por lo que hoy en día ha iniciado a reconstruir su casa de habitación porque ha estado en malas condiciones. 

Por este motivo ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de los materiales de construcción como lo es 10 laminas de zinc , 250 ladrillos , 10 bolsa de cemento y piedra. Con estos materiales logrará continuar en su reconstrucción y así saldrá adelante en la mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señora Reyna M. works very hard selling milk in the municipality of Nagarote in the city of León. She is a lady who has succeeded in getting ahead with her business and is committed to the well-being of her family for whom at this time she has begun to remodel her residence because it has been in poor condition. For this reason she has requested a loan from CEPRODEL for the purchase of construction materials such as ten galvanized steel panels, 250 bricks, ten bags of cement and stone. With these materials she will be able to continue with her remodeling work and that would be a big step forward in the renovation of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz es socia del Banco Manuela Ramos  del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 3 hijos, vive en el Jr. José Antonio Chambilla y cuenta con estudios superiores de técnica de enfermería incompleta.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramis desde hace 5 años e inició su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió comprar zapatillas.
En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 2000.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá comprar zapatillas por docenas y así poder agrandar su negocio.
Su mayor deseo es poner un bazar o su propia fábrica de zapatillas.
texts.en:
Señora Beatriz is a member of the Manuela Ramos Bank in the Mazocruz District, Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 29 years old, married and has three children. She lives on José Antonio Chambilla Avenue and has some upper level education in nursing but has not finished. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last five years and she started out with a loan for 300 New Sols with which she was able to buy sneakers. Currently she requires a new loan which she is requesting in the amount of 2,000 New Sols. This will allow her to buy sneakers by the dozen and thus be able to build up her business. Her greatest desire is to have a store or her own shoe factory.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy footwear

loans.name: Jorge Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Jorge G. se dedica a la actividad ganadera desde muy joven habiendo adquirido amplia experiencia porque fue entrenado junto con su hermano en la crianza de ganado.

Actualmente el señor Jorge ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de dos vacas paridas para su hato y así sacarles el máximo provecho con el fin de obtener ingresos para continuar con el mantenimiento de su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo por ser él la cabeza del hogar.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge G. has worked with cattle since he was very young, having gotten a lot of experience by learning, along with his brother, how to raise cattle. Mr. Jorge has come to Ceprodel today to apply for a loan to buy 2 calving cows for his herd. In this way, he can get the most from them and make more money, so he can continue maintaining his family who really needs his help since he’s the head of the household.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de dos vacas paridas

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel D. is single with no children.  He has received a junior high school education.  Since 2004, he has worked as an auto mechanic selling bulbs, starters, and other spare car parts at Siwdo in Cape Coast.  Daniel uses his income to pay for utility bills and food.  He will use the loan to increase his capital to buy more bulbs, starters, and other spare car parts for resale.  With the new profits from his expanded business, Daniel plans to reinvest.

loans.use: Buy more spare car parts for resale.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León, la señora María T. se dedica a su actividad de crianza de ganado el cual la lleva a cabo en su propia localidad alimentando su hato ganadero con el propósito de sacarle el máximo provecho para mantener a su familia.

Hoy en día requiere la compra de una vaca parida para su respectiva crianza y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y de esta manera salir adelante en su actividad y garantizar el bienestar a su amada familia que depende de él.
texts.en:
In the area of Nagarote in the city of León, señora María T. raises livestock, which she does in a location she owns. She feeds her herd with the goal of getting the most benefit out of it to support her family. Today she needs to buy a calved cow to raise, and this is why she has turned to Ceprodel to obtain a credit. In this way, she will get ahead and guarantee the well-being of her beloved family that depends on her.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calved cow

loans.name: Norman De Jesús

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León, el señor Norman S. se dedica a laborar arduamente en su negocio de venta de lácteos el cual son elaborados de la materia prima como lo es la leche de donde obtiene el queso, la cuajada y la crema.

El negocio le ha sido de mucho beneficio porque ha logrado salir adelante junto con su familia. Hoy en día espera en que Ceprodel le proporcione un crédito para la compra de leche , cuajo y sal para así elaborar los productos lácteos y ofertarlos en su localidad y también ofertar la leche pura la cual es comercializada de igual manera que el queso, la cuajada y la crema.
texts.en:
In the area of Nagarote in the city of León, señor Norman Solis works hard in the dairy business. He uses milk to make cheese, cuajada (a typical Nicaraguan cheese), and cream. His business has benefitted him a lot because he has managed to get ahead with his family. Today he hopes that Ceprodel will offer him a credit to purchase milk, rennet, and salt to make his products and sell them in his area. He will also sell milk, which he sells just like the cheese, cuajada, and cream.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase milk, rennet, and salt

loans.name: Sampson

texts.en: Sampson A., single with no children has received a junior high school education.  For eight years Sampson has worked as an auto electrician selling electrical parts, such as wire, at Siwdo in Cape Coast.  Sampson uses his income to support himself and pay his bills.  He will use the loan to purchase more electrical parts for selling and with the new profits, expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase parts for selling

loans.name: Rosa Ester

texts.es:
La señora Rosa M. se dedica arduamente a atender su pulpería que ella misma posee  en el municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León. Es importante destacar que ella se ha desarrollado en su negocio y ha salido adelante beneficiando a sus pequeños hijos.

Hoy en día ella atraviesa la necesidad urgente de obtener los productos y para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para hacer las compras a sus proveedores y luego ofertarlas en su pulpería que tanto requiere de su apoyo financiero para mantenerla.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa M. works hard attending to her small grocery store, which she owns in the area of Nagarote in the city of León. It is important to point out that she has grown through her business and has gotten ahead to benefit her young children. Today she has the urgent need to obtain products, and this is why she has turned to Ceprodel to be benefitted with a credit to make her purchases from her suppliers and later offer them in her store that is in so much need of financial support to keep it going.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of consumer goods

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León la señora Rosa V. desde hace 10 largos años se ha dedicado a su actividad de crianza y engorde de cerdos para posteriormente venderlos con el propósito de obtener ingresos y así subsistir. 

Es de importancia destacar que ella es una dama muy esforzada que ha salido adelante por medio de su negocio y es por esta razón que hoy en día ha llegado a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los cerdos y su alimentación con el fin de engordarlos y luego comercializarlos para obtener sus ingresos que tanto los necesita para mejorar su situación económica ya que es una dama viuda y ella es el único sustento del hogar.
texts.en:
In the area of Nagarote in the city of León, señora Rosa V. has raised livestock and pigs for ten long years. She raises them to later sell so she can earn an income and survive. It is important to point out that she is a hard-working lady who has gotten ahead through her business, and this is why today she has turned to Ceprodel to request a credit to purchase pigs and their food to fatten and later sell them. She needs income to improve her economic situation since she is a widow and is the only wage earner for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pigs and their food

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es:
La señora Constantina es socia del Banco Manuela Ramos  del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente tiene 5 hijos, vive en el Barrio 3 de Mayo Av. Del Niño y cuenta con estudios de 3ro de segundaria.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años e inició su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su negocio de compra y venta de carne.
En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo por el monto de 3000.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mayor cantidad de de carne.  Su mayor deseo es vender al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la solidaridad y los apoyos.
texts.en:
Señora Constantina is a member of the Manuela Ramos communal bank in the district of Mazocruz, in the province of Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 49, lives with her boyfriend, and has 5 children. She studied through her third year of secondary school. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 4 years, and her first loan was for 300 PEN, which let her expand her business by buying and selling meat. Currently she is requesting her ninth loan in the amount of 3,000 PEN, which will let her buy a larger quantity of meat. Her biggest dream is to become a wholesaler. What she likes most about her communal bank is the solidarity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Dios es Amor del Distrito de Mazo-Cruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil casada con 4 hijos, vive en el barrio José Antonio y cuenta con estudios de primaria completa.  
La señora Margarita viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace ya varios años, ella es una de las fundadoras de su Banco Comunal.  Obtuvo un primer préstamo de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar el capital para su negocio de abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, fideos).   
Con este préstamo de 2000.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual será pagado en 5 cuotas, comprará artículos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, entre otros, y así poder surtir  mejor su tienda para poder captar mayor cantidad de clientes. Su mayor deseo es educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Señora Margarita is a member of the "Dios es Amor" (God is Love) communal bank in the district of Mazo-Cruz, in the province of Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 49, is married, lives in the José Antonio neighborhood, and studied through primary school. Margarita has worked with Manuela Ramos for several years and is one of the founders of her communal bank. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which let her increase her capital for her grocery business (rice, sugar, and noodles). With this loan of 2,000 PEN, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy basic goods like rice, sugar, noodles, etc. She will then be able to better supply her store to attract a larger number of customers. Her biggest wish is to educate her children so they will become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of milk, sugar, rice, noodles, and other basic goods

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest O., a mechanic who makes engine blades also sells engine parts at Siwdo in Cape Coast, which he has done for three years.  Ernest is single with no children and has no formal education.  He is responsible for providing for himself and paying for his own expenses, such as rent.  His loan will be used to purchase materials for making engine blades and selling, and he hopes to use the new profits to reinvest.

loans.use: Purchase materials for making engine blades.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Manuela Ramos  del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 4 hijos, vive en el Barrio Villa Esperanza y cuenta con estudios de 4to grado de primaria.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 12 años, es socia fundadora e inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió comprar repuestos de moto.
En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 1000.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mayor cantidad repuestos para moto y así poder agrandar su negocio, su mayor deseo es comprarse una casa en Puno.  Manifiesta que le gusta la forma del trbajo que hace Manuela Ramos y los beneficios que ofrece a las muejres.
texts.en:
Señora Juana is a member of the Manuela Ramos communal bank in the district of Mazocruz, in the province of Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 44, is married, has 4 children, lives in the Villa Esperanza neighborhood, and studied through the fourth grade. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 12 years and is a founding member of her communal bank. She started with a loan of 300 PEN, which let her buy motorcycle parts. Now she is requesting her ninth loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN, which will let her purchase a larger quantity of motorcyle parts and to expand her business. Her biggest dream is to buy a house in Puno. She tells us that she likes the way Manuela Ramos works and the benefits they offer to women.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle parts

loans.name: Elena Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal Manuela Ramos del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 1 hijo, vive en el Barrio 3 de Mayo y cuenta con estudios de primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año  e inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió comprar carne para su negocio.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 800.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mayor cantidad de carnes para vender en la feria de Mazocruz.
Su mayor deseo es construir su casita. Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones.
texts.en:
Señora Bertha is a member of the Manuela Ramos communal bank in the district of Mazocruz, in the province of Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 29, lives with her boyfriend, has one son, lives in the Tres de Mayo neighborhood, and studied through primary school. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for one year. She started with a loan of 300 PEN, which let her purchase meat for her business. Currently she is requesting a new loan in the amount of 800 PEN, which will let her purchase a larger quantity of meat to sell in the market in Mazocruz. Her biggest dream is to build her own home. What she likes most about her communal bank are their meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meat wholesale

loans.name: Laila

texts.en: Laila A. has worked as a trader selling onions in bags and treated dinking water for five years, in Siwdo in Cape Coast.  She is married with four children and has received an education through junior high school.  Her husband also works as a trader.  Laila is responsible for paying her children’s school fees and for buying their books.  Her loan will be used to buy more drinking water for selling, and she hopes to use the new profits to reinvest.

loans.use: Buy more dinking water for selling.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia M. selling drinks and other groceries at Siwdo in Cape Coast which she has done for two years.  She is married with three children and has received a university level education.  While Cecilia works as a trader, her husband is employed as an electrician.  She is responsible for paying to feed the children and for some of the family’s other bills.  Her loan will be used to purchase more minerals, other groceries for sale and she hopes to use the new profits to reinvest.

loans.use: Purchase more minerals other groceries for sale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La señora Norma  es socia del Banco Manuela Ramos  del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 31 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente tiene 2 hijos, vive en el Barrio Villa Esperanza y cuenta con segundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 año e inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de abarrotes.
En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 1000.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mayor cantidad de productos para su negocio y surtirlo bien.
Piensa comprar asúcar, arroz, leche y otros productos de venta diaria.
texts.en:
Señora Norma is a member of the Manuela Ramos communal bank in the district of Mazocruz, in the province of Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 31, lives with her boyfriend, has 2 children, lives in the Villa Esperanza neighborhood, and studied through secondary school. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. She started with a loan of 300 PEN, which let her increase her capital for her grocery business. Currently she is requesting a new loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN, which will let her purchase a larger quantity of products for her business and to supply it well. She plans to buy sugar, rice, milk, and other products to sell daily.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries (rice, sugar, noodles, and milk)

loans.name: Claber Jasinta

texts.es:
La señora Claber Jasinta C. H. tiene 57 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen del Carmen, vive en la calle Alfonso Ugarte del sector Cochaya caserío de Salpo, de la provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta cuarto grado de educación primaria, pero no continuó estudiando porque no tenía apoyo de sus padres.
Se casó a los 19 años y tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 dependen de ella.
Su actividad económica consiste en la cria de animales, fabricación de queso y quesillo.
El primer crédito recibido fue de 300 soles los que canceló en 4 cuotas, recuerda con mucha alegría que con el primer préstamo compró queso, carne de cerdo y carnero, los que volvió a vender a muy buen precio.
Con este crédito de 500 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en medicina (fertilizantes) para la chacra.
Claber sueña con tener un buen capital para poder invertir en negocios diversos.
texts.en:
Señora Claber Jasinta C. H. is 57 and belongs to the Virgen del Carmen communal bank. She lives in the town of Salpo, in the province of Otuzco, in the department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied through fourth grade but didn't continue studying because she didn't have the support of her parents. She got married at 19 and has 5 children, 3 of whom still depend on her economically. She raises animals and makes cheese. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she paid off in 4 months. She remembers her first loan fondly and used it to buy cheese, pork, and mutton, which she resold for a good price. With this credit of 500 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in fertilizers for her farm. Claber dreams about having a good amount of capital to be able to invest in diverse businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The street saleswomen will use the loan to buy more products to sell. The vegetable and clothing saleswomen will use it to buy more merchandise and also to buy more fruits, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena es socia del Banco Manuela Ramos  del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en el Jr. Ejercito y cuenta con estudios de 5to se secundaria.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años e inició su préstamo con la suma de 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para la venta de golosinas y gaseosas.  Actualmente se dedica a la venta de carne.
Con este préstamo de S/ 2500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará mayor cantidad de carnes para su negocio y así agrandarlo.  Su mayor deseo es poner su emporio y necesita mayor capital.
Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la garantía solidaria.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elena is a member of the Manuela Ramos Bank of the Mazocruz district, Province of Collao, Department of Puno; she is 30 years old and is married with 3 kids, she lives in Jr. Ejercito and didn't finished high school. Mrs. Elena has been working with Manuela Ramos for the last 2 years, and her first loan was for 500 New Soles, which allowed her to increase her working capital to sell candies and sodas. She currently works selling meat. With the loan of S/ 2500 New Soles, she will buy more meat so her business can grow. Her biggest dream is to establish her business so she needs more capital. What likes most of the bank is the warranty of solidarity.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia  es socia del Banco Manuela Ramos  del Distrito D. Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 51 años D. edad, D. estado civil conviviente tiene 3 hijos propios y 7 adoptivos hijos, vive en el Barrio 3 D. Mayo Jr. 28 D. Julio y cuenta con estudios D. 3ro D. segundaria.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 10 años  e inició su préstamo con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su negocio D. compra y venta D. carne.
En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto D. 3000.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mayor cantidad D. D. carne.
Su mayor deseo es comprarse un carro para transportar su mercadería. Lo que más le gusta D. su  Banco Comunal es el cumplimiento D. las demás socias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucia is a member of Bank Manuela Ramos at the Mazocruz district, Province of Collao, Department of Puno; she is 51 years old, and lives with her partner, she has 3 children of her own and 7 adopted children, lives in the neighborhood of 3 D. Mayo Jr. 28 D. Julio, she didn't finished high school. Mrs. Lucia has been working with Manuela Ramos for the past 10 years, her first loan was for 300 new Soles, which helped her increase her business of buying and selling meat. Currently she wants a new loan for 3000 New Soles to buy larger quantities of meat. Her biggest wish is to buy a car so she can transport her merchandise. What she likes most about the community bank is the fulfillment of payment by all members.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La señora Olga  es socia del Banco Manuela Ramos  del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente tiene 4 hijos, vive en la Av. binacional y cuenta con estudios de 3ro de segundaria.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 años  e inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su negocio de venta de comida.
En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 3000.00 Nuevos Soles, para comprar insumo para la elaboraciónde comidas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga is member of the Bank Manuela Ramos from the district of Mazocruz, Province of Collao, Department of Puno; she is 39 years old, she lives with her partner and has 4 children, she lives in Av. Binacional and didn't finished high school. Mrs. Olga has been working with Manuela Ramos for the past 7 years and her first loan was for 300 New Soles, that helped her increase her business selling food. Currently she is requesting a new loan for 3000 New Soles to buy products to prepare the food she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to prepare food

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El Señor Pedro V. tiene 64 años de edad y tiene 4 hijos, todos mayores de edad.

El Señor Pedro se dedica a la producción de ladrillos, a base de barro cocido, que es utilizado como material principal en la construcción de una casa.

Empezó esta actividad con su padre, ya que se dedicaba a la misma actividad, quien al fallecer le dejó dicho trabajo aparte del inmenso conocimiento.

En la actualidad es una de las olerías (como es llamada en la zona a esta actividad) más importante ya que produce aproximadamente 35 a 40 mil ladrillos en forma mensual. Su éxito se debe a que los ladrillos que produce, son los más resistentes y de mejor calidad.
Gracias a este trabajo logró hacerse de casa propia, vivir dignamente y a la vez dar trabajo a personas de la zona.
El crédito solicitado es para la reparación de trapiche, que es utilizado para mezclar el barro, materia prima principal para la elaboración de los ladrillos.
texts.en:
Señor Pedro V. is 64 years of age and has four children, all adults. He works making bricks, made of fired earthenware, which are used as the principal material in the construction of a house. Pedro started out in this trade with his father, who was in this business, and when he passed away he left Pedro this business as well as his immense knowledge. Presently, it is one of the most important "olerías" (which is what they call the area where this work is done) since it produces approximately 35-40,000 bricks per month. His success is due to the bricks that he produces which are the most durable and best quality. Thanks to this work he has been able to build his own house, to live with dignity and at the same time to provide employment for people in the surrounding area. The loan being requested is for the repair of the "trapiche" which is used to mix the earth, the main raw material for producing the bricks.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the mixer.

loans.name: Mujeres Habiles Group

texts.en:
Andrea C. is the coordinator for the group called Mujeres Habiles which in English means "Able Women." Andrea is the owner of a store that sells clothing and other items and is excited to get her first loan from Esperanza. She has two children ages 13 and 19, the youngest is enrolled at a nearby school, and the other is studying medicine at a nearby university.

A dream Andrea has is to continue progressing in her business and life and be able to help people through her business. She would also like to have her own storefront in which to do business. In addition to the storefront, Andrea hopes to be able to afford to finish building the addition on her house that was started a while back. She hopes her children grow up to be professionals.

On behalf of Andrea C., Mujeres Habiles, and all of us here at Esperanza International, thank you for your interest in these entrepreneurs and effort to fight the global issue of poverty!

loans.use: Replenish supplies.

loans.name: 6 De Enero Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo a través de la Sra. Barsilisa P., a quien le gusto el programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de Fundacion Paraguaya, decidio invitar a sus vecinas y amigas del Asentamiento Org. 6 de Enero para trabajar juntas y poder progresar. Ellas estan acostumbradas a organizarse y se llevan muy bien. Ellas son independientes en sus labores como vendedoras de ropas, venta de comidas, venta de frutas, venta de joyas, Peluquera, etc. y reciben de crédito en un promedio de Gs. 563.636 cada una.

Las integrantes son:

They are well-organised and they all get along. They work independently as clothing vendors, in food, fruit and jewellery sales, as hairdressers etc. They will receive an average loan of 563.636 PYG each.

loans.name: San Antonio De Padua Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó a través de la Sra. Sara F., a quien le gusto el programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de Fundacion Paraguaya.  Ella decidio invitar a sus vecinas y amigas del Barrio La Floresta para trabajar juntas y poder progresar.  Ellas estan acostumbradas a organizarse por lo cual su grupo prospera. Ellas son independientes en sus labores como vendedoras de ropas, venta de comidas, venta de frutas, venta de joyas, modista, etc. y reciben de crédito en un promedio de Gs.588.000 cada una.  

Las integrantes son:

This group formed because Mrs. Sara F. liked the Mujeres Emprendedoras of the Fundacion Paraguaya program. She decided to invite her neighbors and friends from the La Floresta neighborhood to work and progress together. Because they are organized, their group prospers. They work independently in their work as a seamstress, sellers of clothes, food, fruit, jewelry, etc. The loan is for an average of $120 each. The members are: 1Sara F. - Seamstress 2 Eliodora S. – Clothing Sales 3 Victorina B. – Fruit Sales 4 Perla V. – Fruit Sales 5 Librada P. – Food Sales 6 Gladys V. – Mini Market 7 Lourdes Y. – Sells Cassava Melons 8 Maria V. – Sells Edible Organ Meats 9 Julia B. - Sells Cassava Melons 10 Maria L. – Sells Fruit 11 Atanacia O. – Sells Food 12 Eladia V. - Sells Cassava Melons 13 Carmen A. - Sells Cassava Melons 14 Maria B. – Sells Meat 15 Zunilda L. – Sells Chickens 16 Mirta D. - Sells Food 17 Ana T. - Photocopies

loans.name: San Cayetano-Potrerito Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo a través de la Sra. Maria M., quien se entero del programa por medio de una comadre y como tenia vecinas muy trabajadoras decidio formar su grupo en el Barrio Potrerito. Todas se esmeran dia a dia en vender sus productos para tener beneficios y llevarlo al hogar. 

Ellas son muy unidas y se ayudan entre si. Todas son independientes en sus labores como vendedoras de ropas, venta de comidas, venta de frutas, Peluquera, etc. y reciben de crédito en un promedio de Gs. 704.700 cada una.

Las integrantes son: 

1	Maria M.	-  Venta de Pollo
2	Virginia M.	-  Venta de mandioca
3	Eumelia M.	-  Venta de comida 
4	Beatriz M.	-  Peluquera

This committee was started by Maria M., who found out about the program through a close friend and since she had some hard-working neighbors, decided to start a group in Barrio Potrerito. Each of them makes an effort every day to sell their products so they have earnings to take home. They are united and help each other out. All of them work independently selling clothing, food, fruit, as hairdressers etc. and they received an average loan of Gs. 704,700 each. The members are: 1 Maria M. - sells chicken 2 Virginia M. - sells cassava 3 Eumelia M. - sells food 4 Beatriz M. - hairdresser 5 Juana V. - sells food 6 Sonia Centurión - sells cosmetics 7 Ilda V. - sells cassava 8 Juliana R. - sells cassava 9 María L. - sells clothing 10 Lucía López - sells clothing 11 Rosalina M. - sells food 12 Fatima R. - sells cassava 13 Maria M. - sells clothing 14 Raquel V. - sells second-hand clothing 15 Dionisia V. - sells cassava 16 Florentina L. - sells milk 17 Nilda S. - sells fruit 18 Mirian J. - sells clothing 19 Flora F. - sells clothing 20 Ester F. - sells perfume 21 Nancy S. - sells food

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es socia del Bancomunal Sol de Alegría.
Alejandra es casada tiene 68 años, tiene 6 hijos todos están casados.
Alejandra puso su bodega hace años, empezó poco a poco, comenzó vendiendo gaseosas, después dulces y conforme ganaba iba comprando mas mercadería. 
Alejandra necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de sacos  azúcar, arroz, gaseosa. 
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió como invertir mejor el dinero del préstamo. 
El sueño de Alejandra es tener su tienda bien surtida.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a member of the Sol de Alegría communal bank. She is 68 years old and has 6 children, all of whom are married. Alejandra started a convenience store several years ago. She start off bit by bit, selling soft drinks and later candy, and as she earned money she bought more merchandise. She needs a loan for 1,000 soles to buy sacks of sugar, rice and soft drinks. Since she has been in Finca, she has learned how to better invest her loans. Alejandra´s dream is to have a well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn  es socia del Bancomunal Sol de Alegría.
Evelyn es casada tiene 31 años, un hijo de dos años.
Evelyn estudio enfermería técnica, pero no pudo trabajar por que el negocio familiar de sus padres empezó a crecer  y sus padres le pidieron que  trabaje con ellos Evelyn  acepto trabajar con sus padres cocina y administra el restaurante que tiene por nombre las chinchanitas.  
Necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles,  para la compra de menaje de cocina, platos, cubiertos, bandejas.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió administra mejor su negocio, a saber invertir, para que el negocio crezca.
El sueño de Evelyn es tener un restaurante propio.
texts.en:
Evelyn is a member of the Sol de Alegría communal bank. She is married, 31 years old and has a 2-year-old son. Evelyn studied to be a nurse technican but could not work because her parents´ business began to grow and they asked her to work with them. She agreed to work with her parents and cooks for and runs the restaurant which is called "Chinchanitas". She needs a loan for 2,000 soles to buy kitchenware, plates, eating utensils and serving trays. Since she has been in Finca she has learned how to better run her business and how to invest so that the business grows. Evelyn´s dream is to have her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy kitchenware, plates, eating utensils and serving trays.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria Magdalena es socia del Bancomunal Sol de Alegría.
Maria Magdalena  tiene 32 años, es conviviente  tiene dos hijos de 11 y 15 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Maria Magdalena  tenia una bodega en su casa, pero cerro por que la competencia era mucha y las vecinas solo querían que se les fié, se puso a vender salchi-papas, hamburguesa en la puerta de su casa empezó con una mesita y una cocina, después de compro un carrito samwichero, sus hijos le ayudan. 
Maria Magdalena necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de mesas, sillas y mercadería.  
Maria Magdalena  desde que esta en Finca  aprendió a invertir bien su dinero aprendió ahorrar puede comprar cosas que antes no compraba para su casa, también puede comprar mas alimentos para sus hijos.
El sueño de Maria Magdalena es abrir un restaurante.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena is a member of the Sol de Alegría communal bank. She is 32 years old, lives with her common-law husband and has two children, 11 and 15 years old, who are studying in public schools. María Magdalena had a convenience store in her home, but closed because competition was stiff and her neighbors only wanted to buy on credit. She began to sell salchi-papas (a fast food dish of fried hot dogs and french fries) and hamburgers from her front door. She started off with a small table and her kitchen and later on bought a vending cart. Her children help out. María Magdalena needs a loan for 1,000 soles to buy tables, chairs and supplies. Since she has been in Finca she has learned to invest her money and save so she can buy things which before she was unable to buy for the house. She can also now buy more food for her children. María Magdalena´s dream is to open a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tables, chairs and supplies.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina es socia del Bancomunal Sol de Alegría.
Agustina es casada tiene 48 años  tres hijos16, 11 y 9 años que están en la escuela estatal.
Agustina tenia una ferretería ella distribuía materiales para ferretería a varios locales  pero se enfermo de la columna por cargar las cosas, dejaba a crédito a quince días y a  un mes y tuvo que cambiar de giro puso un restaurante le va mejor, cada día hay entrada de dinero. 
Agustina necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles, para la compra de mesas, sillas, menajes de cocina para su restaurante.
Desde que esta en Finca puede invertir mas, su economía ha mejorado, aprendió ahorrar aprendió  a ser responsable con los prestamos    
Agustina tiene un sueño que es poner un restaurante.
texts.en:
Agustina is a member of the Sol de Alegría communal bank. She is married, 48 years old and has three children, 16, 11 and 9, who are in the public schools. Agustina had a hardware business and distributed hardware supplies to various shops, but she hurt her back from carrying so much and gave out credit at 15 days and 1 month, so she had to change her line of business. She started up a restaurant, which is going better for her, and there is money coming in every day. Agustina needs a loan for 2,400 soles to buy tables, chairs and kitchenware for her restaurant. Since she has been with Finca she now invests more, her finances have improved, and she has learned to save and to be responsible with her loans. Agustin´s dream is to start up a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables, chairs, kitchenware for her restaurant.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
Marcela es socia del Bancomunal Sol de Alegría.
Marcela es casada tiene 37 años, dos hijos de 18 y 16 años que estudian en instituto superior.
Marcela desde hace tres años vende productos de bellaza por catalogo, pero necesitaba mas ingresos y  hace seis meses  se asocio con una señora para vender comida, alquilo una casa   y  actualmente vende comida por las tardes    
Marcela necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de cosméticos y flores por el día de la madre. 
Desde que esta en Finca, le han orientado mas sobre su negocio, como enfrentarse  a la competencia, como administrar el dinero. 
El sueño de Marcela es tener otro negocio,  de ropa o de zapatos, el negocio de comida es  muy trabajoso.
texts.en:
Marcela is a member of the communal bank, "Sol de Alegría" (Sun of Happiness). She is married and is 37. She has 2 children who are 18 and 16 who study in a university. Marcela has sold beauty products by catalog for 3 years, but she needed more income, so 6 months ago she joined with a woman to sell food. She rented a house and currently sells food in the afternoons. Marcela needs a loan of 1,200 PEN to purchase cosmetics and flowers for Mother's Day. Since she has worked with Finca, they have taught her more about her business, how to prepare for competition, and how to manage money. Marcela's dream is to have another business, such as selling clothing or shoes, as selling food is very labor intensive.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Marcela needs a loan of 1,200 PEN to purchase cosmetics and flowers for Mother's Day

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria  es socia del Bancomunal Sol de Alegría.
Victoria es casada tiene 50 años, cinco hijos,  los tres mayores están casados y los de 16 y 19 años están estudiando en la escuela estatal. 
Victoria se dedica a cuidar a sus hijos, también a  bordar chompas semanal borda 50 chompas desde hace 20 años, hace dos años junto un dinero y se compro una moto -taxi, su hijo de 19 años la maneja y ella administra el dinero de la moto-taxi.  
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles,  para el cambio de toldos de la moto por paneles de fibra de vidrio.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió administra su negocio de moto-taxi el dinero del negocio no se debe tocar, se ahorra es lo que ha aprendido, le gusta las reuniones  por que se distrae.
El sueño de Victoria es abrir una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Sol de Alegría comunal bank. She is married and she is 50 years old and has five children. The three oldest are married and the two that are 16 and 19 are studying in the state school. Victoria takes care of her children and she also embroiders sweaters. She has been embroidering 50 sweaters per week for the past 20 years. Two years ago, she saved up some money and bought a motorcycle taxi. Her 19 year-old son drives it and she manages the money from it. Victoria needs a loan of 1000 PEN to change the fabric coverings on the motorcycle taxi for fiberglass panels. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned to administer her motorcycle taxi business, especially that money for the business itself can’t be touched. She has learned to save and she likes the meetings because they’re fun. Victoria’s dream is to open a small grocery store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Victoria needs a loan of 1000 PEN to change the fabric coverings on her motorcycle taxi for fiberglass panels.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria del Rosario es socia del Bancomunal Sol de Alegría.
Maria del Rosario es casada tiene 40 años, dos hijos de 16 y 9 años que están estudiando  en la escuela estatal.
Maria del Rosario es programadora de sistemas, no ejerció por que se caso se dedico a su casa y a cuidar a sus hijos, con los ahorros familiares que tenían  hace tres años compraron un carro de segunda el cual su esposo da servicio de taxi todos los días. 
Maria del Rosario necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de repuesto para su carro, llantas batería, para que pueda funcionar mejor.
Desde que esta en Finca Maria del Rosario aprendió como trabajar en el negocio, como ahorrar, también tiene mas amigas por que paraba en su casa.
El sueño de Maria del Rosario es comprarse un auto nuevo.
texts.en:
María del Rosario is a member of the Sol de Alegría comunal bank. She is married, she is 40 years old, and she has two children, 16 and 9 years old, who are studying in the state school. María del Rosario is a systems programmer, a career in which she did not participate because she got married and took care of the house and her children. Three years ago, using the family savings, they bought a used car that her husband drives as a taxi every day. María del Rosario needs a loan of 1200 PEN to buy parts for her car, tires, and a battery, so that it can run better. Since she has been with Finca, María del Rosario has learned how to work in her business, how to save, and she also has more friends because before she just stayed at home. María del Rosario’s dream is to buy a new car.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: María del Rosario needs a loan of 1200 PEN to buy parts for her car, tires, and a battery, so that it can run better.

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
Mirtha  es socia del Bancomunal Sol de Alegría.
Mirtha es casada tiene 32 años, un hijo de 4 años que esta en el jardín.
Mirtha estudio secretariado cuando termino no pudo trabajar por que su papa se enfermo y sus planes cambiaron. Al tiempo Ella empezó vendiendo jugo de naranja, pero no le salía mucho, pensó en algo que tenga mas salida y que pueda ofrecer a sus clientes, era dar desayuno, ella  vende desayunos  en el mercado todos los días. Por las noches esta estudiando enfermería geriátrica.
Mirtha necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de insumos como azúcar, leche, quinua, harina, para la preparación de desayunos.
Desde que esta en Finca cuenta con un capital para la compra de víveres para dar el desayuno. 
El sueño de Mirtha es terminar sus estudios y tener un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a member of the Sol de Alegría comunal bank. Mirtha is married, 32 years old, and has a 4 year-old son in kindergarten. Mirtha studied to be a secretary, but when she finished her studies she couldn’t work because her father fell ill and her plans changed. She eventually began selling orange juice, but this didn’t earn much. She thought something that would earn more and that she could offer to her customers was selling breakfast. She sells breakfasts in the market every day. In the evenings she is studying geriatric nursing. Mirtha needs a loan of 800 PEN to buy ingredients such as sugar, milk, quinoa, and flour for preparing the breakfasts. Since she has been with Finca, she has had the capital she needs to buy ingredients for her breakfasts. Mirtha’s dream is to finish her studies and have a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mirtha needs a loan of 800 PEN to buy ingredients such as sugar, milk, quinoa, and flour for preparing breakfasts.

loans.name: Eva Maria

texts.es: La señora Eva Maria G., tiene la edad de 25 años, habita en el barrio esquipulas, ubicado en km11 ½ carretera Masaya, junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como taxista para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, los planes hacia su hogar es poder formar una familia y agrandar mas su negocio;  ella desde hace seis años tiene una panadería y repostería, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento para poder invertir en su inventario y abastecer a todo su clientes .Con el financiamiento obtenido lo va invertir en compra varias como: harina, azúcar, chocolate y todo lo que sea para hacer sus queques, da las gracias a la institución de Afodenic por el apoyo que ha tenido, lo cual se ha beneficiado para incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Eva María G. is 25 years old. She lives in the Esquipulas neighborhood, located at kilometer 11 ½ on the highway to Masaya, with her husband, who works as a taxi driver to help out with the household expenses. Their plans for their home are to have children and to expand their business. Eva María has had a bakery and cake decorating business for six years. The biggest difficulty she has is the lack of financing she needs to be able to invest in inventory and supply all of her clients. With this loan, she will invest in buying: flour, sugar, chocolate, and everything she needs for her cakes. She is grateful to the Afodenic institution for the support she has had, which has benefited her in the growth of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, and other ingredients she needs to make her cakes.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, tiene 36 años y  vive en su propia casa junto a sus 2 hijas Deys de 9 y Deysi de 2 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El negocio de Catalina es la venta de combustible, el cual vende ambulatoriamente, desde muy temprano sale a la calle en busca de clientes, quienes no dudan en comprarle debido a los precios cómodos que ofrece, ella es una vendedora muy persuasiva y generalmente siempre vuelve a su casa con los bidones vacíos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 10 años en este negocio y lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en la calle soportando los cambios repentinos del clima, aun así sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para alcanzar sus metas. Más adelante espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender su combustible con mayor comodidad. Catalina se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con MFP, está muy decidida a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria con las demás. Con los mil quinientos soles solicitados planea comprar más combustible e incrementar la cantidad que vende diariamente.
texts.en:
Catalina is a joyful and hardworking woman. She is 36 years old and lives in her own house, along with her 2 daughters, who are 9 and 2 years old. They are the reason for all her hard work. Catalina’s business is fuel sales, which she does as a street vendor. She goes to work very early in the morning in search of customers, who have no doubts about buying from her due to the affordable prices she offers. She is a very persuasive salesperson and almost always returns home with her containers empty. What she likes most about her job is talking with her customers. She has been doing this for 10 years and the most difficult part is having to be in the street all day, putting up with sudden changes in the weather. Even so, she knows she has to work very hard to achieve her goals. She hopes eventually to have a store where she can sell her fuel in more comfortable conditions. Catalina is in her second loan from MFP. She is very determined to make her payments on time because she would like to receive future loans. In her communal bank she is a very participative and is supportive of everyone else. With her loan of 1500 PEN she plans to buy more fuel and increase the amount she sells daily.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory of merchandise (fuel)

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena es socia del Bancomunal Juan Pablo II
María Elena tiene 58 años es viuda, hace seis, dejo el negocio por la muerte de su esposo, se puso a vender cosméticos por catalogo  
María Elena necesita  un préstamo de  2000 soles, para la compra de joyas y cosméticos por catalogo. 
Desde que María Elena esta en Finca aprendió a trabajar, a saber invertir y hacer independiente, porque ella dependía de su esposo para todo.
El sueño de María Elena es tener de nuevo su peluquería y su vitrina llena de cosméticos.
texts.en:
María Elena a member of the Juan Pablo II cooperative bank. María Elena is 58 years old and a widow. She started her business selling cosmetics by catalog six years ago, when her husband died. María Elena needs a loan of 2000 soles, to purchase jewelry and cosmetics by catalog. Since María Elena has been with Finca, she has learned about business, how to invest, and how to be independent since previously she relied on her husband for everything. María Elena’s dream is to again have a beauty salon and her display case full of cosmetics products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: María Elena needs a loan of 2000 soles, to buy jewelry and cosmetics by catalog.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina es socia del Bancomunal Juan Pablo II
Karina  es casada tiene 45 años un hijo de 24 años que estudia instituto superior.
Karina estudio secretariado no pudo terminar por que salió embarazada y se dedico a su hijo,  y cuando su hijo estaba ya grande se puso a trabajar en la venta de ropa y zapatos previo pedido.  
Karina necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles, para la compra de ropa y zapatos por el día de la madre. 
Desde que Karina esta en Finca aprendió administrar el dinero y ahorrar, antes no podía ahorrar se gastaba todo, en Finca pudo lograrlo.
