El sueño de Karina es tener una tienda para venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the Juan Pablo II cooperative bank. Karina is married, 45 years old, and has a 24-year old son who is continuing his studies. Karina started in secretarial school, but was not able to finish because she started a family and instead dedicated herself to her son. When her son was grown, she began working selling clothing and shoes. Karina needs a loan of 2400 soles to buy clothes and shoes for Mother’s Day. Since Karina joined Finca, she has learned to manage money and save. Before, she wasn’t able to save and spent everything. That has changed, however, since she started with Finca. Karina’s dream is to one day have her own clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Karina needs a loan of 2400 soles, to buy clothes and shoes for Mother's Day.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar es socia del Bancomunal Juan Pablo II
Pilar es conviviente tiene 45 años, tiene un hijo de un año.
Pilar trabajaba en el bazar del ejército, sufrió un accidente y dejo de trabajar, después de un tiempo alquilo un puesto y puso un  bazar en el mercado y por las tardes vende salchi-papas. 
Pilar necesita un préstamo de 2800 soles, para la alhajas de oro de catorce por el día de la madre
Desde que está en Finca aprendió ahorrar, ser responsable, su económica ha mejorado tiene más capital para invertir.
El sueño de Pilar es comprarse un puesto en el mercado.
texts.en:
Pilar is a member of the Juan Pablo II cooperative bank. Pilar is married, 45 years old, and has a one-year-old son. Pilar worked at the military store, but suffered an accident and had to stop working. After some time, she rented a stall in the market and sold salchi-papas (pan fried sausage mixed with French fries) in the afternoons. Pilar needs a loan of 2800 soles to buy 14k gold jewelry for Mother’s Day. Since starting with Finca, she has learned how to save, be responsible, and her financial situation has improved as she has more capital to invest. Pilar’s dream is to buy her own stall in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pilar needs a loan of 2800 soles, to buy 14k gold jewelry for Mother's Day.

loans.name: Elba

texts.es: Elba de 32 años, desde muy joven luchó por salir adelante, vive en la casa de sus familiares junto a sus 3 hijas; Yeni de 14, Luz de 10 y Belinda de 10 meses, a quienes desea dar unos buenos estudios. Se encuentra en el negocio de la venta de hoja de coca, actividad que le ha sido muy rentable y le ha dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, compra las hojas al por mayor, para luego repartirla entre sus clientes, también tiene su puesto de venta en la explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca) donde vende diariamente la sagrada y típica hoja. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus vecinas de venta y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en la feria, le es muy difícil permanecer todo el día en su puesto, ya que le resulta muy cansado y estresante, sabe que si quiere alcanzar sus metas tiene que trabajar muy duro y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Este es el tercer préstamo de Elba con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es muy querida por sus socias debido a la alegría que pone en el grupo. Con los mil ochocientos soles que solicita comprará más hojas de coca y así incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende.
texts.en:
Elba is 32 years old, and has worked hard from a young age to get ahead. She lives in her relative’s house together with her 3 daughters; Yeni, who is 14, Luz who is 10, and Belinda who is 10 months old. She wants to provide a good education for them. She is in the business of selling coca leaves (traditionally chewed or brewed like tea), an activity which has proven to be very profitable and has provided the necessary income to support her family. She buys the leaves at wholesale, to later distribute among her customers. She also has a stall at the Laguna Temporal esplanade (site where the markets of the city of Juliaca take place), where she sells the sacred and traditional Incan leaves on a daily basis. She has been doing this activity for 15 years, and what she enjoys most is the companionship with the other saleswomen and finding out what is going on at the market. It is difficult for her to stay at the market all day, as she ends up very tired and stressed. She knows that, in order to meet her goals, she has to work hard and is prepared to do so. This is Elba’s third loan with MFP, and she has been on time with her previous payments and hopes to do so this time as well. She is well-liked by the other members of her cooperative bank for the good cheer she brings to the group. With the 1,800 soles that she is requesting she will buy more coca leaves, and that way be able to increase the amount of merchandise she has to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia  es socia del Bancomunal Juan Pablo II
Julia es casada tiene cinco hijos, todos mayores y ya están casados.
Julia vendió por ocho años en el mercado en un puesto lencería, medias, pero decidió poner en su casa una pequeña bodega  bazar donde vende cosméticos y lencería.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 3400 soles, para la compra de cerveza  y una exhibidora de gaseosas.
Desde que está en Finca, aprendió ahorrar por el sistema de ahorros que tiene finca, también aprendió  a ser puntual. 
El sueño de Julia es ser mayorista de cerveza y gaseosa.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Juan Pablo II cooperative bank Julia is married and has five children, all grown and married. Julia sold items such as undergarments and socks from a stall in the market for eight years, but then decided to open a store in her house where she sells cosmetics and undergarments. Julia needs a loan of 3400 soles to buy beer and a soft drink display case. Since she started with Finca, she has learned how to save through their system. She also learned how to be punctual. Julia’s dream is to be a wholesaler of beer and soda.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Julia needs a loan of 3400 soles, to buy beer and a soft drink display case.

loans.name: Elicia

texts.es: Elicia es una madre muy responsable y amorosa con sus 3 hijos; Soledad de 10, Rosmeri de 8 y Rodrigo de 11 meses, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es brindarles unos buenos estudios. Su puesto está ubicado en la explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan las ferias en Juliaca), ella vende la tan conocida hoja sagrada de los Incas, es decir la hoja de coca. Su puesto es muy concurrido y debido a la carismática forma de vender que tiene, sus clientes siempre se van muy contentos y felices con su compra. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender su producto y terminar con la cantidad prevista. Lleva 8 años en esta actividad y lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin poder salir a ningún lugar. Para el futuro desea hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos, sabe que el camino a sus metas es largo y sacrificado, pero está dispuesta a recorrerlo. Este es el segundo préstamo de Elicia con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en las reuniones. Con los mil quinientos soles solicitados planea comprar más hojas de coca, para aumentar la mercadería que vende normalmente.
texts.en:
Elicia is a very responsible and loving mother to her 3 children: Soledad, age 10, Rosmeri, age 8, and Rodrigo, 11 months. She lives in her own house, and what she wishes for the most is to provide her children with good educations. Her stall is located in the Laguna Temporal esplanade (site where the markets in Juliaca take place). She sells the well-known sacred leaf of the Incas, in other words, coca leaves (typically chewed or brewed like tea). Her stall is very busy and, given her charismatic way of selling, her customers always leave content with their purchases. What she enjoys the most about her work is selling her product, and ending the day with her predicted number of sales. She has been doing this activity for 8 years, and the most difficult part is staying in her stall all day without leaving. For the future, she hopes to grow her business to improve her income. She knows the road to get to her goals is long and will require sacrifices, but she is prepared to take it. This is Elicia’s second loan with MFP, and she knows that she has to make her payments on time. She is a very responsible member of her cooperative bank, and she always enjoys the reunions. She plans to use the 1500 soles she is requesting to buy more coca leaves, so she can increase the amount of product she has to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia  es socia del Bancomunal Juan Pablo II
Silvia es separada tiene 46 años, dos hijos de 14 y 13 años que están en la escuela estatal.
Silvia empezó vendiendo a puerta cerrada, gaseosa y cerveza, después de un año decido abrir su casa poniendo una bodega para esto compro un mostrador, y más mercadería.
Silvia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles para la compra de mercadería para su bodega, gaseosas y productos de belleza. 
Desde que está en Finca aprendió a invertir el dinero que llega a sus manos y a ser puntual con sus pagos.
El sueño de Silvia es poner un spa de uñas y masajes.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the Juan Pablo II cooperative bank. Silvia is separated, 46 years old, and has two children ages 14 and 13 that are in the public school. Silvia started selling sodas and beer behind closed doors. After a year, she decided to open up her house by installing a store in it. For this, she bought a display case and more merchandise. Silvia needs a loan of 1200 soles in order to buy more merchandise for her store, including soft drinks and beauty supplies. Since she started with Finca, she has learned how to invest the money that she gets and to be on time with her payments. Silvia’s dream is to open a spa offering manicures, pedicures and massages.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Silvia needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy merchandise for her store, soft drinks and beauty supplies.

loans.name: Kransi

texts.es:
Kransi es socia del Bancomunal Juan Pablo II
Kransi es soltero tiene 30 años, ha estudiado  mecánica industrial y diseño grafico, empezó su negocio de imprenta industrial grafica alquilando maquinas, alquilo un local en el centro de Lima, tiene dos personas que le ayudan.
Kransi necesita un préstamo de  1200 soles para la compra de insumos de tinta, papel.
Desde que está en Finca Kransi  ha podido capitalizarse, le va mucho mejor, aprendió en este tiempo la puntualidad y eficiencia en el trabajo.  
El sueño de Kransi es tener una editora –grafica.
texts.en:
Kransi is a member of the Juan Pablo II cooperative bank. Kransi is single, 30 years old, and has studied industrial mechanics and graphic design. He started his graphic design printing business with rented equipment and leased space in the center of the city of Lima. He has two assistants. Kransi needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy supplies such as ink and paper. Since he joined Finca, Kransi has been able to capitalize his business, and things are going much better for him. Over this time, he also has learned to be punctual and an efficient worker. Kransi’s dream is to have a graphics editor.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Kransi needs a loan of 1200 to buy supplies such as ink and paper.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María Elena es socia del Bancomunal Juan Pablo II
María  es casada tiene  39 años dos hijos de 14 y 10 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
María vende en su casa gaseosa y cerveza, no le va muy  bien, ha tenido que empezar a vender productos de belleza por catalogo desde hace un año  y le esta yendo bien.  
María necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de productos de belleza por catalogo.
Desde que María está en Finca, siente que es un apoyo por los préstamos, su capital ha crecido y tiene más ventas de sus productos por catalogo.
El sueño de María es crecer más en el negocio, y llegar a tener un puesto en el mercado.
texts.en:
María Elena is a member of the Juan Pablo II community bank. María, 39, is married and has two children ages 14 and 10. The children go to the state school. María sells soft drinks and beer from her home, but it is not going well for her. One year ago she had to start selling beauty products by catalog. This is going well. María needs a loan of 800 PEN to buy beauty products by catalog. Since María has been with Finca she feels that it is supportive with loans. Her capital has grown, and she has more catalog product sales. María’s dream is to grow more in her business and to have a stall in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products by catalog

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana es socia del Bancomunal Fuerza y Poder.
Susana tiene 44 años tres hijos de 15, 10 y 6 años que están en la escuela estatal.
Susana empezó hace diecisiete años atrás con una carreta salía a ofrecer a los vecinos de San Jun a sus servicios de  confección de cortinas por un año, después alquilo en el mercado un puesto  de confecciones de cortinas, es allí donde entra a Finca, actualmente tiene una tienda de confección de cortinas, forros para muebles.  
Susana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de telas para cortinas, rieles, alfombra. 
Desde que está en Finca empezó un nuevo negocio compro motos-taxi, para dar servicio, aprendió la perseverancia en los negocios, para llegar a su meta. 
El sueño de Susana poder dedicarse a dirigir su negocio administrándolo, y tener personal a su cargo.
texts.en:
Susana is a member of the communal bank "Fuerza y Poder." She is 44 years old and has 3 children who are 15, 10, and 6 years old. They all study in the state school. Seventeen years ago, Susana began selling curtains to her neighbors in San Jun by cart. She did this for a year and then rented a place in the market where she could sell her curtains. It is there that she got involved with Finca. Nowadays she has a shop where she sells curtains and furniture covers. Susana needs a loan of 2000 soles to purchase material for curtains, rails, and carpets. Since she has been with Finca, she has started up a new business of buying motorcycles that are used as taxis. She has learned to persevere in business and reach her goals. Susana’s dream is to be able to spend her time directing and managing her business and having employees.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Susana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de telas para cortinas, rieles, alfombra.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria  es socia del Bancomunal Fuerza y Poder.
Victoria es casada tiene 52 años,  cuatro hijos, los tres hijos mayores que son independientes y uno menor de 8 años que va a la escuela estatal.
Victoria se dedica a la venta de fruta, gaseosas y cerveza en la puerta de su casa.   
Victoria necesita 1600 soles, para la compra de gaseosa, aceite, cerveza. 
Desde que está en Finca, aprendió ahorra, los prestamos le ayudan para poder invertir, se siente muy contenta. 
El sueño de Victoria es abrir su tienda.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Fuerza y Poder (“Strength and Power”) cooperative bank. Victoria is married, 52 years old, and has four children. The three oldest are independent, and one younger child who is 8 years old attends public school. Victoria dedicates herself to the sale of fruit, sodas, and beer from the doorway of her house. Victoria needs a loan of 1600 soles to purchase soft drinks, cooking oil, and beer. Since she started with Finca, she has learned how to save. The loans help her to invest and she feels very content. Victoria’s dream is to open her store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Victoria needs 1600 soles to buy soft drinks, cooking oil, and beer.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.es:
Pepe es socia del Bancomunal Fuerza y Poder.
Pepe  es del sur, tiene 33 años. es soltero, estudio  solo hasta primaria porque su mamá falleció, a los 13 años le ofrecieron darle trabajo y se vino a trabajar  para  L. ,  en el Terminal pesquero por varios años, hace dos años una amiga le da ropa a consignación para que venda, actualmente trabaja como cobrador y en la venta de ropa.
Pepe necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de camisas y pantalones de hombre.
Desde que está en Finca su negocio ha mejorado puede comprar más mercadería, ha podido comprarse un terreno en Pamplona.
El sueño pepe es tener una tienda en gamarra.
texts.en:
Pepe is a member of Fuerza y Poder Communal Bank.

Pepe is from the South, 33 years old and single. He only studied up until primary school because his mother died. At 13, he went to L. and worked in the fish market for several years. Two years ago a friend gave him clothing on consignment for him to sell. Now he works as a conductor and also sells clothing.

Pepe needs a loan of 800 soles to purchase men’s shirts and trousers. Since he has been working with FINCA, his business has improved, he can buy more merchandise and he has been able to purchase land in Pamplona.

Pepe dreams of having a shop in Gamarra.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase men's shirts and trousers

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es socia del Bancomunal Fuerza y Poder.
Graciela trabaja con su esposo él es chofer y ella cobra, siempre alquilaban un carro para trabajar, un amigo le ofreció vender una couster de segunda con los ahorros que tenían y con los prestamos lograron comprarla, su esposo es chofer de su couster y ella cobra.  
Graciela necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para el arreglo de su couster.  
Desde que Graciela esta en Finca, puede cubrir sus gastos, ya no corre a los prestamistas que le cobraban 20% de interés, ella se siente más tranquila encuentra un apoyo.  
El sueño de Graciela es comprarse otro carro pero a gas.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the Fuerza y Poder (“Strength and Power”) cooperative bank. Graciela works with her husband, who is a driver, and she does the billing/charges. They always rented a car to work, and a friend offered to sell them a used coaster (a small type of bus). With their savings and some loans, they were able to buy it. Her husband drives the coaster, and she handles the charges. Gabriela needs a loan of 1000 soles to make repairs to the coaster. Since Graciela started with Finca, she is able to cover her expenses and doesn’t have to go to loan sharks that charge her 20% interest. She feels more at peace now that she has found some support. Graciela’s dream is to buy herself another vehicle, but one that runs on gas.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Graciela needs a loan of 1000 soles to make repairs to her coaster bus.

loans.name: Ulices

texts.es:
Ulises es socia del Bancomunal Fuerza y Poder.
Ulices es conviviente tiene 42   años, tres hijos de 22, 9 y  15 años, estos dos últimos están en la escuela estatal.
Ulices trabajo por diez años como transportista, se compro una couster, y  con un grupo de amigos decidió fundar una linea de trasporte, la unidad de villa, actualmente trabaja como chofer en su couster.  
Ulices necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de piezas para su couster y para el mantenimiento.
Desde que está en Finca los préstamos le han sacado de apuros cuando se presentan emergencias con su couster tiene ahorros.
El sueño de Ulices es seguir trabajando para darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ulices is a member of the Fuerza y Poder community bank. Ulices, 42, is in a common law marriage. He has three children ages 22, 9, and 15. The youngest two are in the state school. Ulices worked for ten years as a driver. He bought a “couster” (omnibus) with a group of friends and decided to start a transportation line, La Unidad de Villa. He currently works as a driver in his omnibus. Ulices needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy parts and perform maintenance on his omnibus. Since he has been with Finca, the loans have saved him when he has had predicaments or emergencies with his omnibus because he has savings. Ulices’ dream is to keep working to give his children the best.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy parts and perform maintenance on his omnibus

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita es socia del Bancomunal Fuerza y Poder.
Felicita es casada tiene 44 años, tres hijos de 23, 22 y 16 años este último está estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Felicita estudio tres años cosmetología y curso de especialización, trabajo en una peluquería de su profesora por tres años, después se independizo, alquilo un local hace dos años en el cual ella atiende,  también vende productos de belleza.    
Felicita necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de una vitrina, y de materiales para peluquería, líquidos, tintes.
Desde que está en Finca ha podido poner su negocio, es una ayuda, aprendió a compartir cuando las socias están en necesidades. 
El sueño de Felicita es tener otra peluquería en una zona más comercial.
texts.en:
Felicita is a member of the communal bank "Fuerza y Poder." 44-year-old Felicita is married and has 3 children, ages 23, 22, and 16. Her youngest is a student in the state school. Felicita studied cosmetology for 3 years. She worked in her teacher's beauty shop for 3 years and then struck out on her own. Two years ago, she rented a shop where she also sells beauty products. Felicita needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase a glass display case and beauty supplies, including liquids and coloring. Since she has been with Finca, she has been able to start her own business. She is helpful and shares with other Finca members when they are in need. Felicita's dream is to have another beauty shop in a more commercial area.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Felicita necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de una vitrina, y de materiales para peluquería, líquidos, tintes.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Bancomunal Las Gitanas.
Luisa es separada  tiene 65 años, tres hijos de 38, 34 y  24 años.
Luisa hace dulces kékes, tamales para reuniones especiales y también vende productos de belleza por catalogo.
Luisa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de productos de Belleza por catalogo por el día de la madre.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió ahorrar, le gustan las reuniones, tiene amigas aprende más de negocio.
El sueño de Luisa es salir adelante y viajar al extranjero para ver a su hija, no la ve más de quince años.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of Las Gitanas community bank. Luisa, 65, is separated; she has three children ages 38, 34, and 24. Luisa makes sweet kékes (a typical Peruvian pastry) and tamales for special gatherings. She also sells beauty products by catalog. Luisa needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy beauty products by catalog for Mother’s Day. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned to save. She likes the meetings, she has friends, and she learns more about business. Luisa’s dreams are to get ahead and to travel abroad to see her daughter whom she has not seen for fifteen years.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products by catalog for Mother’s Day.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth es socia del Bancomunal Las Gitanas.
Ruth es casada tiene 63 años, tiene siete hijos todos mayores y están casados.
Ruth desde joven confeccionaba para varias empresas y estos últimos años para ripley dejo de trabajar por que la operaron de la vista y por restricción médica no pudo seguir en el mismo trabajo, se puso a vender productos de belleza por catalogo. 
Ruth necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles,  para la compra de zapatos y la compra de productos de belleza.
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió a ahorrar, a ser responsable, saber valorar el trabajo.  
El sueño de Rut es tener su negocio en su casa, quiere poner un bazar.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of Las Gitanas Communal Bank.

Ruth is 63 years old, married and has 7 grown-up and married children.

Ruth has worked for various companies since she was young, and most recently for Ripley. She stopped working after undergoing eye surgery. Her medical restrictions prevented her from returning to her old job, so she started selling cosmetics by catalogue.

Ruth is requesting a loan of 1400 soles to purchase shoes and cosmetics.
Since she has been with FINCA, she has learned to save, to be responsible, and to value work.

Ruth’s dream is to set up a shop in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es  socia del Bancomunal Las Gitanas.
Gladys es soltera, tiene 52 años no tiene hijos.
Empezó haciendo tortas y ceviches por varios años, llevaba a las oficinas, hasta que se dedico a cocinar para eventos especiales, actualmente tiene una cartera de clientas, también vende ropa y artefactos eléctricos por pedido.  
Gladys necesita un préstamo de 3400 soles, para la compra de ropa por el día de la madre y para la preparación de su  comida.  
Desde que esta en Finca cuenta con más capital para poder invertir, aprendió a administrar su negocio, a invertir y llevar sus cuentas. 
El sueño de Gladys es poner un restaurante pero en el extranjero.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the Las Gitanas community bank. Gladys, 52, is single and has no children. For several years she made cakes and ceviches (citrus marinated seafood) and took them to offices. Then she started cooking for special events. She currently has a portfolio of customers. She also sells clothes and electrical items by order. Gladys needs a loan for 3,400 PEN to buy clothes for Mother’s Day and for food preparation. Since she has been with Finca, she has more capital to be able to invest. She has learned to administer her business, to invest, and to balance her accounts. Gladys’ dream is to open a restaurant abroad.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes for Mother’s Day and for food preparation.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly  es socia del Bancomunal Las Gitanas.
Nelly  es conviviente tiene 56 años un hijo que es mayor y es casado, ella trabajó como   secretaria en una empresa por veinte años hasta que la empresa quebró, puso un negocio de video juegos que funciono por un tiempo, lo cerro  por que se mudo de casa. Nelly   por las mañanas se dedica a la venta de menú y por las tardes trabaja en la agencia de una amiga como vendedora libre de pasajes aéreos y terrestres 
Nelly  necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de  pasajes para venderlos. 
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió a ser puntual en todo sentido y el respeto mutuo.
El sueño de Nelly es llegar a tener una agencia de viajes.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of Bancomunal Las Gitanas. She is 56, lives with her husband, and has one grown son who is married. She worked as a secretary in one firm for 20 years, and when the business failed, she had a video game business that lasted for a time but closed when she moved to another house. Nelly sells meals in the morning, and in the afternoon she works in a friend's agency as an independent seller of air and land tickets. Nelly needs a loan of $350 to buy the tickets so she can sell them. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned to be precise in every way and in mutual respect. Nelly's dream is to have her own travel agency.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tickets for resale

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa es socia del Bancomunal Las Gitanas.
Maria Luisa es casada tiene tres hijos de 13, 9 y 4 años que están estudiando en al escuela estatal.
Maria Luisa empezó a trabajar desde joven a los 17 años el papa de una amiga confeccionaba zapatos y ella empezó vendiéndolos, desde entonces vende zapatos, ahora le traen zapatos de cuero  del norte del país. También ella trabaja en un colegio como profesora.   
Maria Luisa necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles para la compra de zapatos botines, botas. Para venta por el día de la madre.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió administrar su negocio, aprendió a invertir, ahorrar
El sueño de Maria Luisa es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa is a member of Bancomunal Las Gitanas. She is married with 3 children of 13, 9 and 4, all studying in the state school. Maria Luisa started working at 17, selling shoes made by the father of a friend. She has been selling shoes since that time, now they are brought from the north of the country. She also works as a professor in a college. Maria Luisa needs a loan of $475 to buy shoes, ankle boots, and knee boots to sell for Mother's Day. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned how to administrate her business, and how to invest and save. Maria Luisa's dream is to own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes, ankle boots, and knee boots

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia  es socia del Bancomunal Las Gitanas.
Celia es casada tiene 65 años, 4 hijos todos mayores, ninguno en su poder.
Celia empezó vendiendo productos de Belleza  por catalogo,  su hijo empezó con el negocio de venta de ropa en su casa, su hijo se caso y le dejo el negocio hace un año, ahora Celia se dedica ala venta de ropa en su casa.
Celia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de ropa por el día de la madre.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió a ser unida, solidaria con todos los que ella pueda ayudar, le gusta las reuniones por que se distrae, y tiene amigas con las que comparten experiencias. 
El sueño de Celia es viajar a Venezuela a ver a su hija.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of Bancomunal Las Gitanas. She is 65, married, and has 4 grown children, all independent. Celia started selling beauty products by catalog, and her son started a business selling clothing from her home. A year ago the son married and left her the business, and now Celia sells clothing from her home. Celia needs a loan of $350 to purchase clothing for Mother's Day. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned to stay united and supportive of all those whom she can help. She enjoys the meetings because they amuse her and she has friends with whom she can share experiences. Celia's dream is to travel to Venezuela to see her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing to sell for Mother's Day

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabet tiene 32 años, es una madre muy luchadora y responsable, vive en su propia casa junto a sus queridos hijos Néstor de 9 y Karen de 4 meses, desea darles unos buenos estudios, motivo por el cual está dispuesta a trabajar duramente. La compra, crianza y venta de cerdos es el negocio que realiza Elizabeth diariamente, sus cerdos son muy solicitados en las ferias, ya que siempre están bien alimentados y son muy grandes. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana se levanta para darle a sus cerdos el alimento que necesitan para crecer, los cuida con mucho cariño, puesto que sabe que gracias a ellos tendrá el dinero para mantener a su familia. Los 5 años que lleva en este negocio le han dado la experiencia necesaria para realizar un buen trabajo, lo que más le gusta es que al mismo tiempo puede realizar sus labores hogareñas y velar por sus cerdos. Espera más adelante incrementar el número de porcinos que cría, lo más difícil de su trabajo es evitar que sus animales se vayan lejos y se pierdan, sobre todo tiene mucho cuidado con su engreído el chanchito “Bartolomeo” con quien quiso tomarse la foto. Este es tercer préstamo de Elizabet en MFP, en sus anteriores créditos ha sido muy puntual y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada, debido a la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los mil ochocientos soles comprará más comida para sus cerdos, también aprovechará para comprar otros dos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 32 years old and a spirited, responsible mother. She lives in her own home with her dear children, 9-year-old Néstor and 4-month-old Karen. She is willing to work hard to give them a good education.
Elizabeth makes a living purchasing, raising and selling pigs. Her pigs are in high demand in the markets since they are always very big and well-fed. She gets up early every day to feed her pigs what they need to grow. She looks after them with much affection since she knows that thanks to them she’ll have money to support her family. Her 5 years in this business have given her the necessary experience to do her job well.
What she most likes about her work is being able to look after her household while watching over the pigs. In the future, she hopes to raise a larger number of pigs. The most difficult part of her job is keeping her animals from straying too far and getting lost. She especially takes care of her piggy Bartolomeo, who is with her in the photo.
This is Elizabeth’s third loan with MFP; she has made punctual repayments in the past and hopes to continue doing so. She is a well-respected, responsible member of her communal bank. She will purchase more pig feed and two more pigs with the 1800 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: Leticia tiene 29 años, la mayor parte de esos años los ha pasado tratando de mejorar su vida, vive en la casa de sus familiares junto a su única hija Sheyla de 9 años, quien es la motivación de todos sus esfuerzos. Su negocio está ubicado en la explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), los tejidos artesanales que elabora los vende a la gente que concurre a la feria, sus prendas son compradas sobre todo por los turistas, quienes no pierden la oportunidad de llevarse algo típico a sus países. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta e informarse de las cosas que suceden en la feria, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su puesto sin poder salir a ningún lado. Espera tener más adelante una tienda donde pueda vender sus artesanías con más comodidad. Este es el tercer préstamo de Leticia con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y colaboradora. Con los mil quinientos soles solicitados comprará más lana para tejer más artesanías.
texts.en:
Leticia, 29, has spent most of her years trying to improve her life. She lives in the family house with her only daughter, Sheyla, who is nine. Her daughter is the motivation for all of Leticia’s efforts. Leticia’s business is located in the Laguna Temporal plaza (place where they have the markets in the city of Juliaca). She sells the artisan weaving that she makes to the people who go to the market. Tourists primarily buy her garments. They do not miss the opportunity to buy something typical of the country. What she likes best about her work is talking with her neighboring sales people and finding out what has been happening at the market. She has been doing this for eight years. What she likes the least is having to stay all day inside her stall without being able to go anywhere. In the future she hopes to have a store where she can sell her craft work more comfortably. This is her third loan with MFP. Leticia knows that she has to make her payments on time, and she is prepared to do so. She is a happy and cooperative member of her community bank. With the loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy wool to make more craft work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es: Néstor tiene 34 años es un padre muy amoroso y trabajador, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Vilma de 35 años y sus 3 hijos Yliday de 10, David de 7 y Roció de 5 años, a quienes desea dar unos buenos estudios. Pasa su tiempo tejiendo sus artesanías, todos los días se sienta en su máquina y empieza con su labor diaria, la cual aprendió desde muy pequeño de su madre, tiene su puesto de venta en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan las ferias en Juliaca), pero también trabaja a pedido para el país de Bolivia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer, ya que se divierte mucho haciéndolo, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil para él es trasladar su mercadería hasta su puesto, ya que le es muy cansado. Néstor anhela tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender sus artesanías con mayor comodidad. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, en sus anteriores préstamo ha sido muy puntual y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es una socio muy respetado por el orden que le pone al grupo. Con los mil ochocientos soles que solicita planea comprar más lana de todo color, para tejer sus artesanías.
texts.en:
Néstor, 34, is a loving and hard-working father living in his own home with his wife of 35 years, Vilma, and his 3 children, Yliday,10, David, 7 and Roció, 5, whom he desires to give a good education. He spends his time weaving his crafts, every day he sits at his machine and begins his daily labor that he learned from his mother when he was young. He has his sales location in the Explanada Laguna Temporal (the place where the markets are held in Juliaca), but he also works on commission for the country of Bolivia. What he likes the most about his work is the weaving, which he finds very enjoyable and has been doing for 10 years. The hardest part is taking his merchandise to his stand, which is very tiring. Nestor longs to have a larger shop where he can sell his handiwork more conveniently. This is his third loan through MFP, in his previous loans he has been very punctual and he hopes to be so again. He is a very respected member of his communal bank because of the order he brings to the group. With the $625 he is requesting, he plans to buy more wool of various colors in order to weave his crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool

loans.name: Trok

texts.en: Trok S. is 29 years old and resides in the Kampong Cham province. Working a farm together with her husband, Trok S. typically makes US $2 per day. This couple has two young children. Mrs. Trok would like to take out a loan to purchase hand tractor to help plow the land.

loans.use: To purchase hand tractor.

loans.name: Oum

texts.en: Oum N., 49, pictured here with her husband, is married with four children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province. She is a professional tailor and earns US $2.5 per day. Her husband makes US $2 per day as a farmer. The family is also aided by three children who are garment factory workers. Oum would like to take out a loan to buy a sewing machine and purchase a water pump for her husband to irrigate the farmland.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine and water pump

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn S., 47, pictured here with her husband, is married and lives with ten of her children in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband farm together and typically earn US $4 combined each day. Her family is also supported by four of the children who work in a garment factory and three children who are goldsmiths. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Sorn S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US $750 to purchase fertilizers and land to expand cultivation; she believes this investment will increase their daily income.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and land

loans.name: Sann

texts.en: Sann S. is 35 years old and resides with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She makes and sells feed. On average, she earns about US$6 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and makes US$3 per day. This couple has two school-aged children. Sann S. would like to take out a loan to purchase baskets for packing the feed she sells at the market. She will also purchase some materials to make more feed to sell.

loans.use: To purchase baskets in which to pack feed.

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en: Purevsuren M. is 39, married and the mother of three. All her children are attending a local elementary school. Her family lives in a 'ger’ (traditional nomadic tent) district in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia’s central provinces. Together with her husband, she has been running a small cafe since 2002. Her cafe is located in the center of the province and meals are sold at a cheap price. One meal is around $2 USD because local residents cannot spend a lot to eat out. However, she has many repeat clients. Besides running a cafe, she also runs a retail business selling meat. She buys whole animals from the local herders at a wholesale price and cuts them up to resell. Purevsuren is a warm and friendly person who is well respected. She requests a loan to purchase more food products and beverages for her cafe and whole animals to sell the meat. She says "from now on, I will start saving for my two eldest children's future university tuition."

loans.use: to purchase food products and beverages for her cafe.

loans.name: Yean

texts.en: Yean S. is 29 years old and lives in the Kampong Cham province. She stays at home growing vegetables and raising pigs to earn a living. She is able to make US$2.50, combined, per day. Her husband is a cow dealer and makes US$5 every day. This couple has two young children. Yean is asking for a loan to purchase cows for her husband to sell for a profit. (Yean is pictured, with her husband, at home).

loans.use: To purchase cows.

loans.name: Adyabaatar

texts.en: AdyaB. B. is 32, married and the father of two daughters. His eldest daughter goes to a local elementary school. His family lives in a "ger" (traditional nomadic tent) district in UlaanB., the capital city of Mongolia. In 2002 he began to transport food products for stall owners at "Bars", the biggest vegetable wholesale market in UlaanB.. His average monthly income is 700,000 tugrugs ($1 USD=1,400 MNT), average profit is 300,000 tugrugs. His wife, Bolortuya, works at a local grocery store as a saleswoman. With their savings, they bought a plot of land last fall and built a little house by themselves. AdyaB. has also bought a better second hand car. He requests a loan to buy tires and other spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy tires and other spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly D., 61, pictured here with her daughter, is a widow who lives with one of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She grows rice and sells grocery items from her home. On average, she earns a combined income of about US$2 per day. She is also supported by her daughter, who sells fish in the market. Ly is asking for a loan to purchase more fish for her daughter to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Neth

texts.en: Neth S., 49, pictured here with her husband, is married and lives with her seven children in the Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who works for less than US$3 each day. Her husband works as a fisherman, making US$4 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Neth S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$600 to pay the fishing fee to the fisheres department. In Cambodia, to fish at the river, fishermen need to pay a fishing fee to the government.

loans.use: To pay the government fishing fee.

loans.name: Badamtsetseg

texts.en: Badamtsetseg L., 45, is married and the mother of three. Her family lives in a "ger" (traditional nomadic tent) district on the plot of land she owns in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her youngest two children are attending an elementary school. In 2001, she opened a booth to sell food products next to her little house. As a result of her businesses growth, her booth has developed into a grocery store. Her working capital is now 2 million tugrugs, average daily income is 100,000 tugrugs and average monthly profits from grocery store are 350,000 tugrugs. ($1 USD=1400 MNT). She works as a saleswoman at her store and her children help when she goes to the market to buy food. Badamtsetseg's husband, Vasil, has been working in the Czech Republic for the last four years, and sends $200 US home every month. It is common in Mongolia for people to go to the Czech Republic to find a better paying job. She has opened bank accounts for her children's future university tuition and deposits the money from her husband into them. Badamtsetseg also has another source of extra income. She rents a small house on the plot of land she owns for 50,000 tugrugs a month. With this loan, she will buy food products to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy food products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Ros N., 58, is a fish seller in the local market of Kampong Cham province. She typically makes US$2.50 per day. She has three children, one is a student, another is a garment factory worker and the other is a mechanic. Her husband, Mok Noo, 50, is a farmer and makes US$2 every day. Ros N. is asking for a loan to purchase more fish from fishermen to sell at the market. (Ros is pictured with her husband and her grandson).

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van L., 39, makes and sells rice wine in the local market of Kampong Cham province. She typically makes US$5 per day and is aided by her husband, who raises pigs. On average, he makes US$7 in revenue a day. This couple has two children, both in school. Van L. needs a loan of US$1000 to purchase pigs and pig feed. She is an ambitious entrepreneur who hopes one day to set up a grocery store in front of her home. She sees this loan as a way to increase her income and is confident that her business venture will be successful.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Munhbazar

texts.en:
Munhbazar A. is 45, married and the father of one child. His family lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In 2004, Munhbazar started working as a self-employed taxi driver. After two years, he started working at a local spare parts market as a salesman. His monthly salary is 200,000 tugrugs ($1 USD=1,400 tugrugs) and is not enough to cover his family's needs.

Munhbazar runs a retail business as well as working as a salesman. He buys car batteries and tries to resell them for a better price. His average monthly income from car batteries is 600,000 tugrugs. With this loan, he would like to buy more car batteries to increase his business inventory and monthly income. Munhbazar's dream is to have his own stall to sell spare parts.

loans.use: To buy car batteries

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Oyun P. is 49, a widow and the mother of two. Her husband died ten years ago. A few years after her loss, she lost her eldest son too. Her eldest daughter is married and lives with her own family. Oyun lives with her youngest son (whose name is Batsuren) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 
Oyun is a professional tailor and was working at a sewing factory till 2004. In 2004, she decided to quit her job and started running a tailoring business. She rented a place to work, hired two tailors and bought the necessary equipment. Now her business has stabilized. Her average monthly income is 900,000 tugrugs a month ($1 USD=1,400 tugrugs), and her average profit is 300,000 tugrugs. She is planning to expand her tailoring business by renting a bigger place and hiring two more employees. With this loan she will repair her sewing machines.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Soeung

texts.en: Soeung Y., 45, lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband and four children. She makes about US$1.60 daily, growing and selling vegetables, while her husband makes US$1.50 as a horse cart driver. She is asking for a loan in the amount of US$1000 to purchase fertilizers and land to expand her cultivation. She is also hoping to purchase pigs to raise and sell with the money from the loan. She sees this loan as a great opportunity to expand her business and is confident that she will see her income increase as a result.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and land.

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un E., 56, is a widowed farmer who lives with her two children in the Kampong Cham province. Besides farming, she also sells porridge in the local market. On average, she makes a combined income of US$2 daily. She is also supported by her children, who are working. One of her children is a garment factory worker, the other is a goldsmith.  Un E. is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her son to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Tsolmontuya

texts.en: Tsolmontuya D. is 33 years old and has a 5 year-old daughter. Her family, including her daughter, mother and sisters live in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She is a professional nurse, however she has recently been running a retail business. She rents food stalls at the "Bunbugur" local food market and sells many types of desserts such as candy, biscuits, fruit syrup, and chocolate. Her working capital is 3 million tugrugs ($1 USD=1,400 MNT), and her average monthly income is 7 million tugrugs. With her profit, she has bought a plot of land and built a little house. She requests a loan to buy food products to increase her business inventory. One of her sisters helps in her business and operates the stall when Tsolmontuya goes to a wholesale market to buy food products.

loans.use: To buy food products for her desserts market stall.

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en: Tungalag Z., 23, is a married mother of one child. Her family lives in a "ger" (traditional nomadic tent) district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Tungalag is a professional barber. She has been renting a small space north of town to run a barber shop. Her average daily income is 20,000 tugrugs (1 USD=1,400 MNT). Half of her income goes towards her rental fee. Even though the price of a haircut is very low in her area, she compensates by having many repeat clients. Her hope is to save little by little and then to open her own beauty salon in ten years. Her husband, Batbayar, is a self-employed photographer. Tungalag requests a loan to buy a hair dryer, hair iron and other necessary supplies for her business.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer, iron and other necessary hair supplies for her business

loans.name: Thuch

texts.en: Thuch S., 44, pictured with her husband, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province. She has been growing and selling rice since 2003 and is able to make US$7 per day. Her husband is a farmer and often provides rice for her to sell at the market. The couple has three children: one is a student and two are garment factory workers. Thuch S. would like to take out a loan to purchase a horse and a cart, so that she can transport rice to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and a cart

loans.name: Suren

texts.en: Suren D. is married but currently is living with her parents and two infant children in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her 5-year-old daughter goes to a local kindergarten and her 2-year-old daughter stays at home with her grandparents. Suren started a small cafeteria in December 2008 to support her family. She rents a small cafeteria space in the town inside the local shopping mall and serves lunch and dinner. She started the business with help from her five siblings and, in less than six months, her business capital has increased from 500,000 MNT (1 USD=1,400 MNT) to 3,000,000 MNT. As her business expands, she needs more working capital to meet the demand for her food service. She requests a loan to purchase necessary ingredients for her food business.

loans.use: To purchase necessary ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Tsendsuren

texts.en:
Tsendsuren T. is 18 years old and lives with her brother in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Tsendsuren has a small retail business selling religious articles. The religious products are mostly of Buddhist origin. The main religion in Mongolia is Buddhism. Mongolia reclaimed its Buddhist religion after the collapse of the Soviet Union in the 1990s. Under the control of the Soviet Union, Buddhism was banned. Buddhism quickly regained its popularity in the last two decades.

Tsendsuren started her business in 2003 by selling religious products to locals. She travels to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and purchases religious articles from Gandantegchilen Monastery, the largest and most popular monastery in Ulaanbaatar. Since the start, her business capital has increased from 500,000 ($1 = 1,400 MNT) to 2,000,000 MNT. Her motto in business is an old Mongolian proverb, "If one works hard, destiny follows." She requests a loan to purchase more religious products from Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: To purchase religious products from Ulaanbaatar

loans.name: Zorigtbaatar

texts.en:
Zorigtbaatar G. lives with his wife and three daughters in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Two of his children are high school students and the youngest daughter goes to a local kindergarten. Zorigtbaatar has a small business making traditional shoes. His wife supports and helps his shoe-making business. He has been making traditional winter and spring shoes for women and men since 1992.

Since the start, his business capital has increased from 100,000 MNT ($1 = 1,400 MNT) to 1,000,000 MNT. He hopes to expand his business even more by hiring one or two more employees. Zorigtbaatar and his wife work very hard to make sure that all their daughters receive a good education and go to the universities of their choice. He requests a loan to purchase raw materials, such as leather and glue, for his shoe-making business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials, such as leather and glue

loans.name: Hajra M. Rasheed Group

texts.en:
Hajra baji is a 55-year-old citizen of Lahore, Pakistan, where she has lived for the past 26 years. Her husband's name is M. R. and he works in a factory for a monthly wage. He has five years of experience in this business. She is the mother of three sons. Her elder son is 29 and runs a scrap business. The next to him is an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver and her younger son runs a tea stall. Hajra baji runs a grocery shop in the community. She has two years of experience in this business. She saves her income to marry off her elder son. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries to expand her grocery shop.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for hauling. Lubna baji and Farzana baji each want a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell. Asia baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery shop

loans.name: Mumtaz Riaz Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz baji is the wife of R. M. and they have lived in the city of Lahore, Pakistan for 10 years.  Mumtaz baji says that she is not well educated because she didn’t pay as close attention to her studies as she did to knitting and sewing clothes, a skill which she learned from her mother.  Mumtaz baji is the mother of three sons and all of her children are enrolled in the local neighborhood school.  Mumtaz baji pays their school fees from the money she earns from her knitting business. Her husband runs a sanitary supplies selling business and has done so for 10 years now.  Mumtaz baji successfully repaid her first two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now she is applying for a loan to buy sanitary supplies like pipes and taps to help expand her husband’s sanitary business.

Mumtaz baji is the leader for this group loan which includes four other women from her locality.  The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  Bushra begum baji wants a loan to buy and sell sand. Safia baji will buy more products for her grocery store.  Nasreen baji plans to replace the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle), and Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business.  The members of a group loan mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy sanitary supplies like pipes and taps.

loans.name: Khursheed Zulfiqar Masih Group

texts.en:
Khursheed baji is a 55-year-old married mother of two who has lived in the city of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 35 years. Her husband is named Z. M. and he runs a small hotel in the community, where he also sells Punjabi foods.  He has 6 years of experience in this business.  Khursheed baji helps her husband by cooking Punjabi foods.  And the hotel is known for its delicious foods!  Khursheed baji has a son who earns income as an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver and her daughter currently studies in the 7th standard.  Khursheed baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and now she is applying for another loan to replace the body of her son's auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Khursheed baji is the leader for this group loan which includes three other women from her locality. The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  Shamshad baji will use the loan to buy religious books for her book shop, Razia baji needs a loan to repair the engine of her vehicle (named “Shahzore”), and Irshad begum baji plans to buy a welding machine.  The members of a group loan mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To replace the body of an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.name: Ruqaiya M. Akbar Group

texts.en:
Ruqaiya baji is an uneducated woman from Lahore, Pakistan, a city famous for its historical places and Punjabi foods.  She has been a part of this city for the past 25 years. Her husband is named M. A. and he runs a dairy business. He has been in this business for 10 years.  Ruqaiya baji helps him milk the two buffalo.  Their eldest son also works with them, while the other two sons are enrolled in the local school and are getting an education.  Ruqaiya baji is applying for a loan so they can buy another buffalo to expand their dairy business. 

Ruqaiya baji is the leader for this group loan which includes four other women from her locality. The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  Bushra baji wants a loan to repair her Shahzore rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle), Irshad begum will buy garments to sell, and Nasreen baji plans to buy a molding machine. Hajran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.  The members of a group loan mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to expand their dairy business.

loans.name: Nathan's Group

texts.en: K. Nathan is a hard-working gentleman who is married with 10 children. Seven of the children are out of school and doing their own businesses while Nathan pays school fees for three children and two grandchildren. Nathan has a store in Mityana from where he sells produce like beans, maize, and ground nuts which he buys from farmers in the villages and sells to shops and other traders in the town center. He has been able to win a number of customers, therefore making profits that have enabled him to care for his family, pay his children’s school fees and increase stock in his store as well as being able to repay back his loan on time. After paying off his previous loan, Nathan needs another loan to help with buying more produce for his store.

loans.use: Buying more produce for his store to sale

loans.name: Sohibnazar

texts.ru:
Сохибназар Чуманазаров проживает в городе Истаравшане. Занимается животноводческой деятельностью.  
 Стаж работы Сохибназара в этой сфере 15 лет. У Сохибназара дома есть дойные коровы, молоко которых перерабатывает и продает  его жена Замира. Сохибназар хочет получить займ в размере 400 сомони на 6 месяцев, и потратить его для закупа одного быка.
texts.en:
Sohibnazar C. lives in the city of Istaravshan. He is involved in animal husbandry and has 15 years of experience in this business. Sohibnazar owns dairy cows. His wife Zamira processes and sells the milk. Sohibnazar wants to obtain a 6-month loan in the sum of 400 somoni to be used for the purchase of a bull.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Feruza

texts.ru: Косимова Феруза-молодая женщина 28-ми лет,замужем,имеет 1-го ребенка.Она занимается розничной продажей детской одежды и игрушек.В месяц 2 раза Фируза ездит за товаром в город Истаравшан,где расположен оптовый рынок.Сейчас начало летнего сезона,поэтому она решила взять кредит и расширить свой ассортимент.Также Феруза копит деньги для открытия новой торговой точки,где будет торговать её муж.Более 2-х лет Фируза кредитуется в нашей организации и благодарна нашим кредиторам за поддержку её бизнеса.
texts.en:
Feruza K. is young 28-year-old woman, who is married and has one child. She is involved in retail sales of children’s clothing and toys. Twice per month, Feruza travels for her goods to the city of Istaravshan, where a wholesale market is located. With the summer season starting now, Feruza decided to obtain a loan and expand her goods assortment. Feruza is also saving money in order to open a new store for her husband to run. Feruza has been a working with our organization for over 2 years and is grateful to our creditors for supporting her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of goods assortment

loans.name: Aegamnazar

texts.ru:
Эгамназар Абдуназаров работает водителем автобуса по маршруту Саримсолик-Истаравшан. Родился он в 1961 году, в семье рабочих, по национальности таджик,получил среднее оброзование.Женат, отец 3 детей. 
 Животноводство для Эгамназара, является дополнительным источником доходов в его семье. В свободное от работы время, он посещает рынок и присматривается к домашнему скоту, для того чтобы купить, откормить, и снова его продать. От этого бизнеса он имеет достаточную прибыль, чтобы содержать семью. В этой сфере деятельности ему помогают его жена и дети.
  Стаж работы в животноводстве у Эгамназара 18 лет.
  Он обратился в наш Фонд за поддержкой, так как нуждается в сумме 1200 сомони. Полученый займ планирует потратить на откорм скота.
texts.en:
Aegamnazar A. works as a bus driver on the Sarimsolik-Istaravshan route. He was born into a working family in 1961. He has a secondary education. He is married and a father of three children. Animal husbandry is Aegamnazar’s secondary business that supplements his family’s income. In his free time, he visits a market and picks livestock that he wants to buy, feed and then sell. This business brings in enough profit to support his family. Aegamnazar’s wife and children are also involved in the business. Aegamnazar has 18 years of experience in the animal husbandry field. He reached out to MicroInvest for support because he needs a sum of 1200 somoni. He plans to use this loan for livestock feed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feed

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra O. has been tilling land ever since she was just a small kid. She is 33 years old with three children. She wants to send all her children to school until college, so that when they are older they will be employed and support their future families.

She is requesting a small loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will buy fertilizer to increase her yield. Sandra is hoping that someday she will be able to buy new lots. In that way, she could have a bigger harvest to support the educational needs of her children.

CEVI is helping Sandra to grow her business. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and farm needs

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia L. is a rice grower. She is 49 years old and has four children. Her husband, Lito L., is also a farmer. Together they want to provide a better life for their children. She helps her husband manage their small rice field. Their harvest is intended for family consumption while the rest is sold to rice traders in their village.

She is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase sacks of Urea fertilizer and other farming needs. The loan will help her increase her yield. At some point, Lucia will be able to support the schooling of her kids because she is planning to venture into another business. 

CEVI aims to help small business to grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy Urea fertilizer and other farming needs

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro M. manages a small rice field. He tills the land that his wife owns. He is 36 years old and the father of three children. In the past, he worked as a collector. He got only a small compensation for his work. That is why, when he got married to Eden M., his wife, he decided to manage and take care of the rice field to feed and clothe his family. 

He is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides, The loan will help a lot to achieve maximum yield from his farm. Pedro is also growing other crops for their other needs.

CEVI is reaching out to more people, especially the poor, to start and have a business. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Enh-Amgalan

texts.en:
Enh-Amgalan B. is a 42 year old widow with three children, who are ages 3, 7, and 21. Her youngest two children are attending a kindergarten, and the eldest daughter is working in South Korea. It is common in Mongolia to go to South Korea for a better paying job.

Her family lives in her brother's condominium in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In 2002, Enh-Amgalan started selling men's and women's shoes at the Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. Her eldest daughter helps her mother, brother, and sister as much as she can by sending a small amount of money from her salary every month.

With this loan, Enh-Amgalan is planning to buy more shoes to increase her business inventory. Her hope is to have her own place to live and she is working hard to buy a home. She also dreams of seeing her children graduate from university.

loans.use: To purchase more men's and women's shoes.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo S. is a farmer. His main crop is rice. All his five children help him on his farm. He wants to grow his business even more in order to support the needs of his family. Rice is a commodity and most of his harvest is sold to rice traders, while only some is saved for family consumption. Leonardo believes that someday, he will be able to buy additional lots to farm.

He now needs a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds. The loan will really help him increase his income.

CEVI aims to help small businesses to grow. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 45 years old and already a widow. Her husband passed away in 2006 and she was left with their two children. Her daughter Cheryl is a 17 year old second-year college student and Maricris is a 15 year old high school student. They live in Barangay San Rafael (Cabisera 17-21) Ilagan, Isabela, a rural and mountainous village.

Rosita manages a school canteen during school days and sells snacks in their village on weekends and during summer. She has been in this business for six years and still aiming to make it grow to save for her children's education and family needs.

She is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000 to improve her vending business by purchasing raw materials needed to make snacks and cook food to sell in the village. According to her, she could achieve her goals in life by being patient and industrious. She knows that God will remain by her side to guide her and her family in reaching their dreams in life.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to make snacks and cook food.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena M. says that every individual aims to have a successful life. She is a 48 year old single mother to her three children. They live in Barangay Rizal, Santiago City. Her children are Evelyn, a 28 year old college graduate; Christ John, who is 26 years old; and Rafael, who is 24 years old. Two of her children failed to finish their college educations due to a lack of financial resources.

Elena has been managing a rice farming business for ten years. At present, she is seeking financial assistance in order to maintain her farm. She hopes that lenders will entrust her with a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers, insecticide, and seed variety. She hopes to have a better yield for her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticide, and seed variety.

loans.name: Baby Jane

texts.en:
Baby Jane is married to Dominador from Aguinaldo Cordon, Isabela. The couple is thankful because they are blessed with two children. Mey-Ann is 6 years old and Shikinah is 2 years old.

She is hoping for a loan for PHP 4,000 for the improvement of her hog raising business. She hopes that through the assistance of lenders, she will be able to develop her small business. She also wants to venture into another business to have an alternative source of income. Since her children are still young, Baby Jane and her husband are starting to save something for their education and hope that they will attend through college.

loans.use: To improve her hog raising business.

loans.name: Marie Joy

texts.en:
Marie Joy R. is 22 years old and striving hard to have a progressive life. She and her husband Edgar were gifted with two children. Edmar is 6 years old and Desyrie is 6 months old. Marie Joy's chosen business is vending snacks, such as peanuts, banana cue, and vegetables. She is also a hog raiser in their village.

According to her, all her efforts and sacrifices are for her children. She hopes to give them a progressive life in the future. For her to fulfill her plans, she is requesting a loan for PHP 4,000 for the improvement of her enterprise.

loans.use: To expand her hog raising business.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a hog raiser in the village of Barangay Aguinaldo Cordon, Isabela. She is married to Ricardo G. Jr. and they have eight children: Remalyn - 28 years old; Carmelita - 26 years old; Marie Joy - 22 years old; Jonard - 19 years old; Margie - 17 years old; Richard -10 years old; Rowena - 8 years old and Ariana - 7 years old. The five older children are all high school graduates, while the younger three are still in grade school.

Merly needs additional working capital to maintain her hog raising business. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.use: To buy hog feed

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is a hog raiser in her village and also sells vegetables. She is 52 years old. Pacita is happily married to Trifilo and has four children, who are all married. She is thankful that her husband is helping her maintain the hog raising business. Since she lacks capital, she would like to borrow 5,000 PHP from the lenders. This loan will be of great assistance in improving her small businesses to help meet their needs.

loans.use: Capital for hog raising and vegetable vending businesses

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza M. is 48 years old and married to Armando M. Sr., a farmer in their village. Aside from farming, she also has a tailoring business but, since she has few customers, her focus is on the farm, which is their main source of income. The couple is thankful they have been blessed with five children: Arlee - 30 years old, college graduate; Armando Jr. - 27 years old, also a college graduate; Jefferson - 25 years old, high school graduate; Phelipo - 21 years old, and the youngest is Emmanuel - 20 years old, fourth year college student.

Eliza wants her youngest son to finish his studies and she and her husband are doing their best to send him to school. She is hoping for a loan of 12,000 PHP for farm maintenance. This couple is doing their best to support their family. Eliza always prays for God’s blessing in their life.

loans.use: For farm maintenance

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Sacrifice and discipline help Julita B. fulfill her dreams. She is 45 years old and married to Jose B. of Rizal Santiago City. The couple lives happily with their two children: Gorge - 28 years old and Precy - 25 years old, who are both high school graduates. This couple is in the rice farming business in their simple village. Julita and her husband have maintained their farm for about 20 years and this has served as their major source of income. Julita hopes to borrow 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seed varieties for their rice farm.

To generate additional income to meet their daily needs, Julita has decided to manage a direct selling business. This type of second business will allow Julita to continue to help her husband with their farming activities. She hopes that this loan will create a good opportunity for her family to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Diana Grace

texts.en:
Diana Grace V., a 22-year-old entrepreneur in the village of St. Tomas Saguday, Quirino, operates a small community-based store called a “sari-sari.” Married to Marloue V., a village farmer, they have one child, Arvie, who is 4 years old. Diana Grace wants to save funds for Arvie’s future education by patiently improving her little business.

She is requesting a loan from ASKI for PHP5,000.00 to purchase more store items in order to meet customer demand and increase her profits. With an increased income, she will be able to provide for the needs of her family and give them a higher standard of living. Through sacrifice and patience in life, Diana Grace believes that God will make a way to help her attain all of her goals in life.

loans.use: To purchase more items for her store.

loans.name: 01-Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
"Đông Ngô Thị, a 56 year-old resident of Thanh Hoá, is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 01-Đông Hải (16-04-01).

Đông, married with two adult children, raises livestock. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Đông has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 1.200.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Đông joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Đông has repaid a previous loan of 1.626.900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women that was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell, and she is now requesting a new loan of 1.626.900 VND to be used for the same prupose. The loan will be her third from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Đông plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Ngô Thị Sâm is a 54-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

2. Lê Thị Kỳ is a 48-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her fishing business.

3. Ngô Thị Tính is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her fishing business.

4. T. Thị Thơm is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

5. Lê Thị Lý is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

6. N. Thị Lý is a 48-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raiseand sell in future.

loans.name: Nonina

texts.en:
Most residents of Barangay Rizal City in Santiago earn their living by rice farming. Nonina, a resident of this town, is 44 years old, married and has two children: John Lexter, 18 years old, who is in his second year of college and Anjenette, who is 16 years old and will enter college next year. Nonina is a very grateful because her faith has helped her overcome many trials. 

Nonina makes a living running a village store, while her husband grows rice and raises fish. Nonina has applied for a loan to buy more items to sell from her store, which is 13 years old and which she would like to expand. The increased income made possible by the loan will allow her to pay for her cildren's education.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell from her store.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 37 years old and makes a living running a small general store. She is married to Abner M. and has three children: Janice, 16, Jerwin, 14 and Jennelyn, 8. Her children are all in school: the oldest is in college, while the two younger ones are in primary school.
