She hopes to continue generating income from her business as a way of giving her children a better future.

Susan has run her store for almost two years. She would like to expand it, but lacks capital to buy more products. If she could expand her store, she could also increase her income and provide a better life for her family. Susan has applied for this loan to buy more items that will satisfy her customers’ demands. She would be very thankful if this loan is granted, and will not waste the opportunity it will give her to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Perseverance and love of business are the keys to success, says Norma M.. She is 57 years old and married to Solomon, a farmer in their village. She has two children: Carlos, 39 and Gina, 32. They are both high school graduates. Norma has applied for this loan to improve her family's farm. Planting season is fast approaching and she is hoping to use the loan to expand her crop and generate additional income that will improve her family's life.

loans.use: To improve her family's farm

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine G. makes a living raising pigs in the village of St. Tomas in Saguday, Quirino. This is her family's main source of income, and she would like to expand her small business by buying more feed. She hopes this loan will make her business grow, increase her profits and allow her to provide for the educational needs of her children.

Josephine is 40 years old and married to Silvino G.. The couple has been blessed with five children: Jocelyn who just graduated from high school; Julius, Joven, and Joel, who are currently in high school: and Jayson, presently in elementary school. Josephine hopes to support her children through college, but a lack of money may hinder her ability to do this. She believes that through patience and hard work, she has a chance to attain her goals in life, and believes in the saying, “do your best and God will do the rest”.

loans.use: To expand a small livestock business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie S. lives in Barangay (village) St. Tomas of Saguday, Quirino Province. She makes a living raising pigs in her backyard. Rosalie is 40 years old and married to Alex S.. They have been blessed with six children, two of whom are married. The other four -- Loveline, Erwin, Betty Rose, and Rose Ann -- are still in school. The couple always does its best to meet the needs of their children, especially their educational needs. 

Rosalie's pig-raising business is her family's sole source of income. She has applied for a loan to improve this business, increase her profits and make her livestock company more productive. She hopes that through her sacrifices and hard work, and support from lenders, her family's poor living conditions will improve.

loans.use: To expand a small livestock business

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a woman of strong determination. She wants to give her family a better standard of living. She is 29 years old and married to Joji, a tricycle (three-wheeled vehicle) driver. They are blessed with two children. The eldest is Jeana Jodel, 8 years old and studying in primary school. The second is Dan Justine, 4 years old. Adelaida is happy with her children and does not have any plans of having another one due to the economic situation. With their simple livelihood, Adelaida is aiming for a successful life someday.

She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 6,000 to be used for the maintenance and repair of their passenger tricycle. She hopes that her loan will be granted since the school year is fast approaching and they have to save for their child's school allowance.

loans.use: Maintenance and repair of motorcycle

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a resident of San Rafael (Cabisera 17-21), Ilagan, Isabela. She is 34 years old and married to Reynaldo, a farmer. They have two children, Erwin, 16 years old, a college ,and Reymar, 5 years old, already in the primary level.

Evangeline is engaged in a sari-sari store business (a community-based store). She sells different commodities that are needed in every household and she also sells vegetables that she displays in front of her store. With her need for business capital, she decided to request a loan of PHP 10,000. She plans to purchase more groceries for her store and piglets for a hog-raising business. She dreams that someday her two children will finish their studies and have a good future. She always keep in mind these words “If others can, why can’t I?”, as her motivation to work hard for her family.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 50 years old. She is engaged in a community-based store (called “sari-sari” store). Her husband Jose C. is engaged in a rice-farming business. They both work hard to combat the hardships of life. The couple has been blessed with four healthy children. Their three oldest children are all married. Their youngest, Eugene, is 21 years old and currently living with them.

Yolanda's daily income from managing her general store and the income of her husband from farming are not sufficient to provide for their daily needs, said Yolanda. That’s why she would like to expand her store. For this, she is asking for loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 4,000. It will be used to purchase more products to sell to her customers. Yolanda strives for the development of her business, and hopes that someday her business will grow, for the future welfare of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more products for re-sale

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia runs a small village store in St.Tomas Saguday, Quirino Province. She wishes to make it grow so it will be more profitable, but she doesn’t have enough capital to increase her store’s inventory. She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more supplies for her store so business will improve. Amelia patiently maintains her store so she is able to contribute to the financial support of her family. Her family’s main source of income comes from their farm which is maintained by her husband.

Amelia is 44 years old, and married to Bernabe A., Sr. The couple is blessed with four children; Bernabe A. Jr., 21 years old and a high school graduate; Ricky, 19 years old, also a high school graduate, followed by Roselyn, 10 years old and in grade school; the youngest is Julie-Anne, 5 years old.

Amelia hopes to improve their current standard of living and prays to be able to send her two youngest children to college in the future, since the two elder children were not able to complete their studies due to life’s difficulties. With the loan she will able to provide for the needs of her children. The loan will help her attain her life’s goals.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for re-sale
